story:
Hi, we’re the Austin Museum of Digital Art: a nomadic nonprofit arts organization based in Austin, TX. We’ve been working at the intersection of art and digital technology for nearly two decades. Founded in 1997, AMODA’s mission is to chronicle and promote this still emerging medium through dynamic showcases, performances, screenings and exhibits. We are a part of a vibrant Central Texas art community, often partnering with other organizations in Austin such as the Thinkery, the Contemporary (formerly the Austin Museum of Art), the Church of the Friendly Ghost, Emergency Response Cinema, Nerd Nite, and SXSW Interactive.

IT’S TIME

This is our first crowdfunding campaign and we believe that it’s necessary because we’re attempting a new and ambitious offering: a month-long gallery exhibition in the Canopy art space in East Austin along with related talks, performances and screenings. This exhibit will include work from some of the most exciting new media, Net Art, digital animation, and interactive artists in Texas and beyond.



THE WIDE INTER-CONSCIOUSNESS

We will be highlighting artists whose work transcends technology, opting for a more pure expression. Instead of merely commenting on the medium, the artists in this exhibit use digital tools to speak to the human condition.  Their work explores a wide range of themes: dreams, parallel universes, belief systems, imagined histories, altered states of consciousness, intense nostalgia, and the disorganized and surreal nature of our everyday lives.


WHY WE NEED YOU

This show requires a long list of expenses including: venue rental, equipment rental, installation materials, gear purchases, travel costs, artist honorariums, fabrication, printing, and much more. These expenses far exceed the scope of our annual budget and this show simply won’t be possible without your support. This exhibit has been in the planning stages for awhile and we need your support to make it a reality. In order to make this show what we envision, we’ll need to raise at least $7000 from this crowdfunding campaign. This will be combined with all of our remaining grant money for the current fiscal year.

Our goal is to make this event free and open to the public. We are planning to maintain regular, daily gallery hours so that everybody can visit at their convenience.


INCENTIVES

We are offering some really interesting perks such as t-shirts, posters, original 3D printed art by artist Scott Gelber, an exciting compilation of music produced in the state by hard-working Texas artists, a light-sensitive glass jar synth from artist Kyle Evans, as well as other amazing offerings! Check out the sidebar for details.

Check out our new 2015 tshirt. Yours for a $35 donation!

This amazing light-sensitive jar synth by sound artist, Kyle Evans, of Limited Hangout, is yours for a $125 donation:


Hashtag Jesus, original 3d printed pendant by Scott Gelber, for a $125 pledge:



WHY AUSTIN NEEDS AMODA

Now is the time for an exhibit of digital art such as this. Austin is at a critical point in the maturity of its digital art scene. In larger cities, there are organizations such as Eyebeam, Harvestworks, and Ars Electronica that drive the dialogue about this medium in those regions and internationally. We believe this show positions AMODA to play a similar role in the Central Texas region, especially given our long history as a committed part of this scene with an unwavering focus on digital art.

This exhibit is a re-awakening, an opening salvo, a jumping off point, and an opportunity to push past the commonly held notions about digital art, film and music so that it can take its proper place in the larger Texas art community. We are an all volunteer arts organization. This means that the handful of devoted people working within our organization somehow find the time and energy to produce this programming in addition to working our full-time jobs. It’s not easy, but we strongly believe in AMODA’s mission, which seems more relevant than ever!


We feel that the content of this exhibit represents something that’s been missing in the art conversation in Austin and AMODA is uniquely qualified to deliver such a show. We need your help to make it happen though.

GET INVOLVED

Please contribute and share our campaign page with friends and colleagues! A short link on Facebook, Twitter, tumblr, Instagram, or your new home-brew social app for jailbroken Blackberries will go a long way.

We are also looking for new volunteers to assist with this production and other events throughout the year. Contact us at volunteer@amoda.org.



For more information about AMODA, find us at: 
http://www.amoda.org/ 
https://www.facebook.com/amoda.org 
https://twitter.com/AMODA_org 

Or contact us directly at info@amoda.org.

Thanks to the Austin Film Society for their support of this AMODA project
www.austinfilm.org/

story:
REMEMBER!  The Forgotten Horrors After Katrina

Among the earliest casualties of the flood of New Orleans was "Truth" !  Its'  body is laying buried in some unmarked, shallow grave. Who will speak for Katrina's voiceless, her missing, her dead?

As we approach the tenth anniversary of the flood, the New Orleans Marketing Corporation will continue spending millions of dollars advertising and promoting the city’s re-birth.  A new New Orleans has arisen from the ashes bearing almost no  semblance to the old but rather, more to an adult Disney Land.  The buzz words and phrases are putting all emphasis on the new and closing the book on what was before.  New Orleans is now a city of festivals, not unlike miniature Mardi Gras.  Every day there is a festival or two running simultaneously, contributing to an aura of frivolity, mirth and merry-making. 

In the weeks leading up to the August 29th anniversary of the flood, don't expect to hear much about the tens of thousands of former inhabitants who are strewn throughout these United States.  The post Katrina architects were neither interested nor intended to include the former citizens in  the making of the new New Orleans.   During the planning stage, one of city's most celebrated visionaries even stated, "we must import a new middle class".  And so they did, giving no thought to the missing citizens who are still unaccounted for.

New Orleans was once said to be “the city that care forgot”.   Conversely, the post Katrina New Orleans has proved to be “the city that forgot to care”.  

Art for Truth & Remembrance, Art as Social Commentary

Since the waters were pumped from the city, there has been virtually nothing done to account for the missing who number in the thousands.  Should not there be a reckoning of those who are absent?  Do they not deserve to be accounted for? Who will speak for the voiceless, those still missing, and the unknown thousands who died, were killed or sacrificed.   


Beverly Kimble Davis

Native New Orleanean, Beverly Kimble Davis, has taken up the challenge.  She is a Hurricane Katrina artist who uses her canvas to record untold stories of many horrors inflicted upon the citizens.  Beverly is speaking out in her desire to ensure that history includes a more accurate documentation of the flood, and the unreported experiences of many citizens.  She seeks to speak for Katrina’s voiceless, her missing and the dead.  Beverly's desire is to provoke the world to  think about:

·  The untold stories of what happened to the citizens during the days, the weeks and months after the flood?

·  The thousands and thousands of houses sitting empty and damaged so many years after the flood?

·  The former occupants of those houses, where are they today and what is their status?

·  Why were there no attempts to locate, repatriate and account for the missing citizens long after the danger had passed?



Hurricane Katrina Traveling Art Exhibit

The Truth & Remembrance Tour will initially take the series of paintings to New York, Los Angeles, Minneapolis and Toronto .  Beverly Kimble Davis will accompany her paintings to provide first-hand information and published materials related to the images and stories they reflect. 

The Need for Crowd-Funding

The money raised through crowd-funding is needed to help underwrite the research and completion of additional paintings.  The funds will also help finance three exhibits that will be touring at the same time.  The goal is to increase the number of paintings to achieve a total of three dozen to enable continuous rotation.  Thus far, ten paintings have been completed.  In addition to Beverly, two assistants will travel with the exhibits for openings and to speak and answer questions for attendees.


Unable to Contribute but you would still like to Help?

The objective of the traveling art exhibit is to help inform and to educate.  Your willingness to help spread the word about this Indiegogo campaign and what transpired in New Orleans is invaluable.  So, even if unable to lend financial support, we'd be most appreciative of your helping to spread the word by directing visitors to our campaign site.  Please receive our heartfelt thanks in advance for your support.

Our Gifts & Our Thanks

In exchange for your financial support, we'll send you a signed or unsigned prints or posters of Beverly's first painting.  "Remember! The Forgotten Horrors After Katrina" is a collage of events that transpired even before the water were pumped from the streets.  Through special arrangement with a New Orleans performing artist, you can also choose to receive an incredible CD by MIKHALA IVERSEN who is known as the "Jazz Muffin". 

Contingency Plan

In the unlikely event this campaign is not successful in reaching our goal, we will continue forward with the traveling exhibit but on a reduced scale.  As opposed to three exhibits running simultaneously we might only run two instead.   Whatever the case, we will work diligently to take the stories of what happened after Katrina in New Orleans to the world. 

Beverly Kimble Davis 
New Orleans, Louisiana

story:
Mommie by Arlene Gottfried

Mommie is a remarkable photographic portrait of three generations of women in the family of photographer Arlene Gottfried and an intimate story of the inevitable passage of time and aging. Pictured within, we are introduced to Gottfried's 100-year-old immigrant grandmother, fragile mother, and reluctant sister over the breathtaking course of 35 years. The book, Arlene's fourth from powerHouse Books, will be released this December.

We need your help to realize a special dream for this book!

We would like to use real upholstery fabric to wrap the book's boards (the front cover, spine, and back cover). Join us and share in the wealth of Arlene's photographic world. Tokens of our appreciation range from inclusion in the book's acknowledgement page to signed copies of her rare and out of print books (Bacalaitos & Fireworks, Midnight, and Sometimes Overwhelming)...even a signed and numbered Limited Edition and a special luncheon with the singing photographer!

We made a short film to help get Arlene's story out into the world. Share today.

Arlene is a precious gem in the history of New York street photography, and beloved by all who know her in the photo world. Help us make more people aware of her very special gifts, and her wonderfully intimate and empathic mode of storytelling: share this video, this campaign, and come out to her book signings this coming holiday season.
Thank you!
Daniel Power, powerHouse Books (and Sara Rosen, interviewer and essayist; Snorri Sturluson, director; Craig Cohen, Wes Del Val, Will Luckman powerHouse Books)

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

We (Krista Newey and Kirsten Sullivan) are two emerging artists based in Toronto. Together we aspire to create work that engages audiences in community building through immersive, interdisciplinary performance. The inception of MOOD RING comes from a longing for a safe space to share and engage with a vast, vibrant and all-embracing community through self-expression. MOOD RING will bring together a transformative evening of gallery, performance, and interactive art, inviting collaboration and spontaneity from its participants. With MOOD RING we aim to blur the distinction between performer and audience. Through eliminating the idea that the performer is more important than the audience we aim to eliminate the idea that any one person is more important than any other.

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking support to help us cover the costs of venue and equipment rentals, and most importantly, to support the artists and performers financially for the time and energy they have contributed to this project and will provide throughout the event. This is also a wonderful way to show your support if you are unable to attend our event in person!

By donating to our campaign you are giving support to local artists and performers who care about the strength and viability of the arts within their communities.  This is an amazing opportunity for Toronto communities to engage with and celebrate in the energy of collaboration, spirit of engagement, and intimacy in performance. 

The Impact

By supporting MOOD RING, you are helping to create space that is safe and receptive to all of its participants, as well as becoming a part of a community that is full of engaged, thoughtful and inspiring local artists.

MOOD RING believes strongly in uplifting the voices of various backgrounds, histories and life experiences. By supporting MOOD RING you are supporting inclusive collaboration, and uplifting voices that may otherwise remain unheard. 

MOOD RING desires to host artists from a multitude of backgrounds, as well as attract participants from all walks of life. By supporting MOOD RING you are encouraging cross disciplinary creation, collaboration and intimacy.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able to contribute financially we would still love your support! Here's how you can help:

- Assist us in the spreading the word about our show by sharing our campaign on your social media

- Sharing our event and following us on our social media platforms 

Facebook Event: https://www.facebook.com/events/665150393866859/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/projectmoodring/

And of course by coming out on September 28th at Art Square Gallery!

story:
The Wing Portal

This past fall our community here in California was hit by the devastating fires that destroyed hundreds of homes and affected so many lives. These events have deeply changed us. 

As a visual metaphor to transcendence and metamorphosis, our team is building a sculpture out of the ruins from the fire and is bringing it to another place of deep personal transformation: Burning Man. And after the Burn, the sculpture will be publicly installed in California. 

The wings span 60 feet across , and are  built out of recycled metal, iridescent dichroic acrylic panels and thousands of LED lights. 

During the day, they will shimmer with iridescent light as a place where people can take refuge and meditate.

At night, the sculpture will transform into a stage with nightly music and art performances.  

 

Team

Our team includes electrical engineers, structural engineers, 3d designers, and sculptors. All of us are long-time Burners, and Californians, so this is a very personal piece for us. 

Schedule Of Events

- Tuesday Party with Maxa Camp Art Car on Tuesday night 

- Wednesday Wedding Celebration

- Thursday Sunset Dance Performance by Alea Rain 

- Friday Sunrise Sound Bath with Scarlett De La Torre under the Wing Portal 

Story

Suki Somersall - the project's visionary and lead artist - has been affected by the fires first hand. Here Suki talks about those events and the inspiration behind the sculpture in her own words: 

 On Nov. 11, 2018, my home and art studio in Malibu burned to the ground. I had just moved in a few weeks before and was out of town when the fire blazed through Latigo Canyon. The whole experience felt surreal."

I went to visit the site of my short-lived home where all of my possessions and paintings had burned. It was just a pile of dust and melted metal.

I was struck by the peculiar beauty I saw in all my work, possessions, journals and paintings transmuted back to the Earth and the air.

I was now free.

These things had been trapping me. I was in a prison of my own design and I had not even realized it. The fire released me on a new, higher path, lighter and stronger.

'The Wing Portal' represents this transformation. With your contribution, you will be helping us to create beauty from chaos, and see that sometime destruction creates the most devastatingly beautiful outcome.

 

Where We Are & What's Next

  • We have already finalized the structural and electrical engineering for the piece, allocated recycled materials from the ruins, and have begun fabrication.

  • We need the your support to cover welding costs, LED infrastructure, and transportation to and from the Playa. 

  • We are going big in size and if our goal is not met, we will scale the piece to a smaller size but still dramatic and beautiful. 
  • With each donation level you will receive a piece of artwork from the artists on our team.


    •  

Getting The Word Out!

  • Please help us spread the word and share this project with your community!
  • Email suz@kirakira.com with any questions <3

Please donate to bring this symbol of transcendence to Burning Man 2019!
story_txt:
The Wing Portal
This past fall our community here in California was hit by the devastating fires that destroyed hundreds of homes and affected so many lives. These events have deeply changed us. 
As a visual metaphor to transcendence and metamorphosis, our team is building a sculpture out of the ruins from the fire and is bringing it to another place of deep personal transformation: Burning Man. And after the Burn, the sculpture will be publicly installed in California. 
The wings span 60 feet across , and are  built out of recycled metal, iridescent dichroic acrylic panels and thousands of LED lights. 

During the day, they will shimmer with iridescent light as a place where people can take refuge and meditate.
At night, the sculpture will transform into a stage with nightly music and art performances.  

 
Team
Our team includes electrical engineers, structural engineers, 3d designers, and sculptors. All of us are long-time Burners, and Californians, so this is a very personal piece for us. 

Schedule Of Events
- Tuesday Party with Maxa Camp Art Car on Tuesday night 
- Wednesday Wedding Celebration
- Thursday Sunset Dance Performance by Alea Rain 
- Friday Sunrise Sound Bath with Scarlett De La Torre under the Wing Portal 
Story
Suki Somersall - the project's visionary and lead artist - has been affected by the fires first hand. Here Suki talks about those events and the inspiration behind the sculpture in her own words: 
 On Nov. 11, 2018, my home and art studio in Malibu burned to the ground. I had just moved in a few weeks before and was out of town when the fire blazed through Latigo Canyon. The whole experience felt surreal."

I went to visit the site of my short-lived home where all of my possessions and paintings had burned. It was just a pile of dust and melted metal.
I was struck by the peculiar beauty I saw in all my work, possessions, journals and paintings transmuted back to the Earth and the air.
I was now free.
These things had been trapping me. I was in a prison of my own design and I had not even realized it. The fire released me on a new, higher path, lighter and stronger.
'The Wing Portal' represents this transformation. With your contribution, you will be helping us to create beauty from chaos, and see that sometime destruction creates the most devastatingly beautiful outcome.
 

Where We Are & What's Next

We have already finalized the structural and electrical engineering for the piece, allocated recycled materials from the ruins, and have begun fabrication.
We need the your support to cover welding costs, LED infrastructure, and transportation to and from the Playa. 
We are going big in size and if our goal is not met, we will scale the piece to a smaller size but still dramatic and beautiful. 


With each donation level you will receive a piece of artwork from the artists on our team.
 

Getting The Word Out!

Please help us spread the word and share this project with your community!
Email suz@kirakira.com with any questions <3


Please donate to bring this symbol of transcendence to Burning Man 2019!

story:
Short Summary

Dreams are the stories our brains tell while we’re sleeping—they’re a collection of clips, images, feelings, and memories that involuntarily occur during the REM (rapid eye movement) stage of slumber. "Liquid Dreams" will purposely encourage artists to liquefy their dreams into tangible realities.   

My name is Shirley "Shellz" Joseph, and I have a Dream to Spread Love through Art & Music. I am an Artrepreneur from the "City of Champions" [Brockton, MA]. When I was a child, I would write poems, songs, and create masterpieces to share with my friends and family. I will never forget the warm feelings and happy reactions of those who received a gift of Art. I have a dream to share this with the world! "Liquid Dreams" is a masterpiece to be painted in actuality with your help.

It's important for artists to dream and execute their dreams as entrepreneurs. A little over a year ago, my dreams were just mental pictures, I would speak them into existence and pray to accomplish them one day. My efforts lead me to a #GymForArtists in Quincy where my dreams immediately began to take off. I released two music projects [“No Category” &  “-ily”], performed at over 10 shows, and sold over 10 art pieces all in the upper east coast of America.

Art is a form of creative human expression and a way of enriching the human experience. I have heard and discussed the needs of artists all over Massachusetts. Artists feel like there's a lack of unity and opportunity. I've dreamed of a solution but I need your participation! Your contributions will give back to artists and encourage them to work harder and smarter towards their dreams.

Contributions will also fund FREE family portraits! These portraits bring unity and support to families in the community who otherwise cannot afford a professional photographer. The funds from this campaign will support the #SupportLocalArtists movement and grant the opportunity for more developments as "Liquid Dreams”.  

What We Need & What You Get

The goal is to raise $5,000.

  • 20% Goes towards the costs and efforts to develop this occasion
  • 20% Goes towards giving back to the Artists
  • 20% Goes towards the #GymForArtists
  • 20% Goes towards the #SupportLocalArtists Movement
  • 20% Goes towards providing Free Family Portraits 

Unique Perks:

General Admission is a minimum contribution of $10.

Our two Bundles include lots of exclusive items!

$50 Bundle | "Dream Big"

  • Includes a Reserved Seat, T-shirt, 10 raffle tickets, and a Tote Bag filled with goodies!

$100 Bundle | "Liquid Dreams"

  • Includes a Reserved Seat, T-shirt, 10 raffle tickets, Tote Bag filled with goodies, and an Art Piece of your choice! 

*If you cannot attend the occasion, we will arrange for the items to be shipped to you.

What happens if we don't reach our goal?

"Failure is simply the opportunity to begin again, this time more intelligently." -Henry Ford

If we fall short from our goal we will continue to distribute the funds to all the moving parts to make this occasion a success. We will continue with our mission to Support Local Artists and learn new ways to involve the world. 

The Impact

The term "Starving Artist" has a lot of truth to it. Our solution is to encourage artists to be Entrepreneurs. Encouraging artists to turn their crafts into a legitimate small business, and providing them a platform to do so is the opportunity created at the #GymForArtists. Not only is this good for the artist but it also impacts our economy as a whole. 

Currently, we have artists instructing classes to children and adults to #CreateLocalArtists. The #SupportLocalArtists movement Impacts the nation with stickers reminding us all that we each know an artist who can use support. The #GymForArtists serves as a space for creation and collaborations that leave lasting lifetime expressions. 

These contributions make way for these opportunities to grow and spread; first across the nation, and soon across the world. Providing Free Professional Family Portraits will impact families for a lifetime. A Family portrait is a gift to your grandparents, parents, siblings, extended family, and also for you when family members are no longer with you. Photos taken at "Liquid Dreams" will be historical for generations to come; the captured moments will be left with your family when you are no longer on this earth.

Risks & Challenges

Risks Include:

  • Lack of liquid funds: it will be difficult to cover the costs necessary to make this occasion possible.
  • Having to start over will delay the developments to make this a reoccurring occasion.

Challenges Include:

  • Fronting costs
  • Finding volunteers and sponsors 

These risks and challenges will drive us to succeed by any means necessary. A little goes a long way. The plan is to spread this like wildfire through word of mouth, social media, and inviting others to get on-board with matching efforts.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share, like, and subscribe to our mission. Even if you cannot contribute or attend this occasion, you can still share and follow our journey. Indiegogo has many share tools you can use easily. You can find details of all the artists and businesses involved on our website and social media.

www.TheSelfMadeDesigns.com

IG | @TheSelfMadeDesigns

story:
Overview

MythoFutuRiddim returns with another self-funded pop-up exhibition featuring a new roster of emerging artists who explore ritual, cultural mythology, Afrofuturism and constructed identity. Our first iteration took place in Brooklyn in 2018 and the next version, MythoFutuRiddim 2, will launch in Houston this fall.

As in our tradition, we don't have corporate sponsors and we rely on public support. Therefore, Crowdfunding will be the primary financial support model of this project. Our goal is to raise $4,400 via IndieGoGo to cover the expenses of the exhibition.

As a way to show our gratitude for your patronage, we are offering some amazing patron perks, including vintage records, rare books, as well as original artwork and prints.

Our goal is to develop direct connections between emerging artists and emerging collectors. Your patronage will help build a sustainable career model for the participating artists.

Action brings Clarity

My name is A.C. Evans aka Catalyss, an artist, designer and curator based in Houston.  Over the years as an artist, I've found it difficult to develop a sustainable career using the traditional artist model of production, submission, anticipation and rejection.  The standard artist gallery relationship is exceeding unhealthy and unbalanced.  Most agreements leave artists with little to no leverage. Admittedly, there are organizations that can provide support, but they are often budget strapped and therefore relegate artists to desperately compete for an ever diminishing pool of grants, fellowships and residencies. Instead of complaining about circumstances, we believe its time for artists to actively create the change they want to see.

 

Meet the Artists

 

Tiye Bazzey is a freelance photographer based in Brooklyn, New York. She grew up painting and drawing in and out of art class and began taking photos on a small Canon Powershot in 2009. Her compassion for women of color artists inspired her to create WE ROAM FREELY - a platform dedicated to showcasing and uplifting WOC artists.

Become patron of Tiye's:

 

 

Jamie Robertson  is a visual artist and educator from Houston, currently pursuing an MFA in Studio Art with a concentration in photography and digital media at the University of Houston. She is a former recipient of the Pearlie Roberson Award for her joint Frenchtown Mural project and is interested in cultural community development through creative youth development. Her creative practice explores history and identity in the African Diaspora through photography, printmaking and sculpture.

Become a patron of Jamie's:

 

Become a patron of Robert's:

Robert "yonderboy" Legans-Johnson is a Houston-native digital fabricator and electronic artist who is engaged with the idea of "interaction" and "play". His interests in role-playing, video games, online broadcasting, and interactive design are reflected in the variety of electronic art he has produced, including developing puzzles for escape rooms, motion-reactive light fixtures, and 3D-scanned sculptures, among other works. He is currently occupied in the Interdisciplinary Practices and Emerging Forms (IPEF) graduate art program at the University of Houston, developing pieces that play with randomness, possibility, and the aesthetics of technology.

 

Perks. . . a.ka. stuff for you

All donors at any level will have their name included in the MythoFutuRiddim Arts Patron list which will be prominently posted at the exhibition.  Your name will also be included on the MythoFutuRiddim website as a Patron of the Arts.

As a thank you for your support, we'll be offering a range of donor perks including original artwork, photography prints, digitally fabricated pendants, illustrations, rare LPs and hard find books.  We'll soon be refreshing the perks with limited edition posters, screen-prints plus sticker-packs.

 

Vintage Market for LPs and Rare books!

MythoFutuRiddim 2, will feature a pop-up store curated by DJ Good Grief, featuring vintage LPs from The Record Klub and rare books from Reader's Block Mobile. The market will be open during the full run of the show. 

 

Wait, there's more dope Artists. . .

 

After been diagnosed with life threatening illness and depression, self-taught artist Ronnie Queenan, discovered his abstract practice through an art therapy and healing class. Ronnie creates from everyday life and is in constant vibration with the world around him. Making art for Ronnie represents a meditative connection with his soul and a sense of peacefulness.


Mortimer Ex is an introverted Houston based artist. Her primary medium is collage, which can oftentimes include her poetry and photography. She has had no formal art training and creates the same way she has learned to do most things, by doing it. The bulk of Ex’s inspiration comes from personal life experiences. Her work tends to reflect concepts of self-discovery and blatant juxtaposition. Mortimer Ex’s motives for that exist somewhere between taking pleasure in offering comfort with the uncomfortable and having a instinctual desire to ruin things.  She is a firm believer that art should be diverse, inclusive and accessible and that art and philanthropy are connected.  

 

Irene Antonia Diane Reece, a contemporary artist and visual activist was born and raised in Houston, Texas and is currently based in Paris. Her recent work questions societies perspectives on her racial identities and combats the social norms in regards to being a Black Mexican woman living in the United States and Europe. Her work pushes boundaries and forces her viewers to confront issues that are deemed difficult to tackle.

Become a patron of Irene's:

 

The Details

We are aiming for an initial goal of $4,400, to cover the fees & expenses of funding this pop-up exhibition, which will run from Thursday November 7 until Saturday November 9 2019.

Venue

MythoFutuRiddim 2 will be held at Arka Arts, 4715 Main St,, a 3,000 sq ft event space in the Houston's Museum District.

Schedule

Thursday November 7 - Gallery Hours 6 PM - 10 PM

6 PM - Opening Reception

8PM - Musical Performance

Friday November 7 - Gallery Hours 11 AM - 9 PM

Throughout the day we'll be playing vinyl specifically curated for the exhibition.

5pm-7pm - Pop-Up Happy Hour DJ performance by a Special Guest

8 PM - 9 PM - Artists Presentations + Discussion

Participating artists will give ten-minute lightning talks about the foundational concepts of their art practice.  After the presentations, there will be an open public discussion around how the concepts of mythology, futurism, and riddim/music influence the making of art.

Saturday November 9 - Gallery Hours 12 PM - 9 PM

9:30 AM - 12:30 PM - MythoFutuRiddim is for the Kids!

On Saturday morning from 9:30 AM - 12 PM,  the gallery will be made available to parents with children between the ages of 2yrs - 12yrs for a special children's tour and Design Gym.

Children will be given a curator led tour through the exhibition, followed by an activity time where children will be allowed to create, display and discuss their works of Art. Using examples from the exhibition, attention will be given to how Basic Elements of Design (Line, Shape, + Space) have been employed to create the work featured in the exhibition. Afterwards we'll speak about to communicate your identity through Art related concepts.

**Materials and Snacks will be provided**

7 PM-9 PM - Open Mic/ Exhibition Closing Ceremony

Impact & Traction

Your contribution to this project will make a direct impact on the lives of the artists involved.  By participating in helping us bring this concept to life, you are proving that there is demand for artist-created, patron-driven projects.  By becoming a patron, you are illustrating that there is a vibrant community wiling to support artists who strive to build their careers on their own terms.  In the future, we hope to increase the length of shows, include more artists and offer more creative opportunities for artist patronage.

Risks & Challenges

It's a challenge to step out and try something new, but we know there is prosperity on the other side of struggle. Besides, what's life without a little risk? Personally, this project represents the manifestation of an idea I’ve long hand on how to create opportunities for artists to share their special gifts.  The public needs Art and we genuinely believe the public is interested in supporting Art in all its diverse forms.

We've committed our financial, intellectual and physical resources to our careers. This project represents action,  a direct confrontation to fear, and a more direct affirmation of power of the collaborative spirit.

Money ain't everything

Sometimes though, you just don't have it and we get that, but ultimately currency or money is simply a tangible form of energy.  Your energy in the form of patronage will be directly transformed into making more Art, but also into passing along that energy by:

Sharing our campaign with your friends, family and colleagues. Liking our Facebook as well as  Sharing, Following and posting.

Following us and the individual artists on Instagram and/or Twitter. DM them and tell them how much you like their work

Use the hashtag #MythoFutuRiddim on your platforms to help us spread the word

Thank you kindly for your time, attention and consideration. Hope to see you at the Show!

-A.C. Evans, Tiye Bazzey, Jamie Robertson, Robert Legans-Johnson, Ronnie Queenan, Mortimer Ex, Irene Reece.

story:
Spiritual Soldiers Represent Goodness

People are profoundly touched when standing in front of a towering Soldier built entirely of chairs and borne of a vision to help people heal. When they see the random chair pieces that created the Soldier they realize that they too are made of pieces and that it’s possible to heal their brokenness and become whole. When you stand in the light of this army and raise your hands to the Creator or Soul Soldier, you feel wonder, hopefulness, and peace.

It was 1991, I visited a warehouse full of broken chairs piled 40 feet high and for some reason, I saw giant soldiers looking back at me. It was then that I had a vision of creating a spiritual army for those who could not stand up or fight for themselves. It was a holy moment; I knew then that one day I would build a spiritual army to create peace from pieces and make these healing Soldiers. Twenty-five years later, Mary Stover, a WWII US Army Nurse and my mother-in-law,  faced elder abuse and in a moment of exhaustion I cried out, "God, you need an army to fight for her", and that's when I received the message to "build it now". So I began at once to bring the broken pieces to life as a symbolic army to fight for her and for those who could not fight for themselves. These Soldiers are your army. 

These spiritual Soldiers stand victorious in the face of adversity. Join this voyage with me; with your help, we can build more Soldiers and share this army with others. The Soldiers are 16' 10" to 24' 9" tall and named the Sentinel, the Guardian, Brotherly Love, Soul Man, Creator & Humanity and Victory. Each sculpture has a deeper meaning and represents a form of strength and guidance: peace, love, protection, victory, silence, touch, ancient wisdom.

 

Why Are We Raising Funds? 

We want to build more Soldiers and take them on tour to share with those who want to find peace through these broken pieces.

I’m Visionary Steve Farland and together with Builder/Sculptor Brian Sartor we created these SEVEN Spiritual Soldiers. With your help, we can share this message of peace through pieces with the world. These broken pieces create wholeness and from this brokenness, I see a vision of healing, of Victory through broken pieces. Like these Soldiers, if we embrace our broken pieces, we will find where we fit together and where we are whole.

"Calm seas never made a good sailor. The hard things in life, the reasons that we need to embrace the things that break us is because if you shed them and give them away, you’ll have no ballast, you’ll never be able to weather bigger storms. If you never acknowledge the meaning, then the lesson is never learned. It’s painful; you shed the very lesson you were supposed to learn." (Steve Farland)

We’d like your help to share Victory Art with the world!

  • Our first goal is to raise funds to create a 501(c)3 for the Soldiers; we estimate this cost at $4K.
  • Next, we need to find volunteer Artists and Sculptors who will collaborate with us to create additional Soldiers to complete our Spiritual Army! 
  • $12K will be used for custom-built Shipping Crates to safely travel on tour. They have been carefully blanketed and wrapped and are awaiting their future homes.
  • $6K will go to purchasing a good, clean, used road-worthy trailer to be used to transport the Soldiers.
  • Corner blocks will be mailed to anyone donating over $50. Your message to humanity will be part of our next Soldier!
  • Any remaining funds will be used to seek grants and foundations—as well as to contact museums and other venues that would be interested in displaying the Victory Art Soldiers.

 

What's a Corner Block? It's your Perk!

This is The Guardian. As big as he is (16 ft., 10 in) he can’t stand without corner blocks holding him together. He needs them. So, when people get divided and try to break people away from people, it really is pointless because they’re breaking away from themselves. Their corners are needed. Your corners are needed. When we toured in NYC, I took 1000 of these corner blocks and put them on a table and asked people to write a message to humanity and these are some of the messages that were written. Your message will be included in our next soldier.

We’ll send a corner block to everyone who donates over $50. Please write a message to humanity and send it back to us. We’ll include your message in the next Soldier we build and your words will go forward in that sculpture as it travels. We learn that if you take the smallest and the biggest, they fit together perfectly and uniquely and together, they rise to victory.

 

The Impact

Here's what people say when they see the Victory Soldiers.

  • You walk into the room and you're just BLOWN AWAY. (Jeffrey Keith, Curator, Vicki Maren Gallery) 
  • They inspire the human spirit to go forward through all diversity. (WESTWORD Magazine)
  • I'm overwhelmed with their magnificence and power to heal! (Ann Schaefer, Writer)
  • After you get over that initial shock then you move into the genius of it ... fashioned into these gigantic totems that make the world stand up and be counted, they make us look. This is a metaphor that says there is a solution to the world problems we have ... these broken pieces can be fixed and repaired and formulated into a whole recognizable body. That's what's so powerful about this exhibit. (Ed Dwight, World-Renowned Sculptor/Astronaut)

Other Ways You Can Help

We love that you've checked out our campaign. Even if you can't contribute, we'd appreciate if you'd share our campaign. 

  • Please donate to our Soldiers, our mission and our vision. Thank you for spreading the word about our cause by sharing our campaign with your social platforms. Thank YOU!
  • Share our website: http://www.thevictoryart.com/
  • Be sure to use the Indiegogo sharing tools!

That's our story and we are so thankful that you're interested in helping to build a Spiritual Army! 

Thanks, EVERYONE!
story_txt:
Spiritual Soldiers Represent Goodness
People are profoundly touched when standing in front of a towering Soldier built entirely of chairs and borne of a vision to help people heal. When they see the random chair pieces that created the Soldier they realize that they too are made of pieces and that it’s possible to heal their brokenness and become whole. When you stand in the light of this army and raise your hands to the Creator or Soul Soldier, you feel wonder, hopefulness, and peace.

It was 1991, I visited a warehouse full of broken chairs piled 40 feet high and for some reason, I saw giant soldiers looking back at me. It was then that I had a vision of creating a spiritual army for those who could not stand up or fight for themselves. It was a holy moment; I knew then that one day I would build a spiritual army to create peace from pieces and make these healing Soldiers. Twenty-five years later, Mary Stover, a WWII US Army Nurse and my mother-in-law,  faced elder abuse and in a moment of exhaustion I cried out, "God, you need an army to fight for her", and that's when I received the message to "build it now". So I began at once to bring the broken pieces to life as a symbolic army to fight for her and for those who could not fight for themselves. These Soldiers are your army. 

These spiritual Soldiers stand victorious in the face of adversity. Join this voyage with me; with your help, we can build more Soldiers and share this army with others. The Soldiers are 16' 10" to 24' 9" tall and named the Sentinel, the Guardian, Brotherly Love, Soul Man, Creator & Humanity and Victory. Each sculpture has a deeper meaning and represents a form of strength and guidance: peace, love, protection, victory, silence, touch, ancient wisdom.

 

Why Are We Raising Funds? 
We want to build more Soldiers and take them on tour to share with those who want to find peace through these broken pieces.
I’m Visionary Steve Farland and together with Builder/Sculptor Brian Sartor we created these SEVEN Spiritual Soldiers. With your help, we can share this message of peace through pieces with the world. These broken pieces create wholeness and from this brokenness, I see a vision of healing, of Victory through broken pieces. Like these Soldiers, if we embrace our broken pieces, we will find where we fit together and where we are whole.

"Calm seas never made a good sailor. The hard things in life, the reasons that we need to embrace the things that break us is because if you shed them and give them away, you’ll have no ballast, you’ll never be able to weather bigger storms. If you never acknowledge the meaning, then the lesson is never learned. It’s painful; you shed the very lesson you were supposed to learn." (Steve Farland)

Our first goal is to raise funds to create a 501(c)3 for the Soldiers; we estimate this cost at $4K.
Next, we need to find volunteer Artists and Sculptors who will collaborate with us to create additional Soldiers to complete our Spiritual Army! 
$12K will be used for custom-built Shipping Crates to safely travel on tour. They have been carefully blanketed and wrapped and are awaiting their future homes.
$6K will go to purchasing a good, clean, used road-worthy trailer to be used to transport the Soldiers.

Corner blocks will be mailed to anyone donating over $50. Your message to humanity will be part of our next Soldier!
Any remaining funds will be used to seek grants and foundations—as well as to contact museums and other venues that would be interested in displaying the Victory Art Soldiers.

This is The Guardian. As big as he is (16 ft., 10 in) he can’t stand without corner blocks holding him together. He needs them. So, when people get divided and try to break people away from people, it really is pointless because they’re breaking away from themselves. Their corners are needed. Your corners are needed. When we toured in NYC, I took 1000 of these corner blocks and put them on a table and asked people to write a message to humanity and these are some of the messages that were written. Your message will be included in our next soldier.

We’ll send a corner block to everyone who donates over $50. Please write a message to humanity and send it back to us. We’ll include your message in the next Soldier we build and your words will go forward in that sculpture as it travels. We learn that if you take the smallest and the biggest, they fit together perfectly and uniquely and together, they rise to victory.

 

The Impact
Here's what people say when they see the Victory Soldiers.

You walk into the room and you're just BLOWN AWAY. (Jeffrey Keith, Curator, Vicki Maren Gallery) 

They inspire the human spirit to go forward through all diversity. (WESTWORD Magazine)


I'm overwhelmed with their magnificence and power to heal! (Ann Schaefer, Writer)
After you get over that initial shock then you move into the genius of it ... fashioned into these gigantic totems that make the world stand up and be counted, they make us look. This is a metaphor that says there is a solution to the world problems we have ... these broken pieces can be fixed and repaired and formulated into a whole recognizable body. That's what's so powerful about this exhibit. (Ed Dwight, World-Renowned Sculptor/Astronaut)


Other Ways You Can Help
We love that you've checked out our campaign. Even if you can't contribute, we'd appreciate if you'd share our campaign. 


Please donate to our Soldiers, our mission and our vision. Thank you for spreading the word about our cause by sharing our campaign with your social platforms. Thank YOU!

Share our website: http://www.thevictoryart.com/

Be sure to use the Indiegogo sharing tools!

That's our story and we are so thankful that you're interested in helping to build a Spiritual Army! Thanks, EVERYONE!

story:
Hi! My name is Sarah Murphy and I am a designer, photographer, writer, film maker and artist. This spring I was accepted to an exhibition in Lithuania and Georgia entitled Anima Mundi. 

The eighth task of Hercules was to bring back the four mares of Diomedes to King Eurystheus. Magnifiscent, wild and uncontrollable, they were kept tethered to a bronze manger and consumed an unnatural diet of human flesh. Hercules fed the king’s half-God body to his own horses, which then rendered them calm and complacent.

Through this collection of photographs, I seek to explore perceptions of femininity and power, as well as the symbiotic relationship between horse and human. 

  • A majority of funding will go towards transportation and production costs (as well as materials), exhibition fees, as well as lodging. 
  • Prizes for contributions range from postcards, to prints, name drops in film credits or an exhibition sized 24 x36 wood print of The Mares of Diomedes.
  • Any extra funds beyond the base amount will go towards film/film production costs of "Keeper's Tale."

The Impact

  • This project is a valuable chance for information exchange between the United States and Lithuania and Georgia. It fosters international relationships between the art community. 

  • Previous Awards and Projects: 

    2012 Spirit of Lono, FCFC, Harrisonburg, VA

    2012 The Mares of Diomedes, The Blue Nile Harrisonburg, VA 2009 PVCC, Charlottesville, VA
    2008 The Sound Is In The Grooves, LGC, Harrisonburg, VA

    Group Exhibitions:

    2015 Columbus Museum #MobilePhotoNow, Columbus, OH 2013, Photoworks, Glen Echo, MD

    2012 Mint, Harrisonburg, VA
    2011 “Instability”, The Artful Dodger, Harrisonburg, VA 2011 “A Horse is a Horse”, South Gallery, Charlottesville, VA 2010 “Breath, Spirit, Soul,” League of Therapists
    2008 PVCC Student Show, Charlottesville, VA
    2007 PVCC Student Show, Charlottesville, VA

    Awards and Honors:

    2013 Art Council of the Valley Advancing the Arts Recipient 2013 Super Gr8 Film Festival Critic’s Choice Awards
    2010 AIGA Poster Clash Design Competition Finalist 2008-2010 AIGA Round Table Participant

    2008-2009 PVCC Graphic Design Advisory Board 2008 Chica Tenney Fellowship
    2008 Nancy Eades Art Award
    2008 PVCC Distinguished Student Award

    Bibliography: Public Presentations, Lectures, Juries

    Residence and Refuge, grant recipient
    Hurricane Sandy Relief Art Auction, show curator Art for Haiti’s Sake, show curator
    Help Portrait Coordinator, 2009-2010

    Education:
    Bachelor of Fine Arts, James Madison University, 2013

    Graphic Design Career Studies, Piedmont Virginia Community College, 2008 


Risks & Challenges


  • Tight time frame
  • As a prior grant recipient and exhibiting artist I am familiar with the pressure of fulfilling deadlines in a timely and satisfactory manner. It is important to me to see a project through to the end and overcome any challenges or obstacles. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please help get the word out and share with your friends!
  • Feel free to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Creating chaotic balance is an art form according to multimedia artist Eddy Bogaert. In celebration of the New York community Eddy invites you to show your support for the local art scene, with a crowd fundraising movement.

Eddy has dedicated his life to his craft and to the art community, and now we are asking for your help. In order to continue to create, curate exhibitions and build his brand, funding is desperately needed. Your help will go towards buying paint, canvases, 3D glasses, black lights, resin, and respirators. We are asking for donations (big or small) to help the cause. For donations of certain value, Eddy will create you a personal thank you, ranging from a t-shirt, through to personalizing a painting, or jazz up your favorite pair of sneakers with his signature touch.

Ten percent of all proceeds raised will go towards WhiteBox Charity foundation, which aims to support local artists and gives them a platform to showcase their work. The charity offers diverse programs to nurture community growth for individuals who would otherwise not have the means to support their passion.

Eddy has exhibited his work nationally including the Hampton's, Manhattan and Brooklyn, and been featured in the wall street journal, Nakid magazine, and Culture Mag. He draws inspiration from nightlife, lust, desire, and pop- cul- ture. His paintings are interactive and have discreet subliminal messages, which can only be seen under certain lighting conditions. Eddy has brought the concept of 3D into his paintings adding dimensions and layers, making his pieces dynamic and alluring.

If you would like an interview with Eddy, or to know more about the campaign, please do not hesitate to get in contact. 


www.eddybogaert.com

story:
nowHERE x OROBOROUS

public installation and exhibition series 
MID AUGUST 2016

 

Hi! My name is Cleo Barnett and I am an artist and curator from New Zealand. I'm dedicated to creating public spaces for us as a community to get to know each other, collaborate and support one another in these times of crazy expensive costs of living. Since moving to New York a year ago I've really noticed how much our public spaces are dominated with advertising and I wanted to do something to challenge that. 

Do you think we should have more rights to use public space? Or should multinational corporations with their advertising have the monopoly?

Be part of the conversation.

By supporting our project with a donation you will get some of the artwork from the exhibition mailed to you! 

Your contribution will support the launch of nowHERE x OROBOROUS at a surprise venue in Brooklyn, New York mid August. The artworks, contributed by prolific artists from 10+ cities around the world, intend to engage in community dialogue around who gets access to public space and why.

Featuring artwork from:

Amy Mattox

Alessandro Echevarria aka Skulldaggery

Andrea Wan

Baso

Broken Fingaz Crew

Elise Beer

Erin Forsyth

Gina Keil

Grace Osborne

Lauren Drescher

Milarky

Rachel Lesser

Sofia Drescher

Sean Morris

Sheryo

Xoe Hall

 

What We Need & What You Get

Since none of the art works in this first public exhibition will be on sale, we need your support. Ideally we are looking for $3,000 to complete one public installation, including materials, printing costs and documentation.

For each contribution, we have special gifts as a big THANK YOU for believing in us and helping to make this dream exhibition a reality.

 

The Impact

nowHERE wants to have the conversations life often gets too busy and complicated to have. Through the creation of spaces we reimagine the world. Bringing together dynamic groups of cross disciplinary thinkers and do'ers, we explore how art and community engagement within public spaces can challenge and impact public policy. We are dedicated to building meaningful, stimulating, inspiring and informative platforms that provide participants with real life tools to take action and participate in our world. 

 

Risks & Challenges

To date nowHERE has produced one art program which we managed to fully fund through personal contributions from the curator and public support (SPECIAL thank you for your generous support and positive affirmations!). We are dedicated to producing meaningful, stimulating, inspiring and informative spaces that provide participants with real life tools to take action and participate in our world, but it will be a struggle to do this all on our own! Alongside this campaign we plan to apply for scholarships, art residencies and curatorial funding streams to support ongoing public socially conscious art programs. This process is an ongoing challenge but we believe in the value of creating platforms for community discussion and are therefore excited to give it our time and energy!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are always looking for filmmakers, graphic designers, illustrators, artists, curators, writers, volunteers, teachers and people who can provide materials like paper and paint and/or spaces for workshops and exhibitions.

Please reach out if you want to get involved: yourstrulynowhere@gmail.com

SPECIAL shout outs to  LoveCityLove and ArtPrimo based in Seattle and The Betty’s art collective and KINGBROWN MAGAZINE in New York for the ongoing support.

Big special thanks to the Advocates for Snake Preservation crew who have been advisors on this project.

<<lalalalallalaaa prizes>>>>>>

 

KINGBROWN MAGAZINE

ERIN FORYSTH ORIGINAL PRINT

(green background)

LOVECITYLOVE LIMITED EDITION T SHIRT

ART PRIMO PRIZE PACK

story:
What is Food Love?



Food Love / Alimento Y Amor, a nourishing bi-lingual book, is about to become a vibrant mural in the heart of downtown Santa Cruz. 
Three elegant images, with compelling text in French, English, and Spanish, will enrich and beautify our canvas - the currently blank wall facing the lively Downtown Santa Cruz Farmer's Market.

Led by the author and creator of Food Love/Alimento Y Amor, M.Sophia Santiago, the mural project is brought to you buy a team of passionate, skilled art professionals, painters, students, community art-lovers and supporters! 


Know who else we need on the team?  YOU.

Art Matters!

Another mural downtown? YES! One that includes the community in the making,  illustrating the viability of a creative economy of, and by, the community.

  • During the production of the mural, Food Love/Alimento Y Amor supports artists and shows one pathway to young people considering a career as an artist. Led by muralist and Santa Cruz native Elijah Pfotenhauer, five students from his high school mural program and a Cabrillo College art student will be hired and paid to paint the 60-foot-long mural along with him, a prime example of the Santa Cruz's creative economy in action!


  • Once it's up on the wall, Food Love/Alimento Y Amor reminds those who come in contact with the message, of the farm-to-table journey their food takes, and encourages healthy choices for our community. 

    The     multi-lingual content is inclusive and welcoming to all ages, so the message and beauty will not be lost on even the little ones!
  • While we are thrilled to have received the blessing on the City of Santa Cruz City Council and Arts Commission, funding for Food Love/Alimento Y Amor funding will come from individuals and businesses like yours, giving the community "Ownership" of the project, and the pride of being a tangible part of the team.


What its Going to Take, and What We are Ready to Give.

Let's face it, your financial contributions
are vital to the success of this project!

So, please, contribute money at any level --
because this will be the CooLest Thing you Do all Week!

A financial commitment of $5-500 is just one way to help!
Be part of our team by writing, producing, sharing, posting, liking, painting, showing up, eating, and asking other folks to join in the campaign.

While our team members have each volunteered countless hours in the arts locally, they also earn their living in the arts: teaching, photographing, modeling, administrating, painting - you get the idea.  Our plan for the project includes a real-world budget that supports the artists and arts professionals involved. 

  • If we reach our funding goal, we'll give 70% of it to the artists, students, and professionals that created, administered and produced the piece! (Don't fret! If we don't reach our entire goal, the mural can still proceed, but our creative team will all be donating part of their time. Your contribution will be put to use in the production of this piece, no matter what!)

  • 10% of the $13,300 budget is for paint and other supplies, as well as wall cleaning and preparation costs.

  • 5% goes back to IndieGogo. We couldn't do it without them as part of the team!

  • And the rest pays for the perks!
    (We're working hard to be sure the perks are fabulous, but still keep the budget down. If we exceed our goal, you can bet those gourmet perks will be among the best you've ever tasted!)

What perks, you ask?

  • Snack and Appetizer supporters will get Food Love Buttons and copies of the books in English and Spanish, respectively.


  • How about a gourmet picnic lunch for Brown Bag level donors? You'll come to the mural inaugural launch with other cool people who feel the Food Love - on a Wednesday Farmers' Market day.

  • At the Fine Dining level, you get access to The Curated Feast, complete with custom cocktail and copies of Food Love. 



    What is The Curated Feast?     Liz Birnbaum combines her love of food, art and history as she tells her dinner guests the stories behind their meal. 
  • For those at Banquet level, VIP entry to the Curated Feast is Guaranteed! Complete with maître d's access to the chef's recipes, and a gourmet goody bag courtesy of the Santa Cruz Community Farmers Market.  AND your name or logo goes on the mural.
  • And contributers at the Underwriter level will simply support the mural without reward of perks, because that's what patrons of the Arts do!  But you WILL have your name or company logo featured prominently on the mural dedication and credits.

Can't take us up on our delicious perks, but still want to be on the team? Great!  It's so simple:

  • Share the Food Love Indiegogo Campaign with an art-loving or farmer's-marketing Friend or Network.
  • Blog, post or tweet, #FoodLove #AlimentoYAmor - Let the World know why YOU support Food Love! 
  • Then give yourself a BIG THANK YOU for taking your precious time to watch, to consider, and to CLICK.

Our Team is Ready to Roll

  • Our contract with the owners of the building, Toadal Fitness, is signed!

  • Our support already includes commitments from local businesses (George Ow & William Ow, and New Leaf Community Markets) to support the campaign financially.

  • Our meetings with the Board of Santa Cruz Community Farmers Market continue, and we are excited that they are taking ownership of the piece by contributing and helping us to shape the message on the first panel of the mural.

  • Local, regional, and even national political figures, have expressed their gratitude and support for Food Love! 

A personal goal of M. Sophia Santiago's is to invite First Lady, Michelle Obama, to visit the Farmers Market and see one of the ripple effects of her Lets Move! Program in Action. 


The Visionary Path to Fruition :
This Mural Project is dedicated to Congressman Sam Farr's many contributions to our Community over the decades of his service. Before Sam retires this year wouldn't it be fine to see Sam Farr standing with the First Lady at the Food Love Wall in 2016.  Both Sam Farr and myself have lobbied for the Invitation to Michelle Obama to visit the Central Coast since 2009. Have faith this Campaign will help bring it about!

~M. Sophia Santiago
story_txt:
What is Food Love?



Food Love / Alimento Y Amor, a nourishing bi-lingual book, is about to become a vibrant mural in the heart of downtown Santa Cruz. 

Three elegant images, with compelling text in French, English, and Spanish, will enrich and beautify our canvas - the currently blank wall facing the lively Downtown Santa Cruz Farmer's Market.


Led by the author and creator of Food Love/Alimento Y Amor, M.Sophia Santiago, the mural project is brought to you buy a team of passionate, skilled art professionals, painters, students, community art-lovers and supporters! 

Know who else we need on the team?  YOU.



Art Matters!

Another mural downtown? YES! One that includes the community in the making,  illustrating the viability of a creative economy of, and by, the community.

During the production of the mural, Food Love/Alimento Y Amor supports artists and shows one pathway to young people considering a career as an artist. Led by muralist and Santa Cruz native Elijah Pfotenhauer, five students from his high school mural program and a Cabrillo College art student will be hired and paid to paint the 60-foot-long mural along with him, a prime example of the Santa Cruz's creative economy in action!


Once it's up on the wall, Food Love/Alimento Y Amor reminds those who come in contact with the message, of the farm-to-table journey their food takes, and encourages healthy choices for our community. The multi-lingual content is inclusive and welcoming to all ages, so the message and beauty will not be lost on even the little ones!

While we are thrilled to have received the blessing on the City of Santa Cruz City Council and Arts Commission, funding for Food Love/Alimento Y Amor funding will come from individuals and businesses like yours, giving the community "Ownership" of the project, and the pride of being a tangible part of the team.







What its Going to Take, and What We are Ready to Give.

 Let's face it, your financial contributions are vital to the success of this project! So, please, contribute money at any level -- because this will be the CooLest Thing you Do all Week!
A financial commitment of $5-500 is just one way to help! Be part of our team by writing, producing, sharing, posting, liking, painting, showing up, eating, and asking other folks to join in the campaign.
While our team members have each volunteered countless hours in the arts locally, they also earn their living in the arts: teaching, photographing, modeling, administrating, painting - you get the idea.  Our plan for the project includes a real-world budget that supports the artists and arts professionals involved. 



If we reach our funding goal, we'll give 70% of it to the artists, students, and professionals that created, administered and produced the piece! (Don't fret! If we don't reach our entire goal, the mural can still proceed, but our creative team will all be donating part of their time. Your contribution will be put to use in the production of this piece, no matter what!)


10% of the $13,300 budget is for paint and other supplies, as well as wall cleaning and preparation costs.


5% goes back to IndieGogo. We couldn't do it without them as part of the team!


And the rest pays for the perks! (We're working hard to be sure the perks are fabulous, but still keep the budget down. If we exceed our goal, you can bet those gourmet perks will be among the best you've ever tasted!)



What perks, you ask?


Snack and Appetizer supporters will get Food Love Buttons and copies of the books in English and Spanish, respectively.



How about a gourmet picnic lunch for Brown Bag level donors? You'll come to the mural inaugural launch with other cool people who feel the Food Love - on a Wednesday Farmers' Market day.


At the Fine Dining level, you get access to The Curated Feast, complete with custom cocktail and copies of Food Love. What is The Curated Feast? Liz Birnbaum combines her love of food, art and history as she tells her dinner guests the stories behind their meal. 


For those at Banquet level, VIP entry to the Curated Feast is Guaranteed! Complete with maître d's access to the chef's recipes, and a gourmet goody bag courtesy of the Santa Cruz Community Farmers Market.  AND your name or logo goes on the mural.

And contributers at the Underwriter level will simply support the mural without reward of perks, because that's what patrons of the Arts do!  But you WILL have your name or company logo featured prominently on the mural dedication and credits.



   
Can't take us up on our delicious perks, but still want to be on the team? Great!  It's so simple:



Share the Food Love Indiegogo Campaign with an art-loving or farmer's-marketing Friend or Network.


Blog, post or tweet, #FoodLove #AlimentoYAmor - Let the World know why YOU support Food Love! 


Then give yourself a BIG THANK YOU for taking your precious time to watch, to consider, and to CLICK.


Our Team is Ready to Roll
 


Our contract with the owners of the building, Toadal Fitness, is signed!


Our support already includes commitments from local businesses (George Ow & William Ow, and New Leaf Community Markets) to support the campaign financially.


Our meetings with the Board of Santa Cruz Community Farmers Market continue, and we are excited that they are taking ownership of the piece by contributing and helping us to shape the message on the first panel of the mural.


Local, regional, and even national political figures, have expressed their gratitude and support for Food Love! 



A personal goal of M. Sophia Santiago's is to invite First Lady, Michelle Obama, to visit the Farmers Market and see one of the ripple effects of her Lets Move! Program in Action. 

The Visionary Path to Fruition : This Mural Project is dedicated to Congressman Sam Farr's many contributions to our Community over the decades of his service. Before Sam retires this year wouldn't it be fine to see Sam Farr standing with the First Lady at the Food Love Wall in 2016.  Both Sam Farr and myself have lobbied for the Invitation to Michelle Obama to visit the Central Coast since 2009. Have faith this Campaign will help bring it about!~M. Sophia Santiago

story:
Your Soup Flavored Blankets Staff

We're a multifarious crew of friends from Los Angeles, Reno, Chicago and New York who share a passion for soup and service. The SFB story stems from a brief moment many, many years ago, far beyond Black Rock City's Esplanade, on a frigid deep playa evening. There, gazing at the brothtaking sky and discussing the soupernatural, sat our founder, Noodles and his brother, Max. Although initially vibrant and jovial, their topic of discussion soon shifted to the bitter cold air and a desire for simple pleasures.

"I could sure go for a blanket right now. You know, warm me up from the outside in." Max remarked as he shivered in the deepest of deep playa.

"I could go for a bowl of soup to warm me up from the inside out!" Noodles replied.

Now what followed may be the worst idea ever uttered as Max suggested: "How about a bowl of blanket flavored soup?"

In a harsh tone, Noodles replied: "That's sounds disgusting! Who want's to eat soup that tastes like blankets!?"

Hours passed and their situation worsened. But suddenly, a dusty thought shot out of the Man's neon head, blew across the playa, swirled around the temple walls and shot directly into Noodles's noggin as an idea of spectacular brilliance.

"Some Soup Flavored Blankets, now that would be warmly delicious!" He proclaimed.

Max agreed! And the two brothers jumped to their feet, crossed the cold desert floor and returned to camp to procrastinate for seven years.

As veteran burners we understand the significance of your trash fence quest and the sometimes difficult elements you encounter. Soup Flavored Blankets is a warm soupy refuge and our gift to the many wandering souls of Burning Man.

 

Your Soup Flavored Blankets Experience

The jumbo-sized inflatable SFB can emits light and serves as a navigational aid for all the weary travelers. Directly across from the soup can exists an equally huge SFB Premium Cracker box. Inside, participants will find an assortment of delicious ready-made soup and hot beverage mixes as well as access to boiling water.

After treating yourself to the tastiest soup in Black Rock City, choose a blanket and carefully place your mug of soup into the provided pouch. Begin to wrap your shivering body inside the insulating blanket. You are now comfortably snuggled inside a Soup Flavored Blanket, slurp on wandering souls!

But remember: You eat the soup, you take the moop!

 

Soup Flavored Blankets Asks For Your Help

Your tax-deductible donation goes 100% to procuring transportation, repairs, materials, storage and of course, soup! The Soup Flavored Blankets staff is all-volunteer with a commitment to enhancing your deep playa adventures. You can also help us spread the SFB campaign! Follow us on Facebook and Instagram. And please, find your way to Soup Flavored Blankets during Burning Man and say hi. Your participation is the greatest support you can offer.

Expenses

Transportation - $3,500

Soup - $2,500

Storage - $1,200

Repairs - $500

Miscellaneous - $300

 

Soup Flavored Blankets Rewards

 

  • $5 - Pour One Out For You, Homie

While at Burning Man 2016, we'll pour a little soup out for you, Homie.

  • $10 - Social Media Shout Out

    A sincere thank you from the SFB crew on Facebook. If you're attending Burning Man 2016, come by the art installation and get a face to face thank you!

  • $15 - Soup Flavored Blankets Stickers

Die-cut, high quality stickers to show your soupport for Soup Flavored Blankets. If you're in attendance at Burning Man 2016, redeem at Soup Flavored Blankets in deep playa. Otherwise, we can mail the stickers after the Burn.

  • $27 - Soup Flavored Blankets Mug & Sticker

Feel the Bern...of our soup! (or wait for it to endorse the establishment soup). This is the average working class burner's contribution to this campaign! Join the Soup Flavored Blankets revolution & receive a mug for all the soupy goodness & stickers to show your support! Redeem at SFB in deep playa. Otherwise, message us if you would like your perks shipped.

  • $50 - Soup Flavored Blankets Signature Postcard

Come sign the Soup Flavored Blankets giant cracker box, otherwise we'll sign it for you. Then we'll take a picture of it and create a one-of-a-kind postcard to send to all the contributors at this level. If you're in attendance at Burning Man 2016, stop by Soup Flavored Blankets in deep playa for an extra perk. Your name is your password.

  • $75 - Soup Flavored Blankets Spoon

A real functioning spoon etched with our logo.  Redeem at Soup Flavored Blankets art installation in deep playa and receive an additional secret gift! Please message us if you need spoon to be shipped.

  • $150 - Soup Flavored Blankets VIP Treatment

Cut the line & come into our VIP section for a 2-course instant meal. Soup starter and a hearty, hot instant dinner to follow. Redeem at our art installation in deep playa. Your name is your password. Note: Perk can ONLY be redeemed if contributor is in attendance at Burning Man 2016.

  • $250 - Soup Flavored Blanket

An official Soup Flavored Blanket made from a high quality blanket, complete with soup/beverage pouch as well as an SFB mug and sticker to go in it. Redeem during Burning Man at SFB installation in deep playa for an additional secret gift. Your name is your password. Otherwise, we can ship items.

  • $500 - Soup Flavored Blankets Private Dining For 4

For one night only, reserved seating for 4 with secret menu access, SFB mugs, utensils, blankets, and waiter service. Redeem at Soup Flavored Blankets installation in deep playa. Your name is your password. Note: Perk can ONLY be redeemed if contributor is in attendance of Burning Man 2016.

  • $1000 - Soup Flavored Blankets Soup Master

For one night only, join the SFB staff & help us work the window. We will outfit you with your very own SFB chef's coat & afterwards, we'll send you off with a SFB blanket, mug, & spoon. Redeem at SFB in deep playa. Your name is your password. Initiation rituals may be endured. ONLY redeemable if contributor is in attendance of Burning Man 2016.

  • $5,000 - Soup Flavored Blankets LA, SF or Reno Soup Party​

The SFB staff will prepare and host a soup party for up to 10 at your lovely home. Agreed upon date between October 2016 - July 2017. Limited to contributors within a 50 mile radius of either Los Angeles, San Francisco or Reno. All SFB merchandise included. Soupy good times to be had by all!

  • $8,000 - Soup Flavored Blankets Anywhere USA Dinner Party​

The SFB staff will prepare and host a dinner party for up to 10 at your lovely home. Agreed upon date between October 2016 - July 2017. All SFB merchandise included. Soupy good times to be had by all!

  • $20,000 - Soup Flavored Blankets Anywhere On Earth Dinner Party

The SFB staff will prepare and host a dinner party for up to 10 people at your lovely home or a location of your choosing. Agreed upon date between October 2016 - July 2017. All SFB merchandise included. Soupy good times to be had by all!

Be a Souper Hero!

​*We are unable to create a shipping/pick up option which is why we are offering a secret gift to those contributors who choose to collect their perks at Soup Flavored Blankets. We apologize for the shipping charge inconvenience if you pick up on playa.

Thank you so much for all of your continued support. See you soon!

Follow us on Facebook & Instagram
