story:
I'm an illustrator from Birmingham, AL who loves horror, humor, and crazy characters.

Do you love any of those?  This may be your cup of tea!

The "Mag and Pen" series, targeted mainly more towards youngins but definitely not lacking amusement for everyone else, already has about nine separate books already written out.This particular one, "Spring Cleaning," follows the two creaturesque besties as Mag explains what horrors await Pen if she doesn't clean her nasty house up.... something I know I definitely try to teach my crazy-brained child on a regular basis.

Nine books are already written. This is the first to be fully illustrated! ....and the next release, which is significantly longer and features ALL of the main cast, is already sketched and awaiting its glorious color to bring it to life!

The purpose of this campaign is to help fund the printing of the first book, and honestly, any little bit helps! (But the perks are a huge plus for you guys, right?)

The book is fully ready and illustrated and good to go, but includes quite a nice little deposit to get that ISBN and the initial printing expenses taken care of. After the minimum order size is completed, everything becomes significantly more affordable and way more focus can be directed towards finishing the illustrations for the second book.

For any contributions made towards this project whatsoever, EVERY LAST BIT (even if the goal isn't reached) will be dedicated towards the initial printing and publishing fees. Not a single penny will go anywhere else than besides to the creation of the physical copies of the "Mag and Pen: Spring Cleaning" book.

For most contributions, you will have the options for perks like character prints, stickers, etc. For the heavy-hitters, I'll even include a portion on my main website for top contributors to this and any other projects that may be listed on this funding website in the future. There's something for everybody!


TIME FOR THE NITTY-GRITTY:

What happens when the goal is hit? Or what happens if it isn't reached?

Any contribution at all is appreciated more than you can imagine! What happens if the goal is reached? The printing process can happen IMMEDIATELY once the goal is obtained, but if not, any funds will go towards that deposit anyway, and there will just be a slightly longer release date than hoped for. This project is literally ready-to-go, I just can't personally devote the full deposit amount at this exact point in time, so why not let the supporters chip in and get some cool rewards in the process? Win-win for everyone, and you'll forever have my eternal gratitude. :)


So it this a kid's book, or an adult book with kid characters?

As a parent, as especially one of a child with peculiar interests, I appreciate a break from the generic hero and princess and child-learning-a-lesson stories once in a while. This project takes that and turns it into something tangible. Everything in the story is fully child-safe and won't break your kid, but it's loaded with silliness and unusual characters (a unicorn girl and a stitched-up, zombie-like boy? yeah...), but still keeps it short, funny, and occasionally has a discreet lesson in it, like the importance of cleaning your room (or in the next book-- the importance of taking care of your pets so they don't accidentally get unleashed and terrorize the town!). But yeah, no profanity, no actual legit mature themes, etc. Totally fine for kids of all ages, but definitely a breath of fresh air for parents with slightly 'alternative' interests, if you catch my drift!


How much of a book will I be investing in?

This first book is actually the shortest of the ones written, but has landed close to about 14 pages total. The others are significantly longer and have more complex and silly storylines spreading over much more space, but since this was the first, I kept it more to the point to see how the overall project was received. If this is as much of a success as I'm hoping it to be, I'm throwing myself full-time into getting the other books in the series entirely completed! Otherwise, they'll still be ongoing projects, but will take longer to produce while I continue to work on other projects equally alongside 'em.


I want to support this project, but I can't contribute anything financially! :(

And hey, that's totally okay! You know what helps just as much? Just share the link and help promote the campaign and the book, and that's fantastic! If you're on instagram or twitter, I'll totally even give you a shoutout because just helping to spread the word is a hugehugehugehuge help, and I appreciate it a ton!


What about this "InDemand" thing that keeps going after the campaign goal is reached?

I've selected this option for anyone who wants to contribute further, and all additional funds will be used strictly for producing extra copies of the book or go towards the expenses of printing the second book! All contributions FOR THIS PROJECT will be used strictly FOR the "Mag & Pen" series, no personal profit will be made from this except for from sales of the actual copies of the book itself.

story:
Short Summary

Nearly twenty-five years ago, letters, papers, and ephemera from the Estate of Monroe Wheeler, director of exhibitions and publications at the Museum of Modern Art from 1939 through 1967, were stored in carton boxes in an attic and nearly forgotten. One of the boxes contained Christmas cards sent to Monroe Wheeler by some of the most significant American, European and South American artists of his time during his tenure at MoMA. They were unique  handmade or limited edition cards - artworks essentially - sent by artists such as Ben Shahn, Robert Andrew Parker, Jean Cocteau, Roberto Montenegro, Georges Braque, Marc Chagall, Herbert Bayer, Rufino Tamayo, Bruno Munari and Leonard Baskin. The cards were so astounding when we uncovered them that we wanted to share their unique beauty - and the history of the artists' relationships with Monroe Wheeler - by publishing a book, which would honor his legacy as a lover of typography and publisher of fine books as well as his influence on artists' careers and museum publications design.

With the costs of high-quality book publication, your help is needed to fund the production of this book.  In appreciation we are offering distinctive perks from Monroe Wheeler's archive - as well as the book itself - so that we can share with you some of the history it contains.


About the book

The book will be published by Daylight Books in an edition of 1,000 copies and will be distributed in the United States. Conceived and edited by Vincent Cianni, the 96-page book (including text) will measure 10 x 8" and contain approximately 50 handmade or limited edition Christmas cards by an array of artists from the United States, Europe, Mexico and South America that will be reproduced as close to the their original size with two facsimile pieces laid in on the inside of the front and back covers. The cover will be based on an image by Alexander Calder from a Christmas card that was sent by Galerie Aimé Maeght to Monroe Wheeler (see below) and evokes the idea of Christmas. In addition, 'Sandy' Calder and Monroe were close friends and frequent collaborators from their time in Paris and Monroe's publication of THE FABLES OF AESOP, by Harrison of Paris, which included fifty drawings by Calder as illustrations.  Their collaboration and friendship continued throughout the decades while Monroe was Director of Publications and Exhibitions at The Museum of Modern Art.

 

© 2016 Calder Foundation, New York / Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York

On the front will be a facsimile of Monroe Wheeler's 1937 Christmas card, originally printed on handmade Guarro paper with Glenway Wescott's eloquently-written "New Jersey Farm Christmas Images" inserted. The second facsimile is Bruno Munari's playful 1957 'violin' Christmas greeting to Mr. Wheeler. 

                               

If enough funds are raised in the campaign, we will also be able to reproduce some of the cards as gatefolds or French folds of some of the most unique and masterful Christmas cards in the archive. This is a flexible funding campaign meaning if we don't reach our intended goal, we still receive the contributions made, however with more contributions, we can do more with the design.)

                 

                 Pierre Le-Tan

                 

                 Ben Shahn

                   

                   Bernard Waldman

The book will also include an essay by Allen Ellenzweig and a forward by Joseph Scott. In addition, biographical sketches of the artists whose works are reproduced in the book will establish their relationship with Mr. Wheeler during his tenure at MoMA. Finally, a brief account of Monroe Wheeler's career at MoMA . 

Daylight Books is a non-profit organization dedicated to publishing uniquely collectible art and photography books exploring the relationship between art, photography, and the world-at-large. The book will be designed by Ursula Damm, who along with Daylight has received numerous design awards and inclusion on prestigious "Top 10" lists for their titles.

Vincent Cianni, Newburgh, NY, is a documentary photographer, teaches at Parsons, The New School for Design in NYC and has authored two books, including Gays in the Military, published by Daylight Books in 2014. He is the archivist for the Monroe Wheeler Archive.

Allen Ellenzweig, New York, NY, is an arts critic currently preparing a biography of the photographer George Platt Lynes for Oxford University Press.  He is a contributing writer to the Gay & Lesbian Review Worldwide, teaches in the Writing Program at Rutgers University, New Brunswick, New Jersey and is a founding board member of The Robert Giard Foundation.

Joseph Scott IV, Philadelphia, PA, became caretaker of the Manhattan apartment of Monroe Wheeler in 1990 and assisted with organizing and preserving this important archive.  His work continues today, as executor for Anatole Pohorilenko, cataloging the remaining material in the Monroe Wheeler Archive.


The Impact

The book project can be seen as a way of reintroducing Monroe Wheeler to a larger audience. Relatively unknown now, his work at the Museum of Modern Art helped shape the way we understand the day-to-day operations of an art museum in terms of fundraising, exhibitions, publications and book design. His position as Director of Publications and Exhibitions laid the groundwork for for the development of museum exhibition catalogs and monographs. His book designs were recognized as the highest quality of their kind at the time. In addition, Monroe Wheeler conceived, developed and expanded MoMA's greeting card sales, now recognized as some of the most unique cards on the market today. This work, along with his association with many recognized artists of his time, will be preserved with the production of this book of Christmas cards that he received from them over the years. 


What We Need & What You Get

Expenses

  • The money that needs to be raised is $43, 670.00. 
  • All the funds go solely toward the production of the book regardless of how much is raised.
Expenses include: 
1. Publication costs: book design including alternate designs, complete layout and typesetting, two correction runs, image size adaptations, print-proofing, copy editing, proof reading of texts and PDFs, printing, print supervision, and binding. ($32,670)
2. Pre-press scanning and print-ready images of the artwork provided to publisher for the reproduction of the cards ($2,500)
3. Reproduction fees (fees from artists, artist estates or agencies representing artists' estates to reproduce the artwork/cards in the book. ($3,000)
4. Research assistant/intern (2) for researching biographical information on the artists, initial scanning and photographing of images for design. ($2,500)
5. Writing fees, i.e. essays. ($1500)
4. Shipping costs of books from printer/publisher. ($1,500)
Total costs (not including studio rental and time):  $43,670.00


Perks (what you get for your contribution)

(Please see our Facebook page for hints on the Secret Perk: https://www.facebook.com/MWChristmasCards/)
$5 level - Monroe Wheeler Note Card #1

$10 level - Monroe Wheeler Note Card #2

$20 level - The Xmas Card Perk (two samples, other cards will vary)

           

$25 level - Monroe Wheeler Stationery

$30 level - Monroe Wheeler and Guarro Casas stationery

$40 level - Monroe Wheeler New York

$50.00 level - The Season's Greetings book


$75 level - Christmas and Saul Steinberg

$100 level - Christmas and MoMA

$250 level - Christmas and Monroe Wheeler 1

$400 level - Christmas and Monroe Wheeler 2

$750 level - Christmas and Monroe Wheeler 3


$1000 level - Christmas and Monroe Wheeler 4

$1500 level - Christmas and Monroe Wheeler 5

$2000 level - Christmas and Monroe Wheeler 6

$4000 level - Christmas, Monroe Wheeler and Ben Shahn


Risks & Challenges

The risks for producing this book are minimal, yet the cost of producing a book of such great quality does not come cheap. Even though Monroe Wheeler is relatively unknown and funding for this book is its biggest challenge, the book is now in its design stage and will be published by October 2016 in time for the Christmas holiday season. Therefore, what is at stake is the reproduction of the facsimiles on the front and back of the book as well as the ability to reproduce some of the cards as gatefolds or French folds. This will determine the success of the book as a unique gift for book lovers, art lovers, those who are familiar with the life and work of Monroe Wheeler as well as a mainstream audience. Its placement in museum stores and specialty shops will insure its success.

It is a very tight deadline and not reaching the goal may impact the time and energy needed to complete the project, as well as other relying on alternate funding sources to fund it. Since the book will be printed in China, this may impact the delivery of the books in October, but since all the pre-production work is done, we can work fast once the funding goals are reached. We see the books arriving no later than early November.

In the past I have produced several books and have published with Daylight Books, who themselves have an excellent track record. Everyone involved with the project has experience in book publishing and this is the best way to minimize risk: working with first-rate production people who know how to get things done.

Thanks to our IndieGoGo backers, funding won’t be the obstacle that it usually is. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Contributions at all levels are welcome and appreciated. However, we know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you cannot help:

  • Please get the word out by forwarding this campaign to your friends and people who you know would be interested in the historical aspect as well as the design and gift quality
  • Indiegogo has provided easy-to-use sharing tools to save time. Please use them to help us reach our goal. 

The stated goal is the minimum needed to cover expenses and ensure publication of this book. Please keep in mind that there are also additional costs, such as fees that Indiegogo charges and the time and costs of managing and shipping the rewards.

With your help, we will succeed.  And finally.......

The Life of Monroe Wheeler: 

Monroe Wheeler was director of publications and exhibitions at the Museum of Modern Art from the year 1939 until his retirement in 1967.  He was born in Evanston, Illinois on February 13th, 1899 and began his printing career in 1919 after receiving a small printing press as a gift from his father, a bookbinder and bibliophile.  Among the first titles he published were small chap books of poetry including work by writers he had met as a young man in Chicago: Mark Turbyfill (The Living Frieze, 1921), Yvor Winters (The Immobile Wind, 1921), and Glenway Wescott (The Bitterns, 1920), whom he met in 1919 at the University of Chicago's Poetry Club.  (Wescott would become Wheeler's long-time companion.)

In 1923 in New York City under the imprint Manikin Press, Monroe Wheeler also published chapbooks by William Carlos Williams (Manikin Number Two, GoGo) and Marianne Moore (Marriage, Manikin: Number Three). Soon after he and Wescott went to London and traveled with American expatriate and French literati friends through Europe, primarily in Germany and France, including Paris and Villefranche-sur-Mer on the French Riviera. Wheeler eventually settled in Paris with Glenway Wescott and the young photographer George Platt Lynes, who would become Wheeler's lover. It was in Paris that Wheeler began friendships with artistic and literary figures, such as Jean Cocteau and Gertrude Stein.  He established hi imprint Harrison of Paris with close friend Barbara Harrison, who eventually married Wescott's younger brother, Lloyd. Harrison of Paris created beautiful, limited edition books with fine bindings sold at moderate prices and published 13 books in the four years that it was in business, with titles such as A Sketch of My Life, the first English translation of Thomas Mann’s autobiography, Janet Flanner's Songbook,  the first edition of Glenway Wescott’s novella The Babe's Bed and A Calendar of Saints for Unbelievers, as well asThe Fables of Aesop According To Sir Roger L’Estrange with 50 drawings by Alexander Calder. While producing The Fables of Aesop, Wheeler worked closely with Calder and established a close relationship, both professionally and personally, that would last a lifetime. (Calder was also a frequent guest at parties thrown by Wheeler and Wescott.)

In 1935 Wheeler, Wescott, and Lynes  returned to the United States setting up homes in various New York City apartments and in New Jersey, where they would spend weekends at Stone-Blossom and Hay-Meadows.  That same year Monroe Wheeler became a guest curator and a member of the library committee at the Museum of Modern Art. He was appointed to his permanent position as Director of Publications in 1939 and as its first Director of Exhibitions in 1940. During his tenure at MoMA, Wheeler organized the exhibition programs and oversaw the publication of over 300 titles, defining the standards for museum catalogues and monographs that still exist today. Their scholarship, layout, and design won awards as high quality visual art books. Wheeler also authored many of the essays for artist monographs, including Henri Matisse, Chaim Soutine and Georges Rouault. Under his leadership, MoMA began production of Christmas cards, with early contributors such as Saul Steinberg, Bruno Munari and Ben Shahn. (In 1950, Wheeler wrote Nelson A. Rockefeller that the Christmas cards had been so profitable that MoMA would begin producing blank greeting cards year-round.) 

During his tenure at MoMA, Monroe Wheeler forged relationships with many popular artists of the time. Herbert Bayer and he created exhibits such as the Road to Victory in 1942 and Airways to Peace in 1943. He also worked with Mexican artists Miguel Covarrubias and Roberto Montenegro on the exhibit Twenty Centuries of Mexican Art. It was the largest comprehensive exhibit on Mexican art to date.

During World War II, Wheeler served as Chairman of the Committee on Publications for the Office of Inter-American Affairs under Nelson A. Rockefeller and in 1969 was appointed Cultural Advisor of Latin America. He continued to run the Exhibitions and Publications departments and oversaw all of the Museum's outreach programs, including education, traveling exhibitions, and the library until his retirement in 1967. After his retirement, he served as a member of the International Council and remained actively involved with the Museum of Modern Art. In early 1988, months before his death, the Museum dedicated a reading room in the Prints and Illustrated Books Galleries to honor his dedication and contributions.

Along with - and mostly separate from - his professional career, Monroe Wheeler continued to develop close relationship with artist friends in New York City, continuing to be supportive of both Glenway Wescott (they remained together until Wescott's death in 1986) and George Platt Lynes until his death in 1955, even after Lynes dissolved the relationship with the two in 1943.  In addition Wheeler's far-reaching influence was well-documented through his life-long friendships with artists such as Pavel Tchelitchev, Paul Cadmus, Jared French and George Tooker. 

But it was with his private publications and his work at MoMA that Monroe Wheeler left his greatest legacy as a book designer and publisher, an esteemed typographer and a leadership that guided the Museum through its early years to become the most significant and important museum to champion modern art.
story_txt:
Short Summary Nearly twenty-five years ago, letters, papers, and ephemera from the Estate of Monroe Wheeler, director of exhibitions and publications at the Museum of Modern Art from 1939 through 1967, were stored in carton boxes in an attic and nearly forgotten. One of the boxes contained Christmas cards sent to Monroe Wheeler by some of the most significant American, European and South American artists of his time during his tenure at MoMA. They were unique  handmade or limited edition cards - artworks essentially - sent by artists such as Ben Shahn, Robert Andrew Parker, Jean Cocteau, Roberto Montenegro, Georges Braque, Marc Chagall, Herbert Bayer, Rufino Tamayo, Bruno Munari and Leonard Baskin. The cards were so astounding when we uncovered them that we wanted to share their unique beauty - and the history of the artists' relationships with Monroe Wheeler - by publishing a book, which would honor his legacy as a lover of typography and publisher of fine books as well as his influence on artists' careers and museum publications design.
With the costs of high-quality book publication, your help is needed to fund the production of this book.  In appreciation we are offering distinctive perks from Monroe Wheeler's archive - as well as the book itself - so that we can share with you some of the history it contains.





About the book

story:
Help me reach my goal of 16,000! 

I want to send a special shout out to all who have been helping for The Exit Fairytale of Suicide. I cannot do it with you all. Insurance and marketing costs are covered so I am now stepping into casting calls/auditions for the film! 

Again, there is no deadline for this fundraising campaign so you can donate and contribute in any forms for this participative project that goes far beyond art. I am currently contacting suicide prevention organizations to create a bigger-scaled project so please write me at annina@anninaroescheisen.com if you would like to collaborate...  

One love to you all! And stay tuned! More news to come from me! The journey has just started...


Other ways you can help

If you can't donate at this time, you can still help by spreading the word on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or by sharing directly from Indiegogo. Or if you know anyone who would be interested in funding a project like this, please let me know! Anything helps... Thank you very much! 


The unique and very talented American singer-songwriter David Hykes will be collaborating on Roescheisen's new piece of videoart The Exit Fairytale of Suicide

I am very thrilled to announce that the famous American singer-songwriter David Hykes will compose the film soundtrack! He made pieces for “Baraka,” and “The Tree of Life,” and for many other films... He is currently composing for the famous American film director Terrence Malick. David Hykes is also a teacher of contemplative music and meditation, and media artist. He directs the Harmonic Presence Foundation which since 1981 has explored resonant relationships between mind, music, and the medicine of healing harmonization. His work has been honored by UNESCO, the National Endowment for the Arts, the Rockefeller Foundation, the New York State Council on the Arts, the Edwards Art Fund, the Threshold Foundation and the Flying Elephants Foundation. For more information about him, please visit www.harmonicpresence.org.



I have always emphasized the role of music in literally underscoring the content of my videos. Music opens up our subconscious, bypassing the intellect and reconnecting us with our hearts and true emotions. The Exit Fairtytale of Suicide will use meditative music taking inspiration from chanting monks, repeated mantra sounds and drum beats. 


Meet the artist 

My name is Annina Roescheisen, I am half German, half Slovenian and  I recently moved to Brooklyn, NY. I work as a multimedia artist, using different types of media: video, photography, installations and sculptures. My work makes use of visual metaphors to tackle general subjects on human relationships, behaviors, communication, as well as childhood topics, traumata, fairytale issues and their symbolism among other things, often related to spiritual transformation. Nourished by an imagery of ancient centuries, I try to translate my ideas by a specific visual and symbolic language, emphasizing on emotions, and sensitivity. 

http://www.anninaroescheisen.com


About the film

The Exit Fairytale of Suicide deals with the topic of suicide in a very direct, yet poetic and symbolic way. It confronts us with a painful reality - that of a possible dead man whose suicidal thoughts silently haunt him. The film is divided into three main scenes, spinning back and forth between them, representing on the one hand different life stages (childhood) and on the other hand, different inner experiences. 


Hopelessness and sadness; self hate, self-mutilation and a vain sense of life. This is the hard cocktail that makes you want to kill yourself. There are different varieties of suicidal thought. Some people throb on the surface with black thoughts, yet never take action. Others go much deeper and unfortunately don’t manage to stand up again. Some fail, while others want to fail. In the end it’s often a cry for help, but sometimes no one hears you or seems to want to hear you. It’s like losing your voice, losing everything, losing your very self.


“La tristesse dura toujours  {the sadness will last forever}“ - Vincent van Gogh


I want to rebuild a voice throughout "The Exit Fairytale of Suicide". I want to make people more aware of the topic of suicide and its presence in our today society through art. We all should be able to pay more attention to the alarming signs of our beloved ones because I am you, you are me and we are one! Let's talk about it & give it a voice! 



The film is divided into three main scenes: 

  • The first representing the men at present.
  • A middle scene depicting his inner life through the metaphorical language of vanitas paintings.
  • The third a fantasia of his youth.

As we progress through the film the rhythm accelerates and the three scenes collide, bleeding into one main scene representing the life of the protagonist. I chose a man for the role as I often feel that men are even less open about their emotions, problems and deep scars.

Generally, however, the process is the same, no matter one’s gender identity. Suicide is a truly universal topic. There are no boundaries, and all people from every walk of life are affected.

The first scene shows a man in his mid 40’s/50’s. His face is gaunt; he looks haggard and weary. This scene is nearly pitch-black, filmed like a portrait focusing on the face and eyes. The evolution of his body language and emotions will be highlighted as the film progresses. On a black, slight and textured background, we are immersed in a strong black and white lighting atmosphere.

The second scene shows the knife as a ritual element, displayed as though part of a vanitas still-life painting (referencing the work of 16th and 17th century painters Harmen Steenwyck and Pieter Claesz, among others). A ray of light shines from the side of the image onto a staging of objects; a play of reflections underlines the shapes and the textures of the precisely table-dressed items.

The third scene is a fairytale. A short sequence of the man’s childhood takes place in a magical forest stage design inspired by the Berlin Opera’s portrayal of “Hänsel und Gretel“. We see an 8-year old boy from behind through dense fog. The knife appears in his hands, a simple tool carving wood. Light shines in isolated spots and is very diffuse.
story_txt:
Help me reach my goal of 16,000! 
I want to send a special shout out to all who have been helping for The Exit Fairytale of Suicide. I cannot do it with you all. Insurance and marketing costs are covered so I am now stepping into casting calls/auditions for the film! 

Again, there is no deadline for this fundraising campaign so you can donate and contribute in any forms for this participative project that goes far beyond art. I am currently contacting suicide prevention organizations to create a bigger-scaled project so please write me at annina@anninaroescheisen.com if you would like to collaborate...  
One love to you all! And stay tuned! More news to come from me! The journey has just started...


Other ways you can help
If you can't donate at this time, you can still help by spreading the word on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or by sharing directly from Indiegogo. Or if you know anyone who would be interested in funding a project like this, please let me know! Anything helps... Thank you very much! 


The unique and very talented American singer-songwriter David Hykes will be collaborating on Roescheisen's new piece of videoart The Exit Fairytale of Suicide


I am very thrilled to announce that the famous American singer-songwriter David Hykes will compose the film soundtrack! He made pieces for “Baraka,” and “The Tree of Life,” and for many other films... He is currently composing for the famous American film director Terrence Malick. David Hykes is also a teacher of contemplative music and meditation, and media artist. He directs the Harmonic Presence Foundation which since 1981 has explored resonant relationships between mind, music, and the medicine of healing harmonization. His work has been honored by UNESCO, the National Endowment for the Arts, the Rockefeller Foundation, the New York State Council on the Arts, the Edwards Art Fund, the Threshold Foundation and the Flying Elephants Foundation. For more information about him, please visit www.harmonicpresence.org.




I have always emphasized the role of music in literally underscoring the content of my videos. Music opens up our subconscious, bypassing the intellect and reconnecting us with our hearts and true emotions. The Exit Fairtytale of Suicide will use meditative music taking inspiration from chanting monks, repeated mantra sounds and drum beats. 

Meet the artist 

My name is Annina Roescheisen, I am half German, half Slovenian and  I recently moved to Brooklyn, NY. I work as a multimedia artist, using different types of media: video, photography, installations and sculptures. My work makes use of visual metaphors to tackle general subjects on
human relationships, behaviors, communication, as well as childhood topics, traumata, fairytale issues and their symbolism among other things, often related
to spiritual transformation. Nourished by an imagery of ancient centuries, I try to translate my ideas by a specific visual and symbolic language, emphasizing on emotions, and sensitivity. 
http://www.anninaroescheisen.com


About the filmThe Exit
Fairytale of Suicide deals with the topic of
suicide in a very direct, yet poetic and symbolic way. It confronts us with a
painful reality - that of a possible dead man whose suicidal thoughts silently
haunt him. The film is divided into three main scenes, spinning back and forth
between them, representing on the one
hand different life stages (childhood) and on the other hand, different inner experiences. Hopelessness and sadness; self hate,
self-mutilation and a vain sense of life. This is the hard cocktail that makes
you want to kill yourself. There are different varieties of suicidal thought.
Some people throb on the surface with black thoughts, yet never take action.
Others go much deeper and unfortunately don’t manage to stand up again. Some
fail, while others want to fail. In the end it’s often a cry for help, but
sometimes no one hears you or seems to want to hear you. It’s like losing your
voice, losing everything, losing your very self.
“La
tristesse dura toujours  {the sadness will last forever}“ - Vincent van Gogh
I want to
rebuild a voice throughout "The Exit Fairytale of Suicide". I want to make people more aware of the topic of suicide and its presence in our today society through art. We all should be able to pay more attention to the alarming signs of our beloved ones because I am you, you are me and we are one! Let's talk about it & give it a voice! The film is divided into three main scenes: The first representing the men at present.A middle scene depicting his inner life through the metaphorical language of vanitas paintings.The third a fantasia of his youth.As we progress through the film the rhythm accelerates and the three scenes collide, bleeding into one main scene representing the life of the protagonist. I chose a man for the role as I often feel that men are even less open about their emotions, problems and deep scars.Generally, however, the process is the same, no matter one’s gender identity. Suicide is a truly universal topic. There are no boundaries, and all people from every walk of life are affected.The first scene shows a man in his mid 40’s/50’s. His face is gaunt; he looks haggard and weary. This scene is nearly pitch-black, filmed like a portrait focusing on the face and eyes. The evolution of his body language and emotions will be highlighted as the film progresses. On a black, slight and textured background, we are immersed in a strong black and white lighting atmosphere.The second scene shows the knife as a ritual element, displayed as though part of a vanitas still-life painting (referencing the work of 16th and 17th century painters Harmen Steenwyck and Pieter Claesz, among others). A ray of light shines from the side of the image onto a staging of objects; a play of reflections underlines the shapes and the textures of the precisely table-dressed items.The third scene is a fairytale. A short sequence of the man’s childhood takes place in a magical forest stage design inspired by the Berlin Opera’s portrayal of “Hänsel und Gretel“. We see an 8-year old boy from behind through dense fog. The knife appears in his hands, a simple tool carving wood. Light shines in isolated spots and is very diffuse.

story:
ABOUT ME

I am a direct descendant of a family of photographers that have been active in photography since 1870.
For some time now he dedicates himself to researching the aesthetics of landscapes and to portraying the abstraction of substance and signs, through personal photographic interpretation and creation.
From an article about Alessandro Vasari, published in the magazine “Sguardi on line” – issue n. 4/2002,
on the www.nital.it website (Nikon Italia)
 “When a ray of light falls through a cloudy sky on a dark alley, it can land on any thing: a piece of broken glass on the ground, a torn billboard on a wall or a patch of blond hair. A sunray brings light, enchantment:
it transforms and transfigures.” These words by Hermann Hesse convey the idea of what I feel when I am behind a lens.
I was probably predestined to be a photographer.

Born in Rome as “the actor son of an actor father” of Tuscan origins. My great grandfather left Arezzo for the Eternal City in 1865. In 1870 he opened one of the first studios for the production of art and
architectural photography in Rome , which had become the capital of the kingdom only in 1867.
Since these origins, the Vasari family has always been involved in photography.
I am still today produce photography in the fields of art, architecture, industry, advertising and portraits.
The Studio Fotografico Vasari works are displayed in several international collections, such as the George Eastman House Museum of Photography in Rochester (USA) in the University of Melbourne and Italian Museums Archives (GNAM, Istituto Nationale per la Grafica, Palazzo Venezia Museum, Palazzo Barberini Museum, Galleria Borghese Museum, Galleria Doria Pamphili).

I direct the lenses towards what I feel to be free aesthetic pleasure and I select different subjects, from a landscape to an inanimate detail of an old wall. All of them must have the power of catching my attention and stimulating the click.
Photography as an art form is a constant concern to me. I am convinced that many years of experience are necessary before one can appreciate the beauty of one own art. For this reason, I register and archive my work, showing only a small part of my personal “other” face.

 Exhibitions:

2005  “ Memory of the stones”
Gallery Arteficinterni - Rome ITALY.

2006 “D’ailleurs, c’est toujours les autres qui meurent”, AGAVE  Gallery in Rome Italy.
 
2007 “Orizzonti” Brancaleone Gallery in Rome Italy.

2009 Collettiva a cura di Massagrigia OCCHI ROSSI, Forte Prenestino, Rome ITALY.

2010 Collettiva a cura di Massagrigia, OCCHI ROSSI,Forte Prenestino, Rome Italy.

2011 Collettiva itinerante, 150 Anni Italia.

2012 Collettiva DENTRO DI TE COSA TUA
TORRE BRUCIATA, VIA ANTICA CATTEDRALE, Teramo Italy-By Massagrigia.

2013 Collettiva;Darkroom Project a Muro Leccese, Puglia, Italy.

2014 Collettiva;Darkroom Project, Stutgard, Germany.


THE VASARI PHOTOGRAPHERS

Since 1870 the activity of the Vasari family represents an important contribution to the documentation of Italy  ART over several generations, representing an iconographic memory of recent Italian history. The fundamental moments, which have marked the transformation of the urban landscape of Rome , can be reviewed through the work of five generations of photographers. The views of Rome Capital, Via Nazionale and Piazza Esedra are famous, as are the photograph of the rebuilding of the city during the reconstruction period post World War II, as well as the new Termini main railway station, the construction works for the
1960 Olympic Games, the opera of main artists and architects and the development of churches and museums over the past 100 years of history in Rome. This outstanding documentary patrimony is currently divided between three different funds. Today, a large part of the archive (5,000 21x27 cms glass slides,
plus some in 13x18 cms format) is owned by “Calcografia-Istituto Nazionale per la Grafica” (Via della Stamperia 6 – 00187 Roma, tel. + 39 06-699801/69921454, fax:+39 06-69980229).
The production from 1910 to the 1950 (350,000 articles, both slides and black and white films) was purchased by “Centro Studi e Archivio della Comunicazione” of the University of Parma (Piazzale Pace 7/a – 43100 Parma , tel. +39 0521-270847/270798, fax +39 0521-207125).
The third portion still belongs to the Vasari family private archive, which consists of approximately 40,000 films of various size both b/w and colour. This collection is in continuous development, and includes the Vasari photographic productions from 1950 to the current date.

FOR FURTHER INFORMATION

On line:
www.fotovasari.com
www.alessandrovasari.com

Contacs:
info@alessandrovasari.com
alessandrovasari@gmail.com
phone: 0039 06 3297099
fax: 0039 06 3297099
mobile: 0039 3932805076

ABOUT MY PROJECT

I am currently working on an in depth series of  photographs capturing the amazing beauty of the Ganga's Idols in Kolkata.

Exhibition of n.20 photographies on color prints 70x100 cm. .

This encompasses shooting in Kolkata capturing the beauty of the Idols of this wonderful part of our earth. 

Take a look at those proud, impenetrable eyes towering over you from the pandals. Those eyes will bring the goddess Durga to earth on the day of Chokkhu Daan – when the same eyes are painted on the idol one week before the beginning of Durga Puja annual festival in Kolkata. Goddess Durga, as narrated in the Hindu Mithology, embodies Shatki or divine feminine power. All Gods empowered her in order to destroy the demon Mahishasura who could not be defeated by any man or god. 

The Sanskrit name, Durga, means 'impenetrable' and is the principal form of mother goddess: the goddess of the victory of good over evil. In honor of Durga, Durga Puja festival is celebrated in Kolkata during the period of Navarati (nine nights in Sanskrit). The celebrations continue for 10 days. On the last day, called Dashami (Sanskrit for 10) the idol is immerse in the Ganga waters during the Visarjan (Sanskrit for immersion) pompous celebrations and processions. 

The idol of Goddess Durga has ten hands and stands on the back of a huge lion. She fights with a demon with ten different weapons.

Goddess Lakshmi the goddess of wealth and fortune and Goddess Saraswati the goddess of learning and wisdom stand on each side of Durga. And next to them sit, upon a peacock and a mouse, Kartikeya the god of war and Ganesha the god of wisdom, learning, arts and removal of obstacles.

For 3 days the idols of these gods and goddesses and their mother goddess Durga are worshipped, then  the Puja starts from the seventh day of the moon. On the tenth day of the Hindu calendar the images and idols are immersed in the river waters as the goddess leaves. All idols are luxuriously dressed and decorated in ornaments, some street illuminated with animated lights. During the celebrations the poor are fed and receive handouts. Moreover, in many Puja pandals both rich and poor worship together Durga idols. 

In Kolkata, Durga Pooja 2016 starts on October 1st and ends on October 11.While other parts of India and Nepal celebrate it for 5 days from October 6 to October 11.

There are over 500 Durga Puja Pandals in Kolkata, it is almost impossible to count them. If you'll ever want to visit Kolkata, you should plan your trip during the excitement and splendors of Durga Puja. In the meantime, I hope you will enjoy my photographs. Thank you for your interest and also for your contribution to my exhibition of over 20 images, which, if all goes well, will be exposed in Rome, Italy. 

Namaskar.

story:
Hi, we're Nick Hutton-Jay and Alex Witcombe, from Flywheel Studios, located in the wonderful Comox Valley. Having painted murals all over North America, we have yet to paint one in our own home town! So when the Downtown Courtenay Business Improvement Association expressed interest for a mural, we thought it would be a great opportunity for us to add some colour, culture and heritage to our local streets. The mural will focus on the local contributions of the Leung family, who, for over one hundred years, provided the residents of the Comox Valley with the very best in locally grown produce and community and customer support. We'd love to see you help us honour their presence with a tribute mural, to be located on the side of the Leung's building on 5th St in Courtenay.

Flywheel Studios is cutting our standard mural fees in half for this project, we want to see it happen! Our $20,000 goal will help fund wall prep, paint, supplies and new signage and lighting during the month-long project on over 1000 sqft of wall space. Local printing company Done Creative has designed some gorgeous perks for those who contribute; quality limited edition T-shirts, hats and mugs with vintage Leung's grocery and cafe designs. We will also be painting contributor's names into the mural as a lasting thank you and a select number of contributors can have their portraits painted into the mural as customers of the cafe or shopping at the grocery! All funds contributed will go to creating the mural even if we don't reach our goal.

We at Flywheel have created many world-class murals throughout North America including the recent addition to Campbell River's downtown core, the Discovery Passage underwater mural.  We received outstanding community support for that project and we hope to see that level of enthusiasm and community interest happen again in the Valley with the Leung's heritage mural! Even if you can't contribute financially, we always appreciate a honk and a wave or a nice chat while we're out painting in the community. You can also help us by getting the word out to your friends, family and coworkers. Use good ol' word of mouth or the awesome share tools provided by Indiegogo.

Thank you so much, we look forward to seeing you while we're painting! Check out below for our list of perks.

Sincerely, Nick and Alex


Perk list:

$25 and above:  personal thank you email from us and the Downtown Courtenay Business Improvement Association.

$50 and above: contributor's name artistically hidden in the mural.

$75: vintage-style Leung's logo coffee mug, plus one limited edition Leung's heritage print

$100: your choice of vintage-style Leung's T-shirt or hat, plus one limited edition Leung's heritage print

$500: Perk Package- contributor's name hidden in the mural, one mug, one T-shirt, one hat and full set (4) limited edition Leung's heritage prints

$1000: Your portrait painted in the mural, as either a customer of the cafe or grocery store (limited number available)

story: Thank you for clicking on our "Sweet Tooth" campaign!  One of the most important steps in the production of any film are the costs involved after the film is complete. Proceeds from this campaign will go towards costs involved in Post Production, Sound Design, Musical Score, Film Festival Entries, Press Kits, Promotion & Marketing of the film. Every dollar helps.  We hope to get this short film out to the masses.  It's a psychological horror film with a message that needs to be heard.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Maks. I'm 25 years old. Living in Odessa, Ukraine.
  • It's my dream from 2010 when i have created first successful working prototype, using 200 years old recipe.

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We need about 2500$. This money will be used for making Stormglass solution, buying the vessel for it and some organization/transportation expenses.
  • Recipe is checked! There are about 15 small working models around my city. Time to make it common.

The Impact

  • It is valuable for society as a part of art and good object for observation and relaxation.
  • I have already done the smaller prototype for our "Museum of Interesting Science"
  • If you are asking yourself: "How do i know that it is really working?" - 
    just check - https://www.instagram.com/stormglass_diary/
    or write me an e-mail and i will send you more photos.

Risks & Challenges

  • There is a risk that i will not find the appropriate vessel at once.
    Just more time to spend - and this problem will be solved.
  • I have a reliable source of ingredients, but there can be some delays to find as much as i need.
    And once again - just more time is needed to find required quantity.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can't fund - it is not a problem! I will be glad if you subscribe (https://www.instagram.com/stormglass_diary/) - and share with your friends)
  • Please make more noise about this campaign. Any advertisement will be useful!

Risks & Challenges

There is a risk that i will not find the appropriate vessel at once.Just more time to spend - and this problem will be solved.
I have a reliable source of ingredients, but there can be some delays to find as much as i need.And once again - just more time is needed to find required quantity.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can't fund - it is not a problem! I will be glad if you subscribe (https://www.instagram.com/stormglass_diary/) - and share with your friends)
Please make more noise about this campaign. Any advertisement will be useful!

story:
Local artist Anna Marcantel was recently invited by GardenWalk of Anaheim to paint a mural for the community... With your help, she plans to seize the opportunity to spread a powerful, positive message to all who view it! 

 

The Artist

Anna Marcantel is an abstract artist in Anaheim, California, aspiring to spread joy, positivite energy, and a message of harmony in diversity through eye-catching, powerful art.

Anna has been an artist at heart since the first time her tiny hand could grasp a paintbrush. Through the years, art took a backseat to more practical pastimes, such as becoming employed (don't grow up; its a trap!). After years of holding a variety of jobs merely to pay the bills, she decided it was time to go on a journey of self-exploration. She discovered her true fulfillment came from unleashing her creative energy on canvas and sharing it with anyone and everyone!

In 2016 Anna quit her job waiting tables and dove head-first into the world of a full-time artist. Since then, Anna has been featured as Artist of the Month at Boulevard 574 in Diamond Bar, sold her paintings in markets and fairs throughout Orange County, instructed for Corks & Canvas in GardenWalk, and started her own paint and sip business Paint & Libate.

Her Mission

Anna's paintings often feature bold, bright colors and explore existential motifs. Recently, her creative inspiration has been fueled by the mandala.

In Buddhism the mandala is a circular geometric design symbolizing the infinite expansion of our universe. Mandalas are often used in meditation to achieve a deep connection of one's mind and spirit to the universe and all that exists within it.

I created the Mandala of Unity to promote harmony and togetherness in the most diverse of communities. By painting this mural in GardenWalk of Anaheim, I hope the public will feel a sense of fellowship within their community no matter their gender, orientation, or color. With your help, we can bring this meaningful work of art to life and spread the joy of coming together in peace and comradery!

Anna has been given the opportunity to fill a 16x13 foot wall space right in the middle of the GardenWalk of Anaheim to delight visitors and inspire all who pass by! GardenWalk is a wonderful outdoor dining and entertainment center in the heart of Anaheim next door to the Disneyland Resort. Thousands of tourists pass through every year from all over the world to enjoy the Walk's many shops and restaurants. Locals love it for the Art on The Walk program, where GardenWalk invites local artists to display their work in windows throughout the property and perform live demonstrations at monthly art appreciation events.

The goal is to have the Mandala of Unity completed by January 27th to be debuted at the next big Art on the Walk event!

"In gifting this meaningful work of art to the public, we will be spreading a positive message to our community and thousands of visitors from California to New Zealand, and everywhere in between! Please join me in being a part of this inspiring project!" -Anna

 

 

What You're Funding

By contributing to the Mandala of Unity campaign you are funding:

  • Cost of materials to design and paint the mural including buckets of high quality outdoor paints, spray paint, masks, goggles, brushes, rollers, pans, and tarps
  • Estimated 80 hours spent painting the mural

Perks!

So what's in it for you (besides feeling good about spreading some love and positivity!)?

  • $10: Downloadable/printable mandala coloring pages for all ages! 
  • $15: Set of four 5x7"postcards with the Mandala of Unity printed on front
  • $25: 8x10" artist-signed print of the Mandala of Unity
  • $40: Soft t-shirt in white with black outline of the Mandala of Unity in S, M, L, or XL
  • $60: Black and white tote back with Mandala of Unity design. Size: 19" x 15" x 6"
  • $100: Swag bag! Coloring pages, postcards, 8x10 print, t-shirt + your name under "Made Possible By" painted in the corner of the Mandala of Unity Mural for all to see!
  • $150: Deluxe Swag Bag! Coloring pages, postcards, 8x10 print, t-shirt, cotton tote bag + your name on the mural
  • $175: Framed original watercolor and gouache painting of the Mandala of Unity + your name on the mural
  • $250: An original mandala designed and painted by Anna just for you! Acrylic painting on a 16x20" stretched canvas + your name on the mural
  • $350: The original Mandala of Unity acrylic painting on 30x40" stretched canvas + your name on the mural
  • $500: Private lesson!* Anna will guide you and up to two of your friends through steps to create your own intricate mandala pen drawing in the comfort of your home. Includes one Deluxe swag bag + your name on the mural

*2 hour session includes supplies. Location must be within 15 miles of Anaheim.

story:
What is our installation all about? The idea to create this installation was born out of the platonic solids within sacred geometry. The main focal point of our installation is a dodecahedron (that wizardly wonderful shape suspended in the picture above).  Our team has manifested the mesmerising dodecahedron into a modern space and created the wonderful ALAYA. It will mesmerise you from above (5 metres to be exact) and dazzle you from down below, where we will map out the shape of Metatron’s Cube on the floor below. When creating the installation we will focus on using materials that are sustainable and ethically sourced: sustainable art is a core value of our collective. It will house a solar panel on its peak and additional solar lights on each supporting leg enabling it to illuminate at night without electricity, truly off the grid. Our installation is intended to become a storehouse of consciousness and a place of self reflection.  Around each leg pole we will take our visitors through a journey of the platonic solids, to understand the energy created by them and for you to become a part of the energy of the structure itself.  We want you to interact with our art, as we will with you!

What is a DODECAHEDRON you ask? The dodecahedron has 20 faces, 12 vertices and 30 edges. Each face is shaped in the form of a Pentagon. The dodecahedron is linked to the ether, or universe, and works through the higher chakras from the 6th (third eye) 7th (crown), 8th (higher crown) and above. It is also a tool used in meditation as the energy held within this sacred shape can raise your vibration up to facilitate connection to your higher self. Further, it is an expression of life and consciousness, allowing us to go beyond the vibrations of the physical body and to reconnect with the higher vibration of our true nature. 

Who we are? The team building ALAYA is an eclectic mix of artists from South Africa and the UK.

Why are we doing this? Funny you ask. We often question why we put ourselves in baking hot heat, sometimes for weeks on end, being paid nothing, building weird and wonderful structures. And the answer is… to create, to collaborate, to connect, to provoke, to inspire, and most importantly to make people smile. We get a buzz out of it! On this occasion we are creating a space that will be a transit zone of sorts, between different areas of the event, which lights up at night, that provides sound journeys, a spot for meditative thought, a place to dance, to do yoga, to perform or to chill. The experience you have at ALAYA is up to you.

Why collaborate? We want you to be a part of this journey. Your financial help will not only help us bring ALAYA to life but you will enshrine your energy within her. Go on, be an altruistic alchemist (everyone has a little wizard inside them). We ask for any donation, however big or small.

What/When/Where? Come find us at WAKING LIFE arts and music festival 2017 in Crato, Portugal from 17th - 21st August - www.wakinglife.pt. 

Thank you for reading and we hope to see you all at Waking Life!

story:
Hello dear everyone! Hola from Barcelona! I am Anna, a painter, an art-performer and a huge dreamer. I am so much in love with art, culture and theater and discovering the world. I love seeing people smile, I love hugging the trees and I do believe in magic. These days preparing this project (and being very nervous) I asked many of my friends: Tell me what is your biggest dream? - I wish I had moved to Istanbul to live, - I wish I could do some great archaeology investigations. - I truly wish I was an astronaut and landed in some far away star.
And then: But I will never do...                                             But why?... 

¡Hola querid@s!  ¡Saludos desde Barcelona! Soy Anna, pintora, art-performer y una gran soñadora. Estoy enamorada del arte, la música, el teatro y de deambular por el mundo. Me encanta ver a la gente sonreír, me encanta abrazar los árboles y creo en la magia y en las coincidencias. Estos días, preparando este proyecto, he estado muy nerviosa y les he preguntado a mis amigos: Dime ¿cuál es tu sueño más grande? - Ojalá me hubiera mudado a Estambul a vivir, - Ojalá pudiera hacer grandes investigaciones arqueológicas. - Yo desearía ser un astronauta y aterrizar en alguna estrella lejana.
Y luego añaden: Pero nunca lo haré ...                        ¿Pero por qué? ...



KAONI Gallery, Gràcia, Barcelona, Spain, last summer. Art-show. Photo by Marina Castillón.


MY DREAM. I know it is not easy to confess one´s Dream. But I will. Cause I don´t want it to become a phantom from the past when I get older. I will because I might become an example for the others. I will because the money should be the last reason why one abandons the dream like a broken umbrella under the rain... It is silly to say but once being a little girl I saw Dirty Dancing film, I said to myself, I want to dance. I want to do choreography. Maybe from there started my story of creating paintings about the dancers and doing art-performances where the painting leads the dialog with the movement together with music and poetry being as response. 

MI SUEÑO. Sé que no es fácil confesar El Sueño, no lo es. Pero lo haré. Porque no quiero que se convierta en un fantasma del pasado cuando envejezca. Lo haré porque podría ser un ejemplo para los demás. Lo haré porque el dinero debe ser la última razón por la que uno abandona su sueño, como un paraguas roto bajo la lluvia... Pues, es una tontería decirlo pero una vez cuando era niña vi la película Dirty Dancing, y me dije, quiero bailar. Pues sí, quiero bailar y hacer coreografías. Esa es la razón que me lleva a pintar bailarines y hacer eventos multidisciplinares con ellos. 



GRISES art-show in Centre Arts Santa Mónica, Rambles, Barcelona, 2016. Photo by Marina Castillón.


REWARDS FOR YOU. Today I'm offering my sincere gratitude and hundreds of prints, original art-works and other art gifts in exchange for your contribution for me to be able to make an important step in my life - to undertake professional studies of the Interpretation and Dance in Barcelona where I was accepted. It doesn´t mean I will give up painting or art-performing, in contrast I will be much happier, and will be able to enrich my professional background in art-performing and move it to another higher level. I even have an intention to make after a year of studies some beautiful show together with the Nederlands Dans Theater (hope they will like the idea).

RECOMPENSAS. Hoy estoy ofreciendo mi sincera gratitud y cientos de postales, grabados, pinturas originales y otros regalos artísticos a cambio de su contribución de 1 Euro o más para poder dar un paso importante en mi vida - emprender estudios profesionales de La Interpretación y la Danza en una Academia en Barcelona donde aprobé la prueba de acceso. Tomar este paso no significa que renuncie a la pintura, en contraste voy a ser mucho más feliz, y seré capaz de enriquecer mi experiencia profesional en el art-performing y llevar mis proyectos a un nivel superior. Incluso tengo la intención de hacer después de un año de estudios algun hermoso espectáculo junto con el Nederlands Dans Theater (Espero que a ellos les guste la idea).

 


KAONI Gallery , Gràcia, Barcelona, Spain, last summer. Together with Marc Vilajuana and Neus Soler. Art-show. Photo by Marina Castillón.
 

WHERE FUNDS WILL GO TO. The help I get through this page will cover the costs of the studies of 2017-2020 and the registration fee that I have to pay in August (1000 euros plus 2048 euros the first year of studies) and also some money will go for the compliments for painting. Please share "Dance inside. I have a dream." with your friends and family. Every Euro will help my cause and career of making inspirational art. Thank you SO much, I appreciate your time reading me and your infinite kindness! And please, believe in yourself.

ADÓNDE IRÁN LOS FONDOS. La ayuda que obtengo a través de esta página cubrirá los costes de los estudios de 2017-2020 y la cuota de inscripción que tengo que pagar en Agosto (1000 euros plus 2048 euros primer año) y también algo de dinero será para los complementos de pintura. Por favor compartid "Dancing inside. I have a dream" con sus amigos y familiares. Cada Euro ayudará a mi causa y propósito de hacer el arte inspirador. ¡Mil gracias por leerme y apoyarme! ¡Y por favor creed en vosotro@s mismos!

My watercolour featured by Hayden Lee, NY, USA, 2016. The Main Picture of the Project belongs to this talented photographer as well. 
__________________________________________________________________

How does it work: if you wish to make a simple donation, you press BACK IT at the top under my picture. If you wish to have a gift instead, chose the PERK from the list which appears to the right. Art-prints for 20-70 euros or more. Original paintings for 80-3000 euros or more. Once you have it, check my online gallery (link below) and let me know (anna.dart@yahoo.es) which image you love most. The date which is indicated below shows aproximately when the gift will knock your door. You can happily follow my grow through my social media platforms. :)

Cómo funciona esto: si quieres hacer una simple donación, hay que clicar RESPALDAR arriba del todo. Si te apetece tener una RECOMPENSA a cambio, mirar bien la lista que aparece a la derecha y clicar en una de las fichas. Hay art-prints por 20-70 euros o más. Y las pinturas originales por 80-3000 euros o más. La fecha que pone abajo indica cuándo aproximandamente llegará el regalo a tu casita. Elegir la imagen que te gusta más. Esto se puede hacer a través del link que tengo puesto abajo. Es suficiente con mandarme un correo electrónico a anna.dart@yahoo.es. También si estas en Barcelona, es posible ver la obra de arte en directo. Para seguir mi crecimiento luego te espero en mis redes sociales o en mis performances. :) 
__________________________________________________________________


GALLERY ONLINE watercolours / GALERÍA ONLINE acuarelas 
https://annadart.wordpress.com/paintings/


__________________________________________________________________

For any doubts do not hesitate to send me a message in:
Para cualquer duda mándame el mensaje a:
www.facebook.com/annadartpaintings,  instagram @anna_dart,
check who believes in me and my whole CV 
(some part of it you can check in here down below as well as examples of the Art-Prints).

_________________________________________________________________
Thanks you! Gracias! Gràcies! Merci beaucoup ! Danke! Obrigada!
 

CV: Anna Dart



Solo exhibitions & art-performances / Solo exposiciones y actuaciones

“White is red”, 8 July 2017, CC Can Deu, Barcelona. “Serendipity”, 20 June 2017, El Timbal, Barcelona. “The Sun & the Moon”, 19 May 2017, Global Yoga Congress, Barcelona. Improvisation, with CAGE CompAnIE, Paris 6 May 2017, Ciutadella, Barcelona.“White Rose”, 23 April 2017, Soho House Barcelona. Jam Art (with Escarteen Sisters, Jordi Canela &
Cristian Blanxer), 22 December 2016, YogaOne Tusset, Barcelona. “Grises”, 9 November 2016, Arts Santa Mónica, Choreoscope International Festival, Barcelona. “Grises” 21 July – 26 September 2016, Kaoni Gallery. Barcelona. “Sincerely yours” 10 July – 23 Septiembre 2013, Eurostars Bcn Design Hotel 5*, Passeig de Gràcia, Barcelona. “El Silencio”  21 March – 8 April 2013, Hartmann_LaSanta Gallery, Barcelona.“Acuarellas y acuarellos” 19-30 September 2012,
aDa Gallery, Barcelona. 

Group exhibitions & art fairs / Exposiciones colectivas y Ferias de arte

Global Yoga Congress 18- 22 May 2017, Barcelona, Spain. ART.FAIR 27-30 October, 2016, Cologne, Germany. HARTEXPO, International Festival of Contemporary Art, 16-20 July, 2016, Espacio 120, Hospitalet de Llobregat, Spain. Spring Art Show “Salón de primavera” 21-25 May, 2016, Espacio 120, Hospitalet de Llobregat, Spain. ARTBAHO, 19-23 March, 2016, Espacio 120, Hospitalet de Llobregat, Spain. Col.lectiva “Inquietudes”, 4-19 Juny, 2015, Galería ARAGÓN 232, Barcelona, Spain. Rochester Erotic Arts Festival, 10-11 April, 2015, New York, USA. ART.FAIR 24-27 October, 2014, Cologne, Germany – Stand H06 Col·lectiva d’estiu 2014, 18 Juny – 31 July, 2014, Espai B, Barcelona, Spain. Colores de España, 24 Juny-26 Juny, 2014, Clube Militar de Macau – Sala Ho Yin, Macau, China. ART.FAIR 31 October – 4 Noviembre, 2013, Cologne, Germany – Stand C04 Bosom BCN Sping Exhibition, Rising Talents, 12 Junio – 28 Junio 2013, Dee Bee Group Galería, Barcelona, Spain. National Festival of Feminine Art of Spain, 20 March-12 April 2013, Gallery Arago 232, Barcelona, Spain. Col.lectiva de Nadal, 4-20 December 2012, Hartmann_LaSanta Gallery, Barcelona, Spain.

_________________________________________________________________



Art-Print by Anna Dart  "Wine Tasting" (in INDIEGOGO goes without a frame*)



Details on the large Acrylics Painting by Anna Dart Available in INDIEGOGO. Inspired by Lucima Photography.



Details on the Extra Large Acrylics Painting by Anna Dart Available in INDIEGOGO. Portrait of the dancers Giovanna Carimati and Mathias Medina. Inspired by Macarena De Noia Fotografía.

_______________________________________________
Overview. In paintings: Birdy, Clement Louis, Roma Losaberidze among others. Inspiration for the life & art-projects: Ray Bradbury, Milan Kundera, Nederlands Dans Theater, Hofesh Shechter among others. Special thanks to Canva.com. 
The perks are ONLY available in INDIEGOGO by the end of the project (during the AUGUST 2017)***. 
__________________________________________________________________

And you? What is your biggest dream? ♥

¿Y tú? ¿Cuál es tu sueño más grande? ♥



_________________________________________________________________

HAPPY END / BEGINNING  ;)

P.S. If you’re interested in an artistic collaboration, hit me up!

REWARDS FOR YOU. Today I'm offering my sincere gratitude and hundreds of prints, original art-works and other art gifts in exchange for your contribution for me to be able to make an important step in my life - to undertake professional studies of the Interpretation and Dance in Barcelona where I was accepted. It doesn´t mean I will give up painting or art-performing, in contrast I will be much happier, and will be able to enrich my professional background in art-performing and move it to another higher level. I even have an intention to make after a year of studies some beautiful show together with the Nederlands Dans Theater (hope they will like the idea).RECOMPENSAS. Hoy estoy ofreciendo mi sincera gratitud y cientos de postales, grabados, pinturas originales y otros regalos artísticos a cambio de su contribución de 1 Euro o más para poder dar un paso importante en mi vida - emprender estudios profesionales de La Interpretación y la Danza en una Academia en Barcelona donde aprobé la prueba de acceso. Tomar este paso no significa que renuncie a la pintura, en contraste voy a ser mucho más feliz, y seré capaz de enriquecer mi experiencia profesional en el art-performing y llevar mis proyectos a un nivel superior. Incluso tengo la intención de hacer después de un año de estudios algun hermoso espectáculo junto con el Nederlands Dans Theater (Espero que a ellos les guste la idea).
 

KAONI Gallery , Gràcia, Barcelona, Spain, last summer. Together with Marc Vilajuana and Neus Soler. Art-show. Photo by Marina Castillón. 
WHERE FUNDS WILL GO TO. The help I get through this page will cover the costs of the studies of 2017-2020 and the registration fee that I have to pay in August (1000 euros plus 2048 euros the first year of studies) and also some money will go for the compliments for painting. Please share "Dance inside. I have a dream." with your friends and family. Every Euro will help my cause and career of making inspirational art. Thank you SO much, I appreciate your time reading me and your infinite kindness! And please, believe in yourself.ADÓNDE IRÁN LOS FONDOS. La ayuda que obtengo a través de esta página cubrirá los costes de los estudios de 2017-2020 y la cuota de inscripción que tengo que pagar en Agosto (1000 euros plus 2048 euros primer año) y también algo de dinero será para los complementos de pintura. Por favor compartid "Dancing inside. I have a dream" con sus amigos y familiares. Cada Euro ayudará a mi causa y propósito de hacer el arte inspirador. ¡Mil gracias por leerme y apoyarme! ¡Y por favor creed en vosotro@s mismos!
My watercolour featured by Hayden Lee, NY, USA, 2016. The Main Picture of the Project belongs to this talented photographer as well. __________________________________________________________________How does it work: if you wish to make a simple donation, you press BACK IT at the top under my picture. If you wish to have a gift instead, chose the PERK from the list which appears to the right. Art-prints for 20-70 euros or more. Original paintings for 80-3000 euros or more. Once you have it, check my online gallery (link below) and let me know (anna.dart@yahoo.es) which image you love most. The date which is indicated below shows aproximately when the gift will knock your door. You can happily follow my grow through my social media platforms. :)Cómo funciona esto: si quieres hacer una simple donación, hay que clicar RESPALDAR arriba del todo. Si te apetece tener una RECOMPENSA a cambio, mirar bien la lista que aparece a la derecha y clicar en una de las fichas. Hay art-prints por 20-70 euros o más. Y las pinturas originales por 80-3000 euros o más. La fecha que pone abajo indica cuándo aproximandamente llegará el regalo a tu casita. Elegir la imagen que te gusta más. Esto se puede hacer a través del link que tengo puesto abajo. Es suficiente con mandarme un correo electrónico a anna.dart@yahoo.es. También si estas en Barcelona, es posible ver la obra de arte en directo. Para seguir mi crecimiento luego te espero en mis redes sociales o en mis performances. :) __________________________________________________________________GALLERY ONLINE watercolours / GALERÍA ONLINE acuarelas https://annadart.wordpress.com/paintings/

_________________________________________________________________Thanks you! Gracias! Gràcies! Merci beaucoup ! Danke! Obrigada!

story:
I’m a drawing-based visual artist living and working in the Bay Area. Since earning my Master of Fine arts from California College of the Arts in 2004, I’ve sustained a studio practice committed to continual growth, experimentation, and formal/conceptual risk-taking.

I’m excited to share that I have been awarded a 10-week residency by the highly selective Anderson Ranch Arts Center in Snowmass Village, CO. The program provides an ideal setting for focused, prolonged studio time that is all too rare for working artists today. Especially for those of us whose work is driven by process and exploration, this kind opportunity is not only an honor; it is vital to our very existence.

Like many of my Bay Area artist peers, I work hard at a day job that barely covers minimal cost of living while shouldering student loans close to $50K. In order to support my participation in this rare opportunity, I‘m reaching out to my colleagues and friends who share my enthusiasm for art and my belief in its importance.

My ultimate goal is to raise $2500, which includes the residency fee of $1500 (this covers food, room/board, and studio space), cost of materials ($500), and part of the rent on my Oakland apartment during my absence ($500 towards 3 months’ rent of $1125)— Any amount contributed will mean a tremendous amount and will make a huge difference!

I have come up with some fun and unique “perks” in thanks for your generosity, which I hope will make your donation worthwhile!

story:
Around the World with 80 Artists is an arts and crafts book like nothing you’ve seen before! 

This book was brought to life by 80 artists from 22 countries. Each of these artists contributed a project to make this book uniquely special. You will find 80 step by step craft projects for the beginner to intermediate to the advanced crafter and artist, but most of all you’ll be able to see that creativity is something that holds this earth together and brings us all closer together. We want to celebrate our common love of creativity with this book and want to share with you incredible arts and crafts projects that make their way to you from 22 different countries.

We need your help!

To bring this unique book to the world we need your support! You can pledge your support to get a printed copy of this book full of beautiful step by step pictures and instructions to complete each project. The book will be printed in full color on beautiful paper (we hope) and will make it's way to you before July this year.

This book will make awesome Christmas presents for all the creatives on your list as well!

This book contains...

The book will contain over 250 pages full of artsy and crafty goodness. Some of the things you will be able to find in this book are:

  • Cut and Create projects 
  • Coloring Pages
  • Mixed Media Projects
  • Lettering Tutorials
  • How to Watercolor
  • Playing with Inks
  • Origami
  • Card Making
  • Scrapbook Layouts
  • Jewelry Making
  • Drawing Tutorials
  • Zentangle
  • Mandalas
  • Mini Book Projects 
  • Paper Crafting and much more! 

The projects will range from coloring pages to mixed media to scrapbooking, card making, cut and create and much more!

The best thing? This book is for EVERYONE! It has been designed to help unlock your right brain and add creativity to your life.

Around the World with 80 Artists will have you creating using paper, glue, colored pencils, paint and more. Remember how much fun this was when we did it as kids? Let's find that magic again!

Each project is unique and you will find something to suit every mood. This is also a great book if you're looking to get acquainted with many different arts and crafts.

How will this book make a difference?

20% of the proceeds from this project will go to The Malala Fund to help girls gain an education all over the world. Girls who might otherwise not get their chance at a basic human right. Let's support creativity and education! Find out more at https://www.malala.org.

Through this book you will be introduced to many various art techniques, many countries of the world and many creative folk who love to use their right brain. The range and depth of arts and crafts projects is something that has surprised all of us! We're astounded at the variety of things that are in this book and quite frankly I can’t wait to play with my copy too!

To make this book a reality please consider pledging your support to this campaign. We have awesome rewards and would love for you to be a part of the awesome group that brings this book to life.

Why are we doing this?

The reason we came up with this project is the fact that we see more and more hate make it’s way around the world. We read about terrible things in the news and at times we forget how beautiful this world is. This book is an attempt to highlight the theme of creativity around the world. You’ll be meeting so many new artists and creative folk who have all come together to work on one project with love and creativity flowing in from many different countries of the world. 

What we need the money for?

Our book is almost complete we need the project money to fund the layout of the book - already spoken to a layout designer and she is ready to start work - and also to print the first tranche of books to ship out to you wonderful folk all over the world. We are planning on sending these out before July 2017. If any printing delays slow us down we will keep you in the loop and hope it shouldn't be later than August 2017.

Other ways you can help?

We understand pledging and supporting is not for everyone. If not please share this campaign on social media and with your creative friends and family. Every little bit of love helps.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

Introduce yourself and your background.

Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.

Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.

Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!

Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.

Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).

Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.

Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.

Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
