story:
Short Summary

  • About Me: I hold a Masters in Art Education from the Mass College of Art and Design, and a Bachelor of Fine Arts from Tufts University and the Museum School of Fine Arts. I am the owner and designer for the company B. Felt. I design and manufacture by hand, beautiful felted garments and accessories. My work can be seen in galleries and museum shops around the nation and internationally. My work and show schedule can be viewed on my web site, www.bfelt.com.

  • History: As the National Park boat leaves the Swamp Locks, it enters the lower Pawtucket Canal, heading into the Industrial Canyon. In 1890, if you entered this part of the canal, the crescendos of hundreds of shuttles flying back and forth on the looms would have been deafening. Now, the only sounds are from the outboard motors of the National Park’s Canal boat and the occasional quack of the ducks. Today the mills are filled with artists, entrepreneurs, established businesses, restaurants, condominiums, and apartments. As the canal boat eases through the locks, the building on the right is nothing more than architectural remnants. A ghostly facade of windows belonging to the Dye House was once a two story building and part of the Appleton Mills. It is from these windows that these dyes were unceremoniously dumped into the canals. Some days it would be a red canal, and some days it would be a yellow canal, while other days it would just look like mud.

What We Need & What You Get

I Have Just Launched Part 2

I am more than half way close to my goal. Enterprise Bank has pledged 1000. I am looking to raise $2000 to complete the goal. Please go ro https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/veils-of-col... to contribute. Thank you

  • I am planning on raising $4,500 for this campaign. Contributing to this campaign will help me achieve multiple important steps in the re-installing of this piece, including but not limited to: repairing last seasons veils and creating new ones if needed, hiring an engineer to help me with the thermodynamics of the canal and installing the veils without damaging the historic building or the veils and without injury to me or to anyone else involved, 
  • The perks you will obtain if you contribute to this campaign are as followed;

$5 Postcard 

$15 Postcard and stickers

$30 T-shirt

$50 Postcard and a mug

$75 A tote bag

$150 a mug and a tote bag

$250 a mug tote bag and a t-shirt

$500 a t-shirt and tickets for the canal tour

$1000 Lunch with me in my loft and a personalized tour for 10 people of the canal

  • All of the merchandise given with the perks will be adorned with an abstract graphic of the veils. The postcard will have a photo of the veils from last season's installation.
  • This installation will be happening whether I meet my goal or not. If I do not reach my goal, I will be forced to pull back on the installation.

Risks & Challenges

  • After having done this installation before I am prepared to face the risks I faced last year, and I will be more equipped this time around. I am going to be hiring an engineer to help me with a lot of the challenges I faced, including dealing with the thermodynamics of the canal, figuring out the best solution for installing the veils on the building without damaging it as it is historic, and overcoming the 30 feet high installation on unsteady ground. Having an engineer will make the installation process go much smoother than it had in the past, therefore making me very well prepared.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are unable to contribute to this cause, please help us in another way by sharing this campaign with others through the Indiegogo sharing tools.
  • If you are willing to help physically, we are also looking for volunteers for the installation of this piece!

Having an engineer will make the installation process go much smoother than it had in the past, therefore making me very well prepared.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute to this cause, please help us in another way by sharing this campaign with others through the Indiegogo sharing tools.

story:
I am looking forward to attending this residency and would be grateful for your support. As an internationally recognized artist residency program, Vermont Studio Center supports emerging and established visual and literary artists. This residency will create visibility around my art practice by allowing me to share my work and engage in conversations with the diverse community at Vermont Studio Center. This opportunity offers me both uninterrupted time to focus on my practice and the opportunity to engage in vital professional development activities. While at Vermont Studio Center I will engage in research and create new prints and photographs for upcoming exhibitions. During this residency I will give an artist lecture that is open to the public and will participate in studio visits with other artists and writers.

(See perk images below. More images coming soon!)

I need your support to get there and in return I’m offering a variety of original prints, casts, and other goods I’ve designed and printed. 

THANK YOU for checking out my project!

// About + Artist Statement + Project \\

I received my MFA in Interdisciplinary Contemporary Studio Practice with an emphasis in Printmaking and Installation/sculpture from the University of Oregon in 2013. My studio practice is rooted in the contemporary art practices of printmaking/print media. In my studio I utilize printmaking/print media and relief sculpture. I choose objects to cast, photograph, and print that possess a pleasant sort of uselessness, spirited artifice, or aggressive cheeriness. Candy colored extension cords power nothing, banner flags celebrate a phony patch of grass, and casts of Jell-O molds become the epitome of nature tamed. These displays point to the heaviness of gravity, my body and the fallacy of human dominance/mastery over nature. Through abstraction and image-object placement these projects look at what a still life is, considering life stilled, distilled and concentrated into the quiet physicality of objects. By exploring these forms and their presence through color and materials I look at ideology embedded in the physicality of objects and environments.

Please visit my website to find out more about my practice, artwork and resume at www.katherinespinella.com . 

At Vermont Studio Center I will make 20+ new works on paper. I will create this new body of work by painting and mono printing onto photographs printed on oversized wet media paper. Prior to this residency, I will print photographs I take of arranged still-life displays, consisting of found and cast objects. These prints will serve as the foundation for the new work that I will create during my residency. I will utilize the facilities and resources available to paint and mono-print onto the photographic prints. Engaging with my work for an uninterrupted amount of time and participating in professional development activities at Vermont Studio Center will strengthen my current practice. I will continue to generate new photographs of objects that I collect and cast for the construction of new still-life arrangements. 

Currently on my reading list > Decolonizing Nature: Contemporary Art and the Politics of Ecology, Stilled: Contemporary Still Life Photography by Women, The Return of the Baroque in Modern Culture

// Financial Need + Expenses \\

The total cost for a four-week printmaking residency at VSC is $3,950 which includes access to the printmaking studio, a private studio space, on-site housing and meals. I was awarded a generous merit based grant of $1,000 and received $600 for agreeing to participate in the work exchange program to help offset the costs. This puts the remaining balance of the residency at $2,350 and since I will be flying coast to coast, a roundtrip flight from PDX-BTV and back during this time will be $1, 066. Additionally, I will need funds for transportation by taxi, supplies, possible shipping costs, and Indiegogo’s commission to host this campaign. I am looking to raise $3,416 and any amount over this goal will be put towards supplies, remaining travel expenses, and shipping. 

  • $2,350 (remaining residency balance)
  • $1, 066 (flight)
  • Total: $3,416

And any additional funds will go towards...

  • $200 (Taxi to and from BTV>VSC) 
  • $150 (Shipping, shipping digital prints to VSC and shipping completed oversized print back home)
  • $350 (Wet media paper, one roll and single sheets with the ability to be run though an inkjet large format printer)
  • $200 (Paint/Ink/Mylar/Plate and Supplies for mono printing with the flatbed press)

// Other ways to help \\

Share my campaign with others and follow me on social media!  

Instagram @katherine.spinella + Facebook + Tumblr

 

Thank you friends and followers!

$5/ Button

 

$10/ Thank you postcard

 

$25/ Original Digital + Silkscreen Collage/ examples, each 11in x 15in, print colors may vary but will uphold quality 

$35/ Mono Silkscreen Prints, three 8.5in x 11in (colors may vary)

$50/ Tote

 

$100/ Serigraphy Print

 

$250/ Digital + Serigraphy Print

 

$300/ Plaster Cast

 

$650/ Silkscreen Prints, framed medium sized multi-layer prints (1- top left, 2- top right, 3- bottom left, 4- bottom right)

 

$850/ Silkscreen print, framed large oversized sized multi-layer print
story_txt:
I am looking forward to attending this residency and would be grateful for your support. As an internationally recognized artist residency program, Vermont Studio Center supports emerging and established visual and literary artists. This residency will create visibility around my art practice by allowing me to share my work and engage in conversations with the diverse community at Vermont Studio Center. This opportunity offers me both uninterrupted time to focus on my practice and the opportunity to engage in vital professional development activities. While at Vermont Studio Center I will engage in research and create new prints and photographs for upcoming exhibitions. During this residency I will give an artist lecture that is open to the public and will participate in studio visits with other artists and writers.(See perk images below. More images coming soon!)I need your support to get there and in return I’m offering a variety of original prints, casts, and other goods I’ve designed and printed. THANK YOU for checking out my project!// About + Artist Statement + Project \\ I received my MFA in Interdisciplinary Contemporary Studio Practice with an emphasis in Printmaking and Installation/sculpture from the University of Oregon in 2013. My studio practice is rooted in the contemporary art practices of printmaking/print media. In my studio I utilize printmaking/print media and relief sculpture. I choose objects to cast, photograph, and print that possess a pleasant sort of uselessness, spirited artifice, or aggressive cheeriness. Candy colored extension cords power nothing, banner flags celebrate a phony patch of grass, and casts of Jell-O molds become the epitome of nature tamed. These displays point to the heaviness of gravity, my body and the fallacy of human dominance/mastery over nature. Through abstraction and image-object placement these projects look at what a still life is, considering life stilled, distilled and concentrated into the quiet physicality of objects. By exploring these forms and their presence through color and materials I look at ideology embedded in the physicality of objects and environments.Please visit my website to find out more about my practice, artwork and resume at www.katherinespinella.com . At Vermont Studio Center I will make 20+ new works on paper. I will create this new body of work by painting and mono printing onto photographs printed on oversized wet media paper. Prior to this residency, I will print photographs I take of arranged still-life displays, consisting of found and cast objects. These prints will serve as the foundation for the new work that I will create during my residency. story:
​           My name is Nefeli Markaki and together with my husband Petros Politis, we founded the                company “Nefelopetra”

Our motive was to combine as many different art forms into one performance, using just a small troop of multi-talented artists...

This small multi-talented crew became “Nefelopetra,” a dark and mysterious bunch with a passion to tell twisted mythical stories, to take you on an emotional journey and ultimately to discover the mysteries of life.

With extremely strong performers from all different backgrounds, we weave together dance, live music and acrobatics to create an original performance. Everything you see in a performance from Nefelopetra is created and put together solely by the artists of the company. Lighting design, costuming, music composition, music editing and the dance/acrobatic choreography.It is an absolute pleasure to be able to be creative in so many different areas and until now we have managed without financial aid, but now with bigger, better and more promising productions, we need your help!

  • Our biggest problem as a company is that we don’t own a lot of necessary technical equipment and have to always rely on renting it, which in the long run is extremely expensive! 

        What We Need & What You Get

  • Any money kindly given would help us invest in buying the following:

  • Sound equipment

    * 1 floor tom (Gretsch 18"x16" FT Catalina Cl. SWG'14)

    Approximately €275
    * 1 Xotic RC booster guitar pedal

    Approximately €160
    * 1 wireless guitar mic (T.bone free solo PT 1.8 GHz)

    Approximately €250
    * 1 PA mixing deck (T.mix PM800 B-Stock)

    Approximately €200
    * 1 Amplifier (Roland CUBE Street EX 4-Channel 50-

    Watt)

     

    As we don’t currently have our own company studio we have to rent out rehearsal space. So money would also go into our rent budget.

    Money to rent rehearsal space - €500

    Money donated would also help us with...

    Costuming

    Costuming budget- €500 Advertising

    Posters and flyers- €500

 

Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

 

 Thank you for taking the time to consider our campaign! If you can't contribute with a monetary donation at this time, don’t worry, there are still other ways you can help us:

*Share our work with your networks on Facebook *Share our upcoming events on Facebook
*Email this campaign to a friend in a personal message *Tell your friends and family about us

https://www.facebook.com/Nefelopetra/

story:
Summary

Sundowner Safari is a passionate crew of longtime Burning Man vets from South Africa and Brooklyn. We've been on core teams for major art cars like Heart Phoenix (2013/14) and large-scale installations like The Wedge (2009).

Earlier this year we traveled to South Africa and went on a life changing wildlife safari. We would end each day with "Sundowners", a fantastic tradition of sharing stories, laughter, and drinks with friends old and new.  

We're creating a safari-themed art car because we're passionate about bringing this special cultural ritual to the Burning Man community and beyond. We feel experiences of inclusion and camaraderie are exceedingly vital in these times. We also want to raise awareness for the world's unique ecologies and give back, in small part, where we can. 

It's an honor to put in the sweat to make this project happen. Indiegogo funds will go directly towards the costs to build the art car. Our hope is that this becomes an ongoing project, roaring back to the playa yearly. We'd love nothing more than for you to hop on board for the ride!

    Art Car

    South Africa is one of the world's great melting pots. We want to radically express that in an art car combining an iconic safari land cruiser with the whimsy of a giant toy mutant vehicle.

    Our project has been approved by Burning Man's department of mutant vehicles. We're building the art car on a standard cargo van chassis.

    Key construction steps will include:

    • Sawzall removal of passenger area
    • Seating installation for 17-20 passengers
    • Wind-safe, steel framed shade structure installation
    • Entryway and safety railing installation
    • Front hood "tracker's chair" and bike rack installation

    The specifications for our vision have been drawn up by an insanely experienced art car builder.

    Sundown Safari has been thoughtfully engineered to ensure it can withstand the rigors of the desert and provide maximum safety to participants.

    A mix of African fabrics, faux fur, and handmade or stuffed animals will amp up the art car's rad factor. These items will be tied down or secured with pop rivets or silicone glue and wind tested.

    Vehicle lighting for night missions will include:

    • Moveable round spotlight on hood
    • LED light bars on shade structure, roof, and hood
    • Rear spotlight

    We are also exploring the use of programmable LED Nanoleaf lighting, resources permitting. 

    Our Ask

    We are trying to raise at least $5,000 to offset costs of the art car. It breaks down like this:

    • $2,500 - Outsourced Professional Labor
    • $2,500 - Base Vehicle, Fees & Transport
    • $1,000 - Decoration & Soft Materials
    • $800 - Vehicle Modification Parts
    • $500 - Electrical & Lighting
    • $400 - Construction Needs
    • $400 - Design Engineering
    • $8,100 - Total

    Of course, we are volunteering our time for art car planning, construction, transportation, and storage. We are also covering associated costs, like build team accommodation, out-of-pocket and independent of this fundraiser.

    Sundowner Safari is also an approved Burning Man theme camp where we will be holding scheduled events, but funds raised will go towards the art car. 

    Burning Man

        Sundowners

        The art car will be the epicenter of our Burning Man experience. Sundowners will take place all week, with officially scheduled events at 7:30 and Lustrate. We warmly invite any and all to attend if you make it to the playa this year:

        • Tuesday 5:30 AM - Sunrise Yoga: meet at camp to walk to deep playa
        • Tuesday 6:30 - 8 PM - Sundowners* (sunset 7:48 PM)
        • Wednesday 6:30 - 8 PM - Sundowners* (sunset 7:48 PM)
        • Thursday 6:30 - 8 PM - Sundowners* (sunset 7:48 PM)

        Safari

        Sundowners will be on the hunt for the most challenging and entertaining game in Black Rock City.

        From elusive wild art car beasts to flamboyant costumed creatures, we'll aim to capture it all...and live to tell the tale. 

        Perks

        We are offering some amazing perks in appreciation of your support. Most of them incorporate our custom safari meets Burning Man design...and we ain't lion. 

        Sundowner Pendants
        Laser-etched acrylic statement piece that's sure to turn heads...and tails

        Sundowner Coasters (Coming Soon)
        Treat your Sundowners right with these special sets of 5 laser-etched drink coasters

        Sundowner Clock (Coming Soon)
        You'll always know when it's time for Sundowners with this distinct laser-etched wall clock

        Private Sundowner Safari
        Your own art car and full crew! Sundown Safari will pick up you and up to 9 friends and take you on the journey of your choice. Drinks, shenanigans, sexy animal hunting will all be included. 

        Rexon

        Our logo is named after our amazing South African safari guide, Rexon Ntimane. He represents both our ethos and our relationship to Burning Man. Our physical perks incorporate this logo design and the cool story (bro) behind it:

        • Lion - Natural Safari Majesty / Indomitable Burner Spirit
        • Mane - Sundownder Sunsets / Stylized Black Rock City Map 
        • Eyes - Sundowner Cocktail Glass / Burning Man Lanterns 
        • Nose - The Burning Man
        • Mouth - Deep Playa Excursions

        Impact

            Your contribution is crucial for us to complete Sundowner Safari. Here why you should think about pitching in:

            • It's AMAZING to be able to help bring unique cross-cultural art into the world
            • We're amped to raise Safari animal and environment awareness at Burning Man
            • This project will create once-in-a-lifetime experiences for participants
            • Our core team has the Burning Man, theme camp and art car experience to make this happen

            Wildlife Preservation

                We want the Sundowner Safari experience to be amazingly fun and build community. However, raising awareness for wildlife is near and dear to our hearts. We will be donating at least 5% of proceeds (same take as Indiegogo) to the African Wildlife Foundation, which is highly rated by CharityWatch. 

                Risks & Challenges

                Building an art car from scratch in the weeks before Burning Man is a tall order. The vehicle has to be mutated, transported to the playa and be approved for both day and night use. We have spent a great deal of time with planning and logistics to make sure we will be successful.

                Most importantly, Our crew consists of many decade-plus Burners who have put thousands of hours into large-scale theme camps, installations and art cars. We know the drill and what it takes to make crazy-ass dreams into even crazier reality.

                You Can Still Help

                If you can't contribute, but think Sundowner Safari is worthwhile, you can still lend a hand.

                • Reach Out - Send your friends our way if they might be interested in our project
                • Share - Use Indiegogo tools to post this to social media
                • Donate - Support African Wildlife Fund directly

story:
Présentation du projet

Étant à la base, graphiste de formation, le côté « graphique » en art m’interpelle de plus en plus. Je suis d’ailleurs actuellement inscrite au baccalauréat en arts plastiques à l'UQTR dans le but de perfectionner la dimension « graphique » de ma pratique. J’aimerais donc poursuivre mes recherches avec l’argile liquide afin d’utiliser la barbotine en la colorant, en la transformant, en y ajoutant des textures afin qu’elle serve non pas de « pâte » à sculpture comme je l’ai utilisée jusqu’à maintenant, mais qu’elle devienne plutôt une sorte de « peinture » pour en faire des tableaux et/ou des graffitis. En fait j’aimerais explorer ce type de médium de trois manières différentes, mais en parallèle l’une avec l’autre :
- Créer des tableaux et/ou des graffitis en argile liquide colorée et crue
- Créer des tableaux et/ou des graffitis en argile liquide colorée et cuite
- Créer des tableaux et/ou des graffitis en argile liquide colorée, crue et
cuite à la fois.

Outre la recherche dans la matière avec la terre liquide pour la travailler au pinceau, à la spatule et/ou avec tout autre instrument pouvant bien se prêter à la tâche, s’ajoute également la
recherche d’enduits qui serviront à « fixer » l’argile crue. J’aimerais, avec ce projet, innover dans la façon d’utiliser l’argile de manière plus picturale, mais aussi, de pousser mes recherches sur le potentiel et les avantages de travailler avec de l’argile crue principalement.

Apport de la résidence à ma carrière artistique

Il est évident qu’une résidence d’artiste comme celle qui est offerte à l’Institut européen des
arts céramiques en Alsace s’avérera, pour ma carrière artistique, un apport majeur au niveau
de ma recherche artistique et guidera le cours de ma carrière par la suite. Accepter de partager de soi et de sa vision à l’étranger c’est aussi accepter de se laisser toucher et influencer par la vision de l’autre. Tout cela ne peut être que bénéfique pour la pensée, pour l’évolution de l’artiste que je suis ainsi que pour mon expérience personnelle et humaine. Un peu comme on dit qu’il est bon d’apprendre de plusieurs professeurs, je pense qu’il est aussi essentiel de voir et d’observer les façons de faire d’artistes et d’artisans d’ailleurs. L’échange d’idées, de visions et de façons de faire ne peut qu’enrichir l’un et l’autre. Au niveau plus individuel, je pense que le fait de pouvoir m’arrêter de mon quotidien et être plusieurs semaines à créer et à explorer de nouvelles avenues dans ma pratique artistique ne pourra que me donner des ailes et m’enligner sur la ligne directrice que je souhaite donner à ma carrière artistique dans les prochaines années. S’arrêter, réfléchir, explorer, se tromper, recommencer... c’est un « luxe » que je m'offre en allant à cette résidence.

À mon retour, j'aimerais créer des ateliers pour que les gens aux prises avec une problématique de santé mentale puissent s'exprimer au moyen de l'art, de l'argile liquide, des graffitis! J'aimerais donner une voix à ces gens pour qu'ils puissent s'initier et s'exprimer afin d'embellir et d'éduquer la communauté dans laquelle nous vivons. L'art public, le "street art" et tout ce qui enrichit notre communauté devraient pouvoir vivre et refléter les enjeux de toute la société. La santé mentale et les gens qui doivent se battent chaque jour contre les limites que leurs "démons" personnels veulent leur imposer n'en sont pas excluent. Leur donner une voix, démystifier les différentes problématiques de santé mentale, en parler, s'exprimer, éduquer, s'inspirer et créer... voilà ce que j'aimerais faire de ces ateliers et des expositions qui pourraient en découler. 

DÉMARCHE ARTISTIQUE

L’argile constitue mon médium de prédilection. Je travaille la pièce unique de manière
sculpturale et installative en mettant l’accent sur la terre nue, voire même crue. Le contraste de
textures ou de matériaux est une constante dans mon travail. J’installe aussi une ambiance et
un climat de tension afin de déstabiliser et de confronter le spectateur. L’humain, son comportement, ses réactions, ses interactions et ses émotions sont au coeur de
ma recherche artistique. Mon travail révèle la part de l’ombre que nous portons tous et qui se
reflète sur nos comportements sociaux. Les sujets « tabous » ou « sensibles » dans la société
sont la pierre angulaire de mon inspiration. Je pense aux problématiques en santé mentale principalement (par exemple la phobie sociale et l'anxiété tout particulièrement), mais aussi aux relations toxiques ainsi qu’à certains enjeux féministes, dont l’hypersexualisation des jeunes filles. Idéalement, je veux que mon travail puisse participer à l’ouverture et au dialogue.

BIOGRAPHIE
Née en 1974 à Ste-Thècle dans la région de la Mauricie, je suis maintenant installée dans la ville de Québec depuis le début des années 1990. C’est en 1994 que j'ai débuté ma formation universitaire en art en entreprenant un certificat en Arts plastiques que j'ai complété, en 1997, par un baccalauréat en Communication graphique à l'université Laval de Québec. Mère de trois enfants, je me suis un peu éloignée de la création pendant quelques années. J'y suis revenue en 2008 en entreprenant, à temps partiel, une Technique en métiers d’arts (option céramique) au Cégep de Limoilou que j'ai terminé en 2015. J'ai vu, dans mes études, une façon de m’approprier et de développer de manière très personnelle, les possibilités que me donne l’argile comme médium principal pour travailler la sculpture. J'ai développé, par ailleurs, une technique bien à moi en travaillant l'argile liquide et crue en l’amalgamant avec du papier. Mes recherches, en ce sens, m'ont valu de vendre quelques sculptures « non cuites » à des collectionneurs, dès la fin de mes études. Installée d’abord dans un atelier collectif, j'ai aménagé par la suite un atelier dans mon domicile de Québec lorsque l’atelier collectif s'est vu dans l’obligation de fermer ses portes. J'ai vacillé alors entre la fabrication d’objets utilitaires en céramique et la recherche en art visuel. Influencée par des artistes comme Beth Cavener Stichter, David Altmedj et plusieurs autres pour qui l’art est l’émetteur direct d’un propos fort porté par l’artiste, je tends à faire de mon art une porte ouverte sur la réflexion de thèmes plutôt tabous, mais bien présents dans la société. Toujours à l’affut de me perfectionner et dans le but de créer avec différents types de médiums, j'ai entrepris, à temps partiel en septembre 2017, un baccalauréat en Arts visuels (arts plastiques) à l’Université du Québec à Trois-Rivières. L’apport de techniques plus poussées dans les domaines davantage graphiques me donnera de nouvelles assises pour ma création en 2D et en 3D.
story_txt:
Présentation du projet
Étant à la base, graphiste de formation, le côté « graphique » en art m’interpelle de plus en plus. Je suis d’ailleurs actuellement inscrite au baccalauréat en arts plastiques à l'UQTR dans le but de perfectionner la dimension « graphique » de ma pratique. J’aimerais donc poursuivre mes recherches avec l’argile liquide afin d’utiliser la barbotine en la colorant, en la transformant, en y ajoutant des textures afin qu’elle serve non pas de « pâte » à sculpture comme je l’ai utilisée jusqu’à maintenant, mais qu’elle devienne plutôt une sorte de « peinture » pour en faire des tableaux et/ou des graffitis. En fait j’aimerais explorer ce type de médium de trois manières différentes, mais en parallèle l’une avec l’autre :- Créer des tableaux et/ou des graffitis en argile liquide colorée et crue- Créer des tableaux et/ou des graffitis en argile liquide colorée et cuite- Créer des tableaux et/ou des graffitis en argile liquide colorée, crue etcuite à la fois.
Outre la recherche dans la matière avec la terre liquide pour la travailler au pinceau, à la spatule et/ou avec tout autre instrument pouvant bien se prêter à la tâche, s’ajoute également larecherche d’enduits qui serviront à « fixer » l’argile crue. J’aimerais, avec ce projet, innover dans la façon d’utiliser l’argile de manière plus picturale, mais aussi, de pousser mes recherches sur le potentiel et les avantages de travailler avec de l’argile crue principalement.
Apport de la résidence à ma carrière artistique
Il est évident qu’une résidence d’artiste comme celle qui est offerte à l’Institut européen desarts céramiques en Alsace s’avérera, pour ma carrière artistique, un apport majeur au niveaude ma recherche artistique et guidera le cours de ma carrière par la suite. Accepter de partager de soi et de sa vision à l’étranger c’est aussi accepter de se laisser toucher et influencer par la vision de l’autre. Tout cela ne peut être que bénéfique pour la pensée, pour l’évolution de l’artiste que je suis ainsi que pour mon expérience personnelle et humaine. Un peu comme on dit qu’il est bon d’apprendre de plusieurs professeurs, je pense qu’il est aussi essentiel de voir et d’observer les façons de faire d’artistes et d’artisans d’ailleurs. L’échange d’idées, de visions et de façons de faire ne peut qu’enrichir l’un et l’autre. Au niveau plus individuel, je pense que le fait de pouvoir m’arrêter de mon quotidien et être plusieurs semaines à créer et à explorer de nouvelles avenues dans ma pratique artistique ne pourra que me donner des ailes et m’enligner sur la ligne directrice que je souhaite donner à ma carrière artistique dans les prochaines années. S’arrêter, réfléchir, explorer, se tromper, recommencer... c’est un « luxe » que je m'offre en allant à cette résidence.
À mon retour, j'aimerais créer des ateliers pour que les gens aux prises avec une problématique de santé mentale puissent s'exprimer au moyen de l'art, de l'argile liquide, des graffitis! J'aimerais donner une voix à ces gens pour qu'ils puissent s'initier et s'exprimer afin d'embellir et d'éduquer la communauté dans laquelle nous vivons. L'art public, le "street art" et tout ce qui enrichit notre communauté devraient pouvoir vivre et refléter les enjeux de toute la société. La santé mentale et les gens qui doivent se battent chaque jour contre les limites que leurs "démons" personnels veulent leur imposer n'en sont pas excluent. Leur donner une voix, démystifier les différentes problématiques de santé mentale, en parler, s'exprimer, éduquer, s'inspirer et créer... voilà ce que j'aimerais faire de ces ateliers et des expositions qui pourraient en découler. 
DÉMARCHE ARTISTIQUE
L’argile constitue mon médium de prédilection. Je travaille la pièce unique de manièresculpturale et installative en mettant l’accent sur la terre nue, voire même crue. Le contraste detextures ou de matériaux est une constante dans mon travail. J’installe aussi une ambiance etun climat de tension afin de déstabiliser et de confronter le spectateur. L’humain, son comportement, ses réactions, ses interactions et ses émotions sont au coeur dema recherche artistique. Mon travail révèle la part de l’ombre que nous portons tous et qui sereflète sur nos comportements sociaux. Les sujets « tabous » ou « sensibles » dans la sociétésont la pierre angulaire de mon inspiration. Je pense aux problématiques en santé mentale principalement (par exemple la phobie sociale et l'anxiété tout particulièrement), mais aussi aux relations toxiques ainsi qu’à certains enjeux féministes, dont l’hypersexualisation des jeunes filles. Idéalement, je veux que mon travail puisse participer à l’ouverture et au dialogue.
BIOGRAPHIENée en 1974 à Ste-Thècle dans la région de la Mauricie, je suis maintenant installée dans la ville de Québec depuis le début des années 1990. C’est en 1994 que j'ai débuté ma formation universitaire en art en entreprenant un certificat en Arts plastiques que j'ai complété, en 1997, par un baccalauréat en Communication graphique à l'université Laval de Québec. Mère de trois enfants, je me suis un peu éloignée de la création pendant quelques années. J'y suis revenue en 2008 en entreprenant, à temps partiel, une Technique en métiers d’arts (option céramique) au Cégep de Limoilou que j'ai terminé en 2015. J'ai vu, dans mes études, une façon de m’approprier et de développer de manière très personnelle, les possibilités que me donne l’argile comme médium principal pour travailler la sculpture. J'ai développé, par ailleurs, une technique bien à moi en travaillant l'argile liquide et crue en l’amalgamant avec du papier. Mes recherches, en ce sens, m'ont valu de vendre quelques sculptures « non cuites » à des collectionneurs, dès la fin de mes études. Installée d’abord dans un atelier collectif, j'ai aménagé par la suite un atelier dans mon domicile de Québec lorsque l’atelier collectif s'est vu dans l’obligation de fermer ses portes. J'ai vacillé alors entre la fabrication d’objets utilitaires en céramique et la recherche en art visuel. Influencée par des artistes comme Beth Cavener Stichter, David Altmedj et plusieurs autres pour qui l’art est l’émetteur direct d’un propos fort porté par l’artiste, je tends à faire de mon art une porte ouverte sur la réflexion de thèmes plutôt tabous, mais bien présents dans la société. Toujours à l’affut de me perfectionner et dans le but de créer avec différents types de médiums, j'ai entrepris, à temps partiel en septembre 2017, un baccalauréat en Arts visuels (arts plastiques) à l’Université du Québec à Trois-Rivières. L’apport de techniques plus poussées dans les domaines davantage graphiques me donnera de nouvelles assises pour ma création en 2D et en 3D.

story:
A Sculpted Gift of Gratitude for Oprah by DiAnna Britt

Looking into the portal side of Gracie & out through her eyes.  

The Creative Journey of this Piece Now Includes Others

Amazing Gracie is now ready for gold plating!  When quotes for gold plating come back that make you think you could buy a small car instead, "faux finish" comes to mind. However, when one thinks "Oprah", one does not think “faux gold”, one simply thinks "gold". At this point I took my hands off the wheel. The next day I was guided to create this fundraising campaign. Not knowing what I could possible give back to everyone in return, The Book of Gratitude idea came to me. This piece seeks to gather more hearts in the giving, expanding the love, gratitude, and other prayers woven within it. This gift now includes others in a way I could never have imagined. As I began the endeavor of a public campaign, I realized I could include many of my creations as pledges as well and so here we are. By making a pledge towards gold plating Amazing Gracie, you can become part of this unique gift (literally giving the gift of gold!)

A Few Reasons Gracie is Amazing!  

Gracie is now a mystical portal sculpture of woven prayers. Through simple intention, times hundreds of meditative working hours Gracie did not disappoint! She is quite the doggie-door portal. A magical example of what I call “inversion sculptures” and have named “Portal Pieces or Portraits”. When viewed from the portal side, Amazing Gracie’s face seems to optically come alive. Her heart shaped chakras sprang from her like bubbles when I was creating her. I recognized that they represent the importance of congruency in mind, heart, and word. Some of her many prayers are gratitude, forgiveness, surrender, playfulness and love.

Amazing Gracie In Progress

Your Pledge

Helping create Amazing Gracie’s radiant gold finish through your pledge is a unique way to share your gratitude for Oprah also.  

In Return

Be included in the accompanying Book of Gratitude for Oprah and share your name, photo and a message (based on your pledge), in this collective book. Oprah will be able to forever cherish this sculpture of Gracie along with this book filled with the love from those who have pledged Gracie into gold for her!  Inclusions in the book are optional. Photos will be small head shots (or small group photos for businesses). Messages are a max. of 136 characters/spaces.  

There are many pledges to choose from, so help reach BeYond gold!

Challenges

Luckily for me, many things are well on their way to completion. The biggest challenge at this point was guesstimating fulfillment and delivery.  I have done my best and look forward to delivering each and every item with blessings.                                                                                     

Gracie in progress long ago with original pattern beneath.

Commissioned Works By DiAnna: "Picasso Dog" Gold-plated steel w/patina bronze inlays. &"Delta Dog" Anodized steel.

About the Artist

As an artist, student of metaphysics, yoga & body therapist for over two decades, these disciplines organically merged. All works are created with prayers, intentions, sometimes crystals to amplify and radiate into the world and the lives of those intended for them. From Portal Portraits and Angelic Wall Reliefs to Organic Totems and Healing Crystal Mobiles, all are infused with prayers of the highest intention. Being available by commission is my joy. I have  recently formed BeYond5D LLC and BeYond5D.com to share these healing art works and hand-crafted wellness products. Follow BeYond 5D on Face Book & Visit BeYond5D.com for Amazing Gracie updates and photos. Beyond5D.com will officially open after all pledge obligations have been fulfilled.

    WAYS YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE

    Help get the word out and make some noise using Facebook, Instagram, Tweets, etc. Share with Indiegogo share tools!

    PERSONAL PLEDGES

    Pledge $3 & you have my sincerest thanks.
    Pledge $10 YOUR NAME in the Book of Gratitude.

    Pledge $13 & receive 3 EDDIE BOWLS, & Your Name in the Book of Gratitude. The Eddie Bowl!  A Portable, Reusable, Recyclable Paper Water Bowl for your Pooch that fits in your pocket! Anytime, Anywhere, Eddie Bowl!


         

    Pledge $20 & receive your name in the Book of Gratitude and 10 Pocket Prayer Cards of several different designs with positive, inspiring thoughts & prayers.


    Pledge $33 Your Name & photo* in the Book of Gratitude.
    Pledge $66 Your Name, photo* & message* in the Book of Gratitude.

      CORPORATE PLEDGE

      Pledge $300. Your Company Name & Message in the Book of Gratitude.

      ART & PRODUCT PLEDGES

      These Pledges Include Your Name, Photo* & Message* in the Book of Gratitude. Inclusion in the book is optional. Let Oprah know what you're grateful for. 

      STIX & STONES

      Pledge $99. & Receive a Cold Stone Facial Kit. An Original hand crafted product to sooth facial tension, Two hand picked river stones with hand painted handles. Great for headaches,  sinus inflammation, to reduce fatigue and tension.  Comes with bag and instructions. QTY 50

       

      JETWET 

      Pledge $160. & Receive The Most Awesome Portable Sport Washer on the market! Great for camping, mountain biking, kids, dogs, & yourselves @ Burning Man! etc. Black with a Blue 0r Green Logo, the Universe will decide. JetWetusa.com  QTY 50

       

      GREEN BAG ORIGINAL PROTOTYPE

      Pledge $190. & Receive This hand made original prototype of Green Bag- “The Original Bag of Bags” Zipper top bag with shoulder strap, mesh pockets on back for your keys and 10 shopping bags inside. Designed and hand crafted  by the artist. QTY 1

       

      THE BLISS KIT

      Pledge $369 & Receive THE BLISS KIT - Shoulder & Posture Recovery System This six piece original kit unlocks tension and reducing stress! Restores range of motion, alleviates neck, shoulder & upper back tension & pain, strengthens joints, inspires deeper breathing, calms the nervous system. 20 years tested, massage & yoga therapist approved. For the long list of benefits please go to Beyond5d.com Bliss Kit page.  6pc.Kit includes bag & Instruction Manual.  QTY 30      

                                                                                                            

       

      MERCABA MEDITATION PAINTING I

      Pledge $396. & Receive this Original Painting. Material: Acrylic, powdered crystals. Sacred geometry  that surrounds the human body. QTY 1

       

       

      CHAKRA MIRROR©

      Pledge $396. & Receive A Sacred Chakra Mirror © A beautiful piece of art and a wonderful tool for instant daily alignment of your energy. Useful for meditation and study. Aligns your central chakra energy centers when you stand in front it and breathe deeply.  For more information go to Beyond5d.com Chakra Mirror page.  QTY 10

       

      PRIMITIVE BEASTIE BABIES

      Pledge $539. & Receive 3 Small Primitive Beasties 9” H x 13” L x 6 ½” W.  Organic Material: Sweet Huck, Palmetto, paper & crystal, or glass eyes. Beasties prayer is playfulness, lightheartedness and wonder. The prayer within is an old English nursery rhyme about life: “Row, row, row your boat gently down the stream. Merrily, merrily,merrily, merrily, life is but a dream".   QTY 5 sets (of 3)  

                               

      PRIMITIVE BEASTIE

      Pledge $539. & Receive 1 Large Primitive Beastie   14” H x 2’ L x 1’ W. Organic Material: Sweet Huck, Palmetto, paper & crystal, or glass eyes. Beasties prayer is playfulness, lightheartedness and wonder. The prayer within is an old English nursery rhyme about life: “Row, row, row your boat gently down the stream. Merrily, merrily, merrily, merrily life is it but a dream.”  QTY 5

       

      LYRICAL IMPLOSION

      Pledge $3,300. & Receive this Original Sculpture & Transformative Piece
      15” H x 5.5” W x 13” L  Faux gold leafed steel, Crystal Chakra Inlays, Italian Marble & Wood Base. Radiates freedom from suffering. Her prayer power is strength through adversity. QTY 1                     

      DANCING BIRD

      Pledge $3,699. & Receive this Dancing Bird with Totem Pedestal Base. Still in progress,  21”H x 22” L x 6” W (w/out totem), roughly 4' & change (w/totem) Organic Material from Lake Tahoe and Hawaiian sacred Shiva shell eyes. This bird’s medicine is insight, growth, and healing to family situations.Prayer Power is perseverance and confidence. Base to be determined.  Artist Note: Looks amazing on totem next to SHAMANIC BIRD WOMAN piece would love for them to share the same space. One is a bit taller than the other.  QTY 1

       

       

      SHAMANIC BIRD WOMAN

      Pledge $3,996. & Receive this Warrior Protector Piece with Totem Pedestal Base. Still in progress. 5'H x 20“W. Organic Material: Wings of palmetto, Hawaiian beads down the Side. Hawaiian Shiva shells for a crown. An arrowhead at the foot of the piece. The figure with beaded necklace and the cross at the back of the heart beneath the feathers were pre-existing in the wood and high-lighted by the artist. Protector of Family, Land & Property. Prayer Power is Love. Artist Note: Looks amazing on totem next to DANCING BIRD piece, would love for them to share the same space. One is a bit taller than the other. QTY 1

       

      INDIAN HEAD

      Pledge $6993. & Receive Original Sculpture & Transformative Piece  Organic Material: Clay, Birch bark, fiberglass and steel. Protector of Tribe & Spirit. Her prayer power is forgiveness. She protects loved ones and those who stay true to the calling of their heart, and dance in harmony with nature. QTY 1

       

      PROLIFIC DETRACTION

      Pledge $6999. & Receive Original Sculpture & Transformative Piece. 4.5’ H x 1.5’ W. Wall Relief - Clay & fiberglass, steel, and mop head. Her prayer power is forgiveness & the transmutation of judgement and oppression; protector of women and children. She tells the story of oppressive forces and fertile possibility.  QTY 1

       

      RUNNING MAN

      Pledge $16,000. & Receive this original sculpture & Transformative Piece.
      4.5’ H x 1.5’ W Wall Relief – Clay, steel armature, fiberglass, clay, fiberglass, wire, dentures. His prayer is self-forgiveness, fearlessness. QTY 1

       

                                                   

      TRANSENDANCE                                                                                                                         
      Pledge $63,000. & Receive this       Gold-Plated Bronze on African Wenge Wenge Wood . Transformative Piece. She radiates the ability of gracefully letting go & moving forward. Transcending to a new level of awareness. Her prayer is new life through Grace. Limited Edition, optional single and double bases available. QTY 3

Hawaiian Shiva shells for a crown. An arrowhead at the foot of the piece. The figure with beaded necklace and the cross at the back of the heart beneath the feathers were pre-existing in the wood and high-lighted by the artist. Protector of Family, Land & Property. Prayer Power is Love. Artist Note: Looks amazing on totem next to DANCING BIRD piece, would love for them to share the same space. One is a bit taller than the other. QTY 1
 

INDIAN HEAD
Pledge $6993. & Receive Original Sculpture & Transformative Piece  Organic Material: Clay, Birch bark, fiberglass and steel. Protector of Tribe & Spirit. Her prayer power is forgiveness. She protects loved ones and those who stay true to the calling of their heart, and dance in harmony with nature. QTY 1
 

PROLIFIC DETRACTION
Pledge $6999. & Receive Original Sculpture & Transformative Piece. 4.5’ H x 1.5’ W. Wall Relief - Clay & fiberglass, steel, and mop head. Her prayer power is forgiveness & the transmutation of judgement and oppression; protector of women and children. She tells the story of oppressive forces and fertile possibility.  QTY 1
 

RUNNING MAN
Pledge $16,000. & Receive this original sculpture & Transformative Piece.4.5’ H x 1.5’ W Wall Relief – Clay, steel armature, fiberglass, clay, fiberglass, wire, dentures. His prayer is self-forgiveness, fearlessness. QTY 1
 
                                             
TRANSENDANCE                                                                                                                         Pledge $63,000. & Receive this Gold-Plated Bronze on African Wenge Wenge Wood . Transformative Piece. She radiates the ability of gracefully letting go & moving forward. Transcending to a new level of awareness. Her prayer is new life through Grace. Limited Edition, optional single and double bases available. QTY 3

story:
Ils lane needs you!

What Is it? Ils Lane is a historical alley located in between Chinatown and The Financial District. Until recently, the alley has become a place for garbage dumping, drug use, and illicit activities.

Why Is It Important? It's critical that we preserve and restore Ils Lane because of its historical value. The Jung Sai Garment Workers Strike of 1974, anti-displacement advocacy events in 1969-77, and the battle to save the Fong Building in 1999 are just some of the historical events held here.

What is Our Goal? We have already taken the first big step of cleaning and restoring the lane. Local artist, Sirron Norris, has adorned the walls with vibrant murals. Our next step is to engage the community. 

Who Is Leading The Effort?

The Ils Lane Advisory group is comprised of residents, property owners, and representatives from community organizations. They have come together to form the Ils Lane Advisory Council (ILAC) to address the deplorable conditions of Ils Lane and to foster and promote improvements in the lane to make it safer and accessible to all. Their vision is to turn Ils Lane into a “living lane,” that is, an arts alley where tourists and residents can sit, relax and enjoy cultural activities, view the artwork along the walls; and in doing so create a cultural landmark, which respects the long and diverse history and the role of the Lane in Chinatown. (Pictured above L-R: Janet Chen (Stern School), Larry Milburn (Stern School), Sirron Norris, Supervisor Aaron Peskin, Michael Almaguer)

COMMUNITY IMPACT

The first task of the ILAC is to organize an inaugural cultural event in the Lane to celebrate the opening of the 3-panel mural. One goal for the event is to serve as a template for a continuing series of events on a monthly basis and to be part of the North Beach First Fridays. We recognize that making physical improvements to the Lane is not enough to improve its vitality. We must attract returning and new visitors and make the Lane accessible to all. 

OUR PLAN

The inaugural cultural event will be held on Saturday, October 13th, 2018. Event details include:

Afternoon 3-6 PM Community event for families with art activities, music, spoken word, live art, and food celebrating the opening of the Sirron Norris http://www.sirronnorris.com mural. Who should attend? Local residents, property owners, local merchants, and community organizations.

Evening 6-9 PM Fundraiser for the Homeless with poetry and spoken word performances, comedy, and music. This honors the mural and the unique history of the lane.

LOCATION:

The event will span the length of Ils Lane from Columbus Ave to the back of 53 Columbus, City College and Sterne School. There will be a small stage setup in front of the mural for music throughout the event.

BUDGET

We need to raise $4,000 to pull off the event - this will help fund the food, entertainment, permits and logistical needs. Additionally, this will help us start planning for a series of events in the future. 

 

THE PERK!

If you participate in this perk ($30), you will receive a limited edition, 12 by 18-inch original digital illustration of one of the murals in the alley to be signed by the artist, Sirron Norris (see below).

story:
The Film 

 

The idea of Journey of Endless Time came to me while I was still working on my first immersive art film, Beyond Infinity.  I thought it'd be interesting, as a new project, to make a film that would  investigate the beauty of existence and our place in the history of the universe.

This is my second major film production and will be for giant screens, mixing painting and cutting-edge 4K technology, to bring the visionary imagery alive. The  music will be by the British composer Jonathan Wright. The film will have  no dialogues to break language barriers for audiences around the world. Unlike Beyond Infinity, which was made for dome theatres, Journey of Endless Time will be for flat screen and will eventually be released on the internet after its theatrical release.( Note: if you join the fundraiser you'll be watching it online for free before anyone else!)

For several months I've been working on producing the artworks I will be using in this film and I am now in the final stages of the film production.  I need to secure funding for  post-production  and  distribution costs, as well as start recouping the production costs. For those who want to be part of this journey and make a difference, there are cool perks to snatch, including some original works of art, film credits and more!

 

The Artist/Filmmaker

For those who are not familiar with my work, I am a visual artist who has worked extensively with painting, photography and film, showing my work in museums and institutions around the world, including the BISTFF Film Festival in Beijing (China), Columbia University  and CUNY in New York (US), the Museum of Oriental Art and the Museum of Astronomy and Space in Turin (Italy), the 54th Venice Biennial, the Citè de l'Espace Planetarium (France). My work is held in the collections of the Brooklyn Museum, Columbia University, Albright-Knox museum and several other institutions. Copies of my artist book Cinematography of Urban Madness are kept in the collections of Tate, Whitney Museum, MoMA, NY Public Library. I hold a PhD in Astrophysics from Columbia University and I am currently based in London. More detailed information can be found on my website: www.reviglio.com

 

 

 

The fundraiser and the perks ;)

Joining this journey comes with some great perks - original art works used for the film, limited edition prints, signed posters, having your name listed in the film credits as one of the patrons of this project and more. Please check them out and select the option that best fits you. Artworks will come with a Certificate of Authenticity signed by the artist. It would be great if you could spread the word and  share this fundraiser with people you think may be interested in being part of this project (you can also use the Indiegogo tools). The funds will go towards covering the production costs and the distribution around the world in festivals and institutions. The shipment of artworks will start in spring 2019, the link to watch the film for free will be made available after the theatrical/festival distribution is over (probably around December 2019). Feel free to get in touch for further information.

Here are some examples of the film-related artworks you may get:

 

Original limited edition giclèe print (size A3) edition of 50 of a film still.

 

 

Signed poster (size A4)

A high quality poster sign by the artist, size A4 (21x29.7 cm)

 

 

Original Drawings (Ink / Watercolor) 

Original drawings size A4 or A3 that will be used in the film.  For more information and galleries of available works please check www.reviglio.com/journey . A few examples:

 

 

Original oil on paper paintings

If you choose to become a Co-producer of this film, you will get an original oil on paper painting (size A2 - 42x59.4 cm).  For more information and galleries of available works please check www.reviglio.com/journey

story:
My name is Marlee (she/they), and I'm a queer, Black, artist based in unceded Lenapehoking territory/Brooklyn, New York. I was recently accepted into University of Georgia's low-residency Narrative Nonfiction MFA program. In this program I will be working on one manuscript for the full two year program. 

It's my dream to finish this book in which I write letters addressed to self-described  "Black, lesbian, mother, warrior, poet," Audre Lorde. In this Masters program, I will have the opportunity to work alongside incredible mentors who will help give the guidance, structure, and feedback I need to complete this project. 

How Funds Will Be Used:

Unfortunately, due to the cost of living in New York City, the financial impact of the pandemic, and various other factors, being able to afford tuition is going to be difficult, which is why I'm asking for your help. Any amount you can offer will be greatly appreciated. The funds will help with the cost of my tuition. Every cent I earn will go towards what I have to pay for the first and second semester of the 2021-2022 academic year. Even though most of the program is online, the cost of tuition and research materials is well out of my price range. I only was able to receive aid in the form of a loan from FAFSA, and I already have a mountain of student debt from undergrad. I work part time at a nonprofit, therapeutic horseback riding center, and I will probably have less hours once I'm in school. In addition to the cost of the program, I still have to pay rent and living expenses in the city. Finishing this book is an integral part of my journey as a literary activist. 

Thriving as a Black, queer artist-especially during these times, is not easy. Asking for money is not easy. But in times of hardship, I find it's important that we look towards community. Being able to be a part of this program at UGA would mean the world to me. I hope you'll consider donating if you have the means. Thank you so much.

story:
About the Book

Mama Stitches is an original children's story about how a mother dog, her puppies and their owner sew clothes for the homeless. How the cover with love!!

VISION



About the Author

Akintunde Sogunro “ Tunde” is the director and producer of the award winning inspirational documentary film, Victory. He is excited to be pursuing a career living out his childhood dream by publishing the first book in the "Mama Stitches" series. He received his Bachelor’s of Arts degree in theater at Southern Connecticut State University in 2011, and is currently an MFA in creative and professional writing candidate at Western Connecticut State University. A native of Lagos, Nigeria who spent eight years living in Edmonton, Alberta Canada, Akintunde now resides in New Britain, Connecticut where he spends time spreading Mama Stitches story of hope and love up and down all around his community.



About The Illustrator

Chad Thompson( Former Disney Animation Studios) As a young boy, Chad's Grandfather sat him down at the Kitchen table and taught him how to draw cartoons. Chad never forgot those early lessons!

His love of drawing led him to the Columbus College of Art and Design. Upon graduation graduation, he was hired by the Wal Disney Feature Animation studio in Florida. For the next seven years, he worked on animated movies such as Mulan, Lilo & Stitch and Brother Bear. 


   


Chad currently works as an illustrator and designer for a  wide variety of clients. He continues to work in animation for smaller studios in Orlando, Florida. When he is not drawing at  the board, Chad enjoys spending time with his wife and two young children.


Self Publishing

     
Lisa Umina, founder of Halo Publishing, has always made giving to others a priority in her life. Lisa is the award-winning author of Milo and the Green Wagon. This story is drawn from her own childhood experience helping people in need. Charity is also a priority for Halo. This is evident in the charitable contributions Halo makes to both local and international organizations. Each year, Halo donates books, clothing, food and monetary contributions. In addition to the donations, Lisa and Halo employees volunteer their time at a Hogar Dulce Hogar, an orphanage in Mexico. Who knows, maybe these enriching experiences will inspire another story . . .




Short Summary

TARGET GOAL -$14,000

STRETCH GOAL #1- $16,000- Save Mama Stitches Demo Games

STRETCH GOAL # 2- $20,000- Build our Non Profit- Cover With Love


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

     $2,000- Printing, Marketing, Promotions etc...

  • $4000- Mascot

  • $8,000- Save Mama Stitches App Game


  • [OFFICIAL EARLY DEMO TRAILER]


    Save Mama Stitches is a dynamic new 2D side scrolling game for android and IOS where the player gets to choose as either of Mama Stitches’ puppies, the supercharged Lucky or the high powered Little Mama




    ...  on an epic quest

     through seven levels and seven bosses to save their precious mother from the clutches of The evil Ex Nihilo.

    READING LOG 

    In addition to action packed sequences and daring adventures, Save Mama Stitches includes an educational aspect where children and students can log their daily reading as well as their new DRA levels reached and be rewarded with bonus levels and upgrades! With many more expansions to come!


    In the style of classic games such as Super Mario World, Donkey Kong Country with the flair and fun of newer games such as Angry Birds and Mine Craft, Save Mama Stitches is sure to delight fans for generations to come!



    PERKS

    PUPPY LOVE KEYCHAINS


    MAMA STITCHES T-SHIRTS


    BOOKMARKS





The Impact

Your support will help make the dream become a reality!!

Risks & Challenges

App game development can be a long process. We understand that in order to create a high quality game, we might have to extend our demo dealing of next summer to ensure we have a quality game for children and families. Please bare with us!! Thank you!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you are unable to support or have already donated and would still like to help, feel free to share the Indiegogo campaign link with friends and family as well as like us on Facebook!! Thank you so much!!

story:
**Major Update 3/24/2015** 

Another artist has joined the trip! Her name is Danielle & she is also a photographer. Together, the three of us will document our travels and adventures and I have  a feeling the resulting project will be incredible. 
Please donate & share so we can make sure this trip & resulting project can be as incredible as possible :) 

**Major Update 3/10/2015** 

My friend & incredibly talented photographer, Emily, is now joining me on this adventure. We will be documenting our travels together, in our own styles and from our own perspectives. We think that this will result in a wonderfully balanced final project. Depending on funding, we are looking into turning this project into a book together. 

Hey Friends! We're taking a trip to Iceland

My name is Arianna. I'm a photographer and artist currently living in Baltimore. I've been passionate about photography since I was a teen. I also was bitten by the travel bug at a young age. Combined, these two things create a powerful drive to see the world, capture its beauty and share it with others. 

I am looking to gain funds to go to Iceland this summer and photograph the multitude of cultural and natural beauties that reside there, resulting in a final photo project. 

With your help, I will be able to fund this project. I have already invested in my equipment, I just need help w/ travel expenses and the cost of the final project. 

The Deets

  • Tickets to Iceland are about 700-800 USD currently, round trip.
  • The rest of the money raised will go to travel within the country. Any excess will go towards the cost of printing these images! 
  • Those who donate will get prints of my travel photography! (or even a book!)
  • If I do not reach my entire goal -- the funds raised will go towards the cost of the ticket & travel. This is a dream, and I will make it a reality one way or another! 

Why this is important

They say it's a small world, but there are so so so many beautiful things to see. 

I wish I had enough time in my life to see every detail of this planet, but that is simply impossible. However, I have main checkpoints on my bucket list that I want to see and capture. And more importantly -- share afterwards. 

I believe that art can make the world more accessible. It exposes people to places, people, cultures that they may not otherwise. 

On a similar note, I am a strong believer in affordable art. One should not be a millionaire in order to afford a beautiful image to have & enjoy. 

The final result of this project will be a photo-essay of Iceland & my travels, of which prints & series will be available for sale (or if you contribute, you get some for helping make the project a reality.) 

Other Ways You Can Help
You can help. (Because you are awesome!)

Share, share, share! If you can't contribute -- just let your mom, your dog, your friends, basically anyone with a wallet and an appreciation of art know about this project! 

You are rad. I appreciate you taking the time to read about this project. 


P.S. if you are interested in seeing examples of past travel photography -- you can do so at ariannavallephotography.com.

I also was bitten by the travel bug at a young age. Combined, these two things create a powerful drive to see the world, capture its beauty and share it with others. 
I am looking to gain funds to go to Iceland this summer and photograph the multitude of cultural and natural beauties that reside there, resulting in a final photo project. 
With your help, I will be able to fund this project. I have already invested in my equipment, I just need help w/ travel expenses and the cost of the final project.    The Deets  Tickets to Iceland are about 700-800 USD currently, round trip.
The rest of the money raised will go to travel within the country. Any excess will go towards the cost of printing these images!  Those who donate will get prints of my travel photography! (or even a book!) If I do not reach my entire goal -- the funds raised will go towards the cost of the ticket & travel. This is a dream, and I will make it a reality one way or another!     Why this is important They say it's a small world, but there are so so so many beautiful things to see. 
I wish I had enough time in my life to see every detail of this planet, but that is simply impossible. However, I have main checkpoints on my bucket list that I want to see and capture. And more importantly -- share afterwards. 
I believe that art can make the world more accessible. It exposes people to places, people, cultures that they may not otherwise. 
On a similar note, I am a strong believer in affordable art. One should not be a millionaire in order to afford a beautiful image to have & enjoy. 
The final result of this project will be a photo-essay of Iceland & my travels, of which prints & series will be available for sale (or if you contribute, you get some for helping make the project a reality.) 

Other Ways You Can HelpYou can help. (Because you are awesome!)
 Share, share, share! If you can't contribute -- just let your mom, your dog, your friends, basically anyone with a wallet and an appreciation of art know about this project! 
You are rad. I appreciate you taking the time to read about this project. 

P.S. if you are interested in seeing examples of past travel photography -- you can do so at ariannavallephotography.com.

story:
A Bit About the Artist, Creator of Ndiginus

My name is Rae Vavra, artist and jewelry designer from Los Angeles, California. I have exhibited my Art and designs throughout the LA area, as well as teaching Art since 1989. 

In 2007, I moved to Bali where I began to develop Ndiginus, an Art and Jewelry design venture that promotes the lost Art of Balinese beadwork, as well as creating fair trade jobs for these local craftsmen, while keeping this unique craft alive. I started this as an experiment by asking one craftsman to do beadwork on a piece of fabric as a sample, and now I employ four craftsmen each with his or her own unique skill.

About my project and the Ndiginus Team

I design all the accessories and make the first samples in my studio. I then work with each craftsman individually to reproduce my designs. Some designs are made by only one person, while others are made by the entire team. This process is a very rare hands on approach to creating one of a kind accessories, each one of these craftsman have now become an integral part of my team. I have been supporting this project solo from the beginning, but now, realize I need the support of a larger audience in order for Ndiginus to grow and prosper.

Why funding is needed for Ndiginus, immediate to 1 year goal

* I've started this campaign to raise money for various reasons; the most basic reason is to buy supplies in order to continue producing my accessories, as well as paying the craftsmen who help me produce my designs.

* The immediate 3 month goal is to continue marketing and sales throughout the Los Angeles area, as well as entering trade shows located within the LA fashion mart that target boutiques throughout the U.S. These shows will help promote and create orders for Ndiginus.

* As profits increase, my 6 month to 1 year goal is to create a retail/workspace in Los Angeles that will house as a space for the design and marketing of Ndiginus, in a location clientele can easily access.

* Funding is also needed to supply orders to the client, since deposits are not always possible with certain clientele, i.e. Boutiques. I will continue to do production in Bali, working with my current team of craftsman.

Long term goal

My long term vision is to use some of the profits from future sales to provide a larger space for my team to work from, supporting a creative group effort. This new space will be a sustainable design project built from Bamboo combining an indoor/ outdoor environment. The space will also host educational arts and crafts projects for the surrounding communities.

Thank you for reading my story about Ndiginus, all contributions are greatly appreciated, please read on to view the perks for my campaign.

www.ndiginus.com

PERKS

US $10 Perk

Thank you postcard via email of Puti and Rudi

US $25 perk
A personal thank you card with a photo of original mixed media Art by Rae. The post card photo is from a fundraising exhibit , 2014, where funding was created for a local Bali orphanage from proceeds of Rae's paintings.


US $50 PERK, Single strand Mala bracelet

This Mala bracelet is made from a variety of beads. It will come in earthtones and neutral colors, each with metal Sanskrit tags. Adjustable leather closure and tassels.


US $100 Perk, Single strand Mala necklace

A single strand Mala necklace coming in earthtones, made from a variety of beads, combining semi precious stones, hand made Javanese beads and sacred ruudaska beads, each with a single tassel.


US $350 Perk, "4 Girls"

Mixed media painting combining collage, acrylics, silkscreens, and charcoal on canvas. 27.5" x 30.5"


US $550 Perk,  "Wings of Desire"

Original, mixed media painting, combining Acrylics and charcoal, with rice paper and gold leafing added as texture on canvas. 31" x 31"


US $700 Perk, "Sunwheel"

Original mixed media Abstract painting, combining acrylics, gold leaf, and charcoal on canvas.  39.5" x 39.5"


US $850 Perk, "Burnt Orange"

Original mixed media Abstract painting, combining acrylics and inks on canvas.
W 39.5" x L 47"


US $1000 Perk, "Love in Action"

Original Abstract mixed media painting, combining acrylics, inks and charcoals.
W 79" x L 55".


Delivery of Perks

All perks will be delivered after the campaign is over and funds are received. Approximate dates you will receive your perk are between May 15 to May 31 st. Tracking will be available for the artwork being delivered, so if any problems occur during delivery, we will know where the package is. Also *note, paintings will be delivered off the stretchers in a water proof tube to protect the art. You will need to have the painting restretched. 

I will send an email out to all receiving art or jewelry on the date the perk is mailed.

Thank you!

Thanks to all once again for your contributions and helping Ndiginus move to the next level. If you did not contribute by funding, please take the time to share this link. Any way you can show your support is greatly appreciated!

story:
Get The Sin Out of Northern Michigan!

In 2011, I moved my family back to Northern Michigan, the area of my childhood. My family braved a treacherous 10 day road trip from Southern California, dodging near death experiences and great expense to start a new life.

Money was tight and life was difficult, but we worked hard to succeed, doing an ad campaign for a local jeweler and senior portraits, in addition to a full time day job.

In addition to years of landscape photography, commercial photography and general fine art photography, I have also been a photographer of the human nude (yes, male and females) but had begun working exclusively with model Liz La Point in 2010 for a 5 Year Project, and later she became my wife. 

A Hater emerged and rallied other small-minded haters to harass and bully myself and my family. The attacks included anonymous fake reviews, online and on our client's social media accounts, letters to local organizations warning them against us, and anonymous threatening letters to our home. They falsely called me a pornographer, and my wife a "porn queen", among other absurd things, and forced us to bring the matter to the police. These libelous attacks made working in Northern Michigan and finding and holding jobs extremely difficult, and made life stressful. We began to worry about our safety at home.

Being bullied and attacked for making nude art aimed exclusively to an adult audience discounts all of the other work we do.

So, in order to survive and to protect my family, we are starting this fundraiser to raise the money to move.

Or...

If we stay, we will use the money to hire a private detective, as we now have some pretty solid evidence of the identity of our bully, and a lawyer so we can sure them for libel and slander. 

Hater, if you are reading this, here is your chance to put your money where your slanderous mouth is, and contribute to removing us from your "paradise." If we stay, we are going to fight you and sue you. It is a very small community, and we have a strong idea already of who you are, but once we have the indisputable proof, we are going to make sure you pay for the damage you have done to our reputations and peace.

Friends, you know what we have been through since moving back here, so please help us move from here and start our life over or hold this bully accountable!

Check out Liz La Point's Advice Blog.

www.TheNakedAdvice.com

And her YouTube Channel...

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCNaW2ftS_rC_vdKFqiRo6mA/videos


Liz modeled for artist Josh Skeel for Rusted Crow Spirit's Ginstache

Letters Sent To Our Home From the Bullies.

story:
About Me

I am a professional artist who received my degree in Visual Arts from the University of South Carolina in Beaufort.  All forms of art have always been a passion of mine, and I love helping others explore and express their creativity.  I have taught art classes to children in the past, and when you witness how much art can make someone visually express themselves, it is a gratifying experience.  I am currently in graduate school at Prescott College to receive my Masters in Mental Health Counseling with a concentration in Art Therapy.  I want to help those that are less fortunate and especially give hope to children who have already seen too much. 
"Go into the world and do well.  But more importantly.  Go into the world and do good." (Minor Myers, Jr.)

Short Summary

I want to raise awareness for the use of art therapy on a global level.  The emergence of this goal started over 10 years ago to become an art therapist which ultimately transformed into a passion to work with children especially those who have experienced trauma.  I will be volunteering for the Therapeutic Arts Program (TAP) implemented by the non-profit organization, Global Alliance for Africa (GAA).  I will be traveling throughout Kenya and Tanzania in rural and urban locations. With this program, I will be working with local African artists and art therapists and training under art therapists from around the world.  The TAP program has been set up to help the emotional needs of orphans that have lost their parents to AIDS or HIV, or other tragedies.   Art has the power of healing and can help those that are too traumatized to speak, voice their experiences through imagery.  I have attached some links for you to learn more about art therapy as well as Global Alliance for Africa and their mission!


Why I Need Your Help

I need help with raising money for traveling expenses, food, and a roof over my head.  That will cover all costs.  Any contribution would be greatly appreciated!  Also, any money that exceeds the amount needed for my volunteer trip, will be donated to Global Alliance for Africa and their Therapeutic Arts Program.


The Impact You Will Make!

Your contributions will have improve the lives of children in Africa who have been orphaned by the AIDS pandemic by providing emotionally and physically safe spaces where children and youth can use the arts to freely express themselves.  Through art therapy and the TAP program, orphans can unburden what is troubling them, learn from each other, gain confidence in their skills and abilities, and experience the feeling of kinship.   Your contribution will also help educate visitors about the severe impact that HIV and AIDS has on the children and youth in Kenya and Tanzania.

Kibera Slums


What is Art Therapy?

Art therapy is effective for all types of individuals, families and groups.  Art therapy has been especially effective for those afflicted by Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD).  Art therapy helps those that are suffering by helping shift the emotional distress and help open a new avenue for positive thinking and living.
Art Therapy
http://psychology.about.com/od/psychotherapy/f/art-therapy.htm


Here Are Some Great Websites to Learn More About The Program and Art Therapy:
G.A.A. and T.A.P. Information:

http://www.globalallianceafrica.org/#!therapeutic-arts/cegi

http://www.globalallianceafrica.org/#!ourmission/csgz

Art Therapy and how it can help:

http://www.arttherapyblog.com/child-art-therapy/how-art-therapy-for-children-works/#.VIzuSL5hO5Q

http://virtualmentor.ama-assn.org/2010/09/imhl1-1009.html

Visual Tripline, See the Journey!: 

http://www.tripline.net/trip/Trip_with_Global_Alliance_for_Africa-375637351745101087BEB52133C96F69

Other Ways You Can Help

I would love for some help spreading the word about Global Alliance for Africa and my Campaign to go overseas and volunteer!
