story:
What is Habitable Spaces?

Habitable Spaces is a community arts and agriculture project in which artists are invited to create large- scale interactive pieces while exploring alternate forms of living.  These artworks become installed as a permanent part of the farm, creating a space that becomes a more comprehensive and collaborative project with each successive year. Located in the tiny town of Kingsbury Texas , the Habitable Spaces artist residency program integrates cutting edge art and artists into a rural community, giving an opportunity for both artists and the local community to participate in a lively dialog. We emphasize engagement not only with the rural community, but with the landscape itself, asking artists to consider problems of drought, climate change and urban expansion in their proposed projects.

WE NEED YOUR HELP!

Habitable Spaces received its non-profit status in December, and now we can really push forward to finish building the infrastructure of the farm and artist residences, and get this show on the road!!

WHEN WE RAISE $5,000:  The first thing we will do is put in a culvert and a roadway system so that the public can easily access the farm to attend events, workshops and festivals. 

WHEN WE RAISE $10,000:  We will use the next $5,000 to finish the infrastructure of the farm, digging water lines that will run to our kitchen, and down to our large garden, as well as the many smaller perennial gardens that inhabit the area.

IF WE RAISE MORE THAN $10,000:  You will really get us on our way!  We will use this money to build 5 small artist in residence cabins for local, national and international artists to occupy during their stay with us.

YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL BE REWARDED:

Your donation 100% tax deductible!  In addition,  there are all kinds of perks to supporting Habitable Spaces.  Not only will you feel good about supporting the arts in a small rural community, we have t-shirts, koozies, ball caps, and an extravagant farm to table dinner at habitable spaces planned for generous donors. 

The Impact

We believe that there is a division between the fine arts community and rural farming and ranching communities.  Most opportunities for artists lie in urban areas, creating an exodus of artists from small towns and rural landscapes.  By creating Habitable Spaces, we expose farmers and ranchers to fine art concepts while teaching artists about concepts of homesteading and farming.  We ask artists to consider the problems that face many farmers and ranchers today – water shortages, climate change, and urban expansion, and to think about food production as well as shelter.  Artists are expected to create a project that stays at Habitable Spaces, in this way becoming a part of a larger collaborative architecture. These projects do not have to be sculptural in nature – they can be conceptual, performance oriented, or through painting or photography, but they must have a dialog with the space and the rural surroundings.

Through our artist residency program, Habitable Spaces serves as a platform for artists to research the interactions between artistic practice, the shelter in which one is housed, and the methods through which sustenance is obtained. In this way, we expose artists to a lifestyle where sustenance is gained through farming, and a simplicity of life that is dependent on the weather and landscape for productivity.  We also bring the art world into a rural landscape, exposing farmers and ranchers to concepts and cultures that they do not normally have access to.

We hosted our first artists by invitation in the fall of 2012.  These artists built structures and did research on the property throughout the Winter Season.  In subsequent years, Habitable Spaces has been able to invite artists, as well as performers and writers to have residencies at the farm. During their time with us, artists research and create projects that become a permanent part of the larger structure of Habitable Spaces. We hope that through these additions, Habitable Spaces becomes a collectively built sculptural space as well as a live space and sustainable farm.  In this way each project becomes part sculptural, part performance and part an example of sustainable living. 

YOU CAN SUPPORT IN MANY WAYS

There are many ways to support Habitable Spaces.  We always need volunteers to help us with farming, building, and maintenance.  Come on out to the farm and spend a day with us, you will be well fed, and in good company!

sculptural, part performance and part an example of sustainable living.  

    YOU CAN SUPPORT IN MANY WAYS
There are many ways to support Habitable Spaces.  We always need volunteers to help us with farming, building, and maintenance.  Come on out to the farm and spend a day with us, you will be well fed, and in good company!

story:
Remember Our Dead - Deaths in Custody Awareness T-shirts.


Help us to raise the funds to launch the 'Remember Our Dead' Awareness T-shirt. By contributing as little as £4's to the campaign, you'll get a campaign T-shirt - listing the countless deaths at the hands of the authorities.

These T-shirts are designed to help spread awareness among the movement and activists, wearing political slogans and statements is a form of resistance. Movements across the world show solidarity by wearing slogans and symbols throw up by struggles in everyday life and when marching on the streets.

At London Black Revs, we believe we need to introduce more forms of resistance through propaganda, and the space on our bodies is one which is constantly under attack. By showing solidarity with those who have been killed, their families, campaigns and our communities - we can constantly raise awareness through a passive action of just wearing these t shirts. 

These are just the first of a set of resistance t-shirts and jumpers being designed.

We have two designs consisting of 30 names of those killed in police custody on Black or White T Shirts in Small/Medium/Large/X-Large and XX-Large.

This is strictly a non-profit initiative. T-Shirts will be produced at the at-cost price. Those who contribute more can receive multiple colours & sizes. Any extra proceeds will be distributed to the Justice to Sheku Bayor Campaign and his sister, Kadijartu Johnson.

How to choose size and colour: You've left your email as a contact detail. We can only access this when the campaign has reached it's goal. Once this happens we will send you an emailing asking for your size and colour preference(s)!


Credits go to our comrade and designer; Arjun Mahadevan Design






Who Are We & What Have We Done?

Support London Black Revolutionaries!

We are a young, black and political revolutionary and activist organisation that formed in 2014. 

London Black Revs is a self-determined working class URBAN revolutionary and activist organisation. Our principles include anti-racism, anti-sexism, anti-homophobia/transphobia and anti-fascism. 

We engage in campaigns and offensives in all these areas. We are a democratic but militant organisation that fights oppression and exploitation, whether they are social, economic or political issues. 
We combine practical versatility, technology, self-emancipation, militant offensive and defensive direct action and full commitment to the struggle as cornerstones of London Black Revolutionaries. 

Our organisation is for those who see nothing else but struggle and will not settle for anything less than a world rid of oppression and exploitation. We see the struggles of race, class, gender and sexuality bound together and we need to start fighting side by side when it comes to dismantling oppression and exploitation in the everyday lives of working class Black and Asian people. 

We carry out direct actions which are useful to the community and people of London, such as the Concreting over Tesco's Anti Homeless Spikes as an immediate way of achieving our aims, either by economically crippling oppressive groups by shutting places down, or by sabotage/damage. We take time to explore community empowerment and understand that loving ourselves, celebrating our cultures and healing the wounds of colonialism are also imperative in resisting. S

Since our inception, we have organised and carried out several high profile direct actions, protests and vital community campaigns. With your support we can carry out much more!

Why Support Us?


London Black Revs has always been self funded and this is fast becoming an unsustainable approach as we continue to grow in strength and capacity.. but we're all still poor as ever! We will never stop our work to decolonise, organise and resist, but raising these funds will mean much more opportunities and much more action.

We've also got several direct actions lined up, but we need your support to make that happen. With your support, we can acquire equipment we need to make this happen. It will also cover the basics such as printing supplies, leaflets, meeting/travel costs, emergency responses, a homemade PA system, megaphones, radio equipment...

Funding is tantamount to the security of our movement, with just a little bit of funding, our members will be able to take all the precautions and have all the necessary bits and pieces when organising protests, demonstrations or carrying out political direct actions. We try to source most of our needs for free from friends, organisations or the community, but there are some things that we can't avoid! 

We would be able to afford the kit to take greater precautions in more dangerous actions &  be able to offset travel costs for organising meetings, as many who attend are unemployed or on minimum wage.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to our fundraiser, your help and support is still appreciated. We've name-dropped a couple of pieces of equipment that we're in need of. 

If you want to get involved, or just help us reach our goals, please share our fundraiser with as many people as possible, by email, text, or word of mouth. This campaign will last for 60 days and we need the communities support to give us some more fuel! 

Like, Share and Engage with our Facebook Page

Follow us on @LondonBlackRevs

Sign up to our Mailing List

With your help - we're going to change the entire political terrain of this country.

story:
What We Need & What You Get

Exhibitionists Fort Worth is a creative community of which most members are employees of Fort Worth’s celebrated art museums. These institutions have cultivated a creative hub where artists, curators, intellectuals, music makers, writers, trendsetters, and other expressive and enterprising thinkers converge. The employees of these organizations, ranging from gallery attendants to administrators, are surrounded by one of the best free art educations the city has to offer, a setting in which one can be inspired by the masterpieces that grace its walls and the individuals that traverse its spaces

In this spirit, the Exhibitionists have united to present a pop up art and music event highlighting the creative talent connected to employees of Fort Worth’s four art museums. Unprecedented in its scope and displaying the works of over fifty visual artists - all museum employees with diverse artistic backgrounds and degrees of experience - the art exhibition will be on display Saturday, September 26th at Shipping & Receiving, followed by a reception featuring seven performances by local musicians.

What We Need & What You Get

$750 is approximately 25% of the total cost of the event, which includes expenses such as the venue rental, lighting, sound equipment, musical talent, printed materials and installation supplies (the organizers have committed to donating their time and services, collecting no monetary recompense for themselves). Your contribution directly contributes to keeping this event and its art accessible to our community and leaving more resources to support The Art Station - North Texas’ only non-profit agency solely dedicated to providing art therapy services to children and adults.  We think that would be pretty rad, don't you?

The Impact

With this event, we hope to provide an opportunity for the academic exploration of how publicly available art informs Fort Worth’s artistic and creative community; to create an alternative avenue for artists to collaborate and display their work; and to establish new, as well as strengthen existing networks among Fort Worth’s burgeoning creative community. It also seeks to spotlight Fort Worth as a destination for all creatives to live, work, and play. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Exhibitionists understand that sometimes there just aren't the financial resources to contribute.  Other ways to help include the donation of printing services, raffle items, installation supplies, art works for silent auction, and spreading the word about this campaign and the event with your family and friends. Thanks for your help.  We look forward to seeing you on September 26th!

Facebook Event:  https://www.facebook.com/events/1640291379519714/

Questions? Email info [at] exhibitionistsfw.com

story:
The Project

Axayacoatl (say Ah-Shy-ah-co-atul) is a copper Quetzalcoatl head that stands 21' tall and will be displayed at Burning Man 2015. Sinuous copper pipes covered in beaten copper skins form his stylized head. This Aztec feathered serpent god has a translucent warrior in his mouth, made of copper mesh. Participants standing inside the sculpture will move massive levers and wheels to treat those outside to impressive shows of flame effects and interactive lighting elements that will make Axayacoatl's skin glow and ripple. 

Partly funded by an honorarium grant from Burning Man Arts, Axayacoatl needs your support to meet our full budget. Our project is created with completely volunteer labor, so every penny you donate goes to pay for materials, fuel and supplies. 

Axayacoatl is the first part an ongoing project intended to unfold over 5 years. We are about 70% through building the piece.

Our Rewards

Here's where it gets really exciting! We have designed and made really great hand-crafted rewards. We know how important it is to show off your involvement AT burning man, which means we have planned it so that most everything except the hand-built artwork will ship to you before Burning Man. 

 The pendant top!

And since we are already committed to going, your contribution will ensure that we don't go badly into debt to bring the artwork to you this summer, whether or not we reach our goal.

The Team

Firebulb is a rotating team of artists led by Capra J'neva, who designed 2010's Aeolian Pyrophonic Hall, and has helped build numerous other pieces and art cars. She is joined by Marc Rosenthal, an internationally-known lighting designer who has done numerous pieces in Black Rock City, Ron Mathews, a flame effects and pyrotechnics expert who has 20 years experience designing special effects for the film industry. Other team members include co-lead and jeweler Nicole Gagne, interactive controls designer Brett Doar and numerous builders.

Why Axayacoatl?

Axayacoatl means "Mask of the Serpent" in Nahuatl, the ancient tongue spoken by citizens of the Aztec (or more properly, Mexican) civilization that centered in Tenochtitlan, the world's most sophisticated and largest city of its time--when Cortez encountered it in 1519. Capra became obsessed with Mexican culture when studying natural building in Mexico in 2003, where she saw the incredible murals at Cacaxtla and was struck by the magnitude of the civilization hosted on this continent. The parallels between that culture and the art gifting, dance-oriented ritualistic culture of Burning Man are striking. She wanted to bring a piece of Mexico to Burning Man to remind people of our heritage as North Americans, that our activities there are part of the heart and soul of our continent, and to remind us that throughout time the choices we make are what create our civilization and our legacy.

Risks & Challenges

Since we are 70% through our build, we are not worried about finishing the artwork, the centerpiece of this campaign. Our biggest risk for the campaign is finding the time to package all our rewards and get them sent out to you by August 15th. We have already created a substantial number of the rewards. We will do our best to ship everything we can before the event or to meet you on the playa with your rewards, but please be patient with us, because finishing the artwork is our focus.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word! Our own networks are not enough to properly fund our artwork, but together we can reach our goal.

Our team also needs donations of bicycles for the interactive controls, so if you're in LA or San Francisco and have a bicycle (any condition except completely rusted up) to donate, please reach out to us and we'll coordinate an exchange!

story:
The Quesadillo

Welcome to the wild, wild west  where cowboys and armadillos meet at the Quesadillo. This year, what’s a carnival without a snack station? This Queso-llusion will draw you to a complete pit stop with the gift of daytime quesadillas and nighttime live music jams. The Quesadillo is becoming a musical snack haven for Burners anywhere on the playa.

The Quesadillo, a mutant vehicle planned and designed by veteran burners Abe Finkelstein and Kate Zeiger, needs your help to get mobilized for Burning Man 2015. He is currently being transformed from our ordinary golf cart into a shimmering, technicolored, quesadilla-delivering Armadillo in Abe’s backyard in Berkeley, CA.

Our progress...

  • A kick-ass design concept:

  • A fixed-up engine:

  • Construction of the frame and skeleton:


Now, We Need You!

Since it's the Quesadillo's first time heading to the playa, we need help with acquiring build materials, transportation things, and having lots of delicious, gourmet quesadillas to serve to the wandering crowds.

Here’s some of what your help will accomplish:

  • A steel frame platform to expand the quesadilla awesomeness. We are widening the frame of the golf cart to support more weight meaning more shade! more food! and more jams! The frame will extend outward with additional wheels to disperse the weight and add extra room to chill. 

  • A shade canopy supported by an arching rib skeleton of electrical conduit with  purple shade fabric that will make your experience out on the playa more enjoyable.

  • An engine upgrade! To make sure our 'dilla friend is in tip-top shape for the playa, we are fixing up the engine to run more smoothly, changing the belt, and upgrading the headlights for extra light safety. 

  • Power! We are upgrading to a generator to provide the most effective way to play music and lights out on the playa.

Perks

If you can contribute, we have some killer thank-you gifts with our awesome logo:

   

Please check the side bar for the sweet details.

Either way, you can always help us build:

- Abe and Kate are hosting Brunch and Build days in Berkeley every Sunday, and likely more weekday build days as the event gets closer! Come, get involved, share your creativity and/or technical skill, and be awesome company. 

-Like us on Facebook and feel free to spread the word to your friends, family, burner family, coworkers, or WHATEVER, to get them stoked for Burning Man 2015 and all other things that come after that. 

- Come hang out at our fundraiser party Saturday August 15th in Berkeley. Details to come. 

At the Burn

We will be camping with the Belligerent Gap theme camp at 5:45 and Illusion. Our mutant vehicle is equipped with a portable grill and the things for the BEST armadillo-made quesadillas you've ever tasted. We will have daily specials such as:

  • Cheddar Luck Next Time;
  • May the Fontina Be With You;
  • Live Brie or Die Tryin';
  • I've Created a MUENSTER!;
  • The Gouda, The Badda, and the Ugly;
  • I'm Sorry Swiss Jackson;
  • And more!

Stop by for a drink, a 'dilla, and some wild wild west fun!

The Team

This project has come together by the community and inspiration of several individuals. Andrew Barton-Sweeny helped us take our idea from paper to reality with never-ending suggestions about what and how to do things. Mike Godlewski killed it on the logo, making our 'dillo into its own brand. Zach Flowers welding and engineering abilities helped make the car come alive. 
And countless others who have been and will be involved, we thank you!

story:
About Inspirational Plein Air

Hi, my name is Zhanna, I am an artist, student and photographer. I was born in Ukraine, and living now in USA 

I studied at the Dnipropetrovsk Academy of Architecture 2009-2013; finished school of art in Ukraine 2002- 2009.

I study, teaching students to paint and draw, making photoshoots. I have been busy lately, painting and teaching most of the time. It’s hard sometimes, but I’m happier than ever, because I can live life doing what I love to do.

  I have loved painting since I was a child. I am not a great speaker, but I can express whatever I feel, and say it through the paintings.

 I entered academy for major in architecture but I was not one of the best students. I always asked myself, if it`s really what I wanna do, but all the time wasn’t sure about architecture. And opposite for painting, I was sure that I can`t imagine my life without it. It`s like fresh breeze that comes through your lungs. 


 I love painting outdoors much, because it inspires me to create. Every year I am waiting for the good weather to start painting on the air. But always I have some others things to do, like study, job, etc. So this time I want to spend all of my awake time on traveling and painting outdoors during whole 2 month. I called this project  “Inspirational Plein Air”. Plein Air means from French “in the open air” and is particularly used to describe the act of painting outdoors. I have received a piece of attention lately for my paintings, and I am pleased about it. 

 Painting in the Potawatomi Woods, Wheeling, Illinois


The attention I have received has given me the courage to apply for funding, which will be used to support my art, help get all needed materials and stuff. In the end of the Plein Air project you will receive your rewards and I hope the rest paintings give me foundation for my future exhibition. I would like to kindly ask for your interest and support.

How much is needed for this project:

- Paints:

Oil – 200$

Watercolor – 80$

Gouache – 60$

Acrylic – 40$

Paints total – 380$

- Canvas in different sizes – 300$

- Watercolor paper – 60$

- Sketching paper – 30$

- Brushes – 300$

Other materials ( like painting knife, oil solvents, palettes, etc) – 100$

Parking fees and gas for 2 month painting travels – approximately – 600$

Some overnight stay fees – 300$

Total – 2070$


What unique perks you can get?

-   Paper or canvas art print for oil work “ Magic in the Garden”:

   35$  - Small art print on paper signed    



-   60 $ - An art print of one of 5 proposed paintings on paper, signed. Size 8 x 10 inch (“Sunny Day”, “Cantigny Park”, “ Magic in the Garden”, “Wood cabin”, “Rose Garden” )



- “Sunny Day”  ( oil painting in the Chicago Botanic Garden, size 11x14)




- “Cantigny Park” ( oil painting in the Cantigny Park, size 11x14)





- “Wood cabin” ( oil painting in the The Grove National Historic Landmark , size 11x14)




- “Rose Garden”  ( oil painting in the Chicago Botanic Garden, size 11x14)



-  "Millennium Park" ( watercolor painting size 9x12)



You can see more paintings on my facebook page:
Plein Air with Zhanna

Risks and challenges

This is the first project I starting on Indiegogo and it`s exciting and new. And I will do my best to make my backers happy and satisfied

Thank you for sharing this project!
story_txt:
About Inspirational Plein Air
Hi,
my name is Zhanna, I am an artist, student and photographer. I was born in
Ukraine, and living now in USA 
I
studied at the Dnipropetrovsk Academy of Architecture 2009-2013; finished
school of art in Ukraine 2002- 2009.
I study, teaching students to paint and draw, making photoshoots. I have been busy lately, painting and teaching most of the time.
It’s hard sometimes, but I’m happier than ever, because I can live life doing
what I love to do.
 
I have loved painting since I was a child. I am not a great speaker, but I can
express whatever I feel, and say it through the paintings. I entered academy
for major in architecture but I was not one of the best students. I always
asked myself, if it`s really what I wanna do, but all the time wasn’t sure
about architecture. And opposite for painting, I was sure that I can`t imagine
my life without it. It`s like fresh breeze that comes through your lungs. 
 I love painting outdoors much, because it inspires me to create.
Every year I am waiting for the good weather to start painting on the air. But
always I have some others things to do, like study, job, etc. So this time I
want to spend all of my awake time on traveling and painting outdoors during
whole 2 month. I called this project  “Inspirational Plein Air”. Plein Air means from French
“in the open air” and is particularly used to describe the act of painting
outdoors. I have received a piece of attention lately for my paintings, and I
am pleased about it.  Painting in the Potawatomi Woods, Wheeling,
Illinois
The attention I have received has given me the courage to apply for
funding, which will be used to support my art, help get all needed materials
and stuff. In the end of the Plein Air project you will receive your rewards
and I hope the rest paintings give me foundation for my future exhibition. I
would like to kindly ask for your interest and support.
How much is needed for this project:
- Paints:
Oil – 200$
Watercolor – 80$
Gouache – 60$
Acrylic – 40$
Paints total – 380$
- Canvas in different
sizes – 300$
- Watercolor paper – 60$
- Sketching paper – 30$
- Brushes – 300$
Other materials ( like painting knife, oil solvents, palettes, etc) –
100$
Parking fees and gas for 2 month painting travels – approximately – 600$
Some overnight stay fees – 300$
Total – 2070$
What unique perks
you can get?
-   Paper or canvas art print for oil work “ Magic in the Garden”:
   35$  - Small art print on paper
signed    

-   60 $ - An art print of one of 5 proposed paintings on paper, signed.
Size 8 x 10 inch (“Sunny Day”, “Cantigny Park”, “ Magic in the Garden”, “Wood cabin”, “Rose Garden” )
- “Sunny Day”  ( oil painting in the Chicago
Botanic Garden, size 11x14)

- “Cantigny Park” ( oil painting in the Cantigny Park,
size 11x14)
- “Wood cabin” ( oil painting in the The Grove National
Historic Landmark , size 11x14)




- “Rose Garden”  ( oil painting in the Chicago Botanic Garden, size 11x14)



-  "Millennium Park" ( watercolor painting size 9x12)





You can see more paintings on my facebook page:
Plein Air with Zhanna


Risks and challenges


This is the first project I starting on Indiegogo
and it`s exciting and new. And I will do my best to make my backers happy and
satisfied


Thank you for sharing this project!

story: Unfortunately we're not blessed with money but what we do have is eternal LOVE. We're soulmates who want to celebrate our special day with the people we cherish most. Every donation and item sold will help us pay for a memory of a life time.

story:
Summary

Hi! Liam (waverider_) here,

As you know, I have a HUGE passion for what I do, and I love putting a smile on your face with it! I am based in New Zealand, and it is now my time to travel to America to make my dreams come true, further my career, and meet some of you!

This is where I need your help! An opportunity has come up which involves me travelling to the States alongside my friend in August. During this trip I will be having meetings with contacts that will help me grow, attending events that I have always dreamt of being at, doing meet-ups, and doing collabs with other social media lovers!

Ever since I began my Instagram journey, I knew that America is where I needed to take it. I have tried so hard to make this happen myself, but as you know I've been going through a pretty hard time. 

Let's do this together, and I'm looking forward to taking you along with me for the ride.

I will be so grateful for any donations, small or big. Can't wait to talk with you soon.

Love ya.

story:
Background

Over the last 30 years, Pakistan has seen a shrinking space for critical public expression and citizen engagement. Although electronic and social media have expanded the number of voices, still the voice of women, minorities, youth, transgender, labor, farmer, and the poor continue to be marginal in the mainstream discourse, which is but an interplay of few power players. Additionally, increased involvement in the virtual space has been at the expense of real physical citizen engagement.

Introduction

Awami Art Collective is a group of concerned artists, academics and activists, who initially came together to engage citizens in a dialogue on violent extremism through public art. But soon recognized the importance of interlinkages between extremism, culture and development. We understand ‘development’ as a progression rooted in culture and heritage, and thus consider its contemporary implementation which has led to a lack of urbane culture and inequality as nothing but alienation and underdevelopment.

We thus intervene in the public space for the cause of peaceful co-existence, celebration of cultural diversity and inclusive development, while we employ non-hierarchical collaboration as our process of creation. Our aim is to appropriate the relationship between art and activism to generate public discourse as a catalyst for change.

 

Request for Support

We are currently working on two different initiatives: 

1. A Public Art Installation with the theme of displacement and development      Budget: $3,000

The installation will be informed by the 70th anniversary of the independence of Pakistan which led to one of the largest migrations in human history. It will link the past mass displacement with the current (urban) development paradigm, which disregards citizen’s right to shelter and livelihoods, community life and our intangible heritage. Thus questioning the very notions of our freedom and independence by asking: for whom is this development for if it displaces the same communities that had taken shelter here after the chaos of partition?

2. A Book on public art, activism and community engagement     Budget: $5,000

South Asia has a rich tradition of public art which is weaved in our living culture, such as folk songs, truck art etc. However, the practice of public art is often considered a borrowed phenomenon from the West because of a lack of theorization of local practice. Awami Art Collective thus feels the urgent need to document and theorize its experience working in public space to explore how public art is practiced, viewed, and experienced by the community at large. By doing so, we want to initiate a discourse on public art domestically, and inform it at the regional and international level. We also consider this an important step towards bridging the gap between community and art through an analysis of the people’s reflections on public art. The book will include papers by both members & non-members in English and Urdu, and will be designed by the Awami Art Collective.      

Past Initiatives

1. Surkh Gulabaan Dey Mausam Wich Phulaan Dey Rang Kaaley - Black Spring  (2016)

Black Spring is an installation of a 2000m long web of lights that traverses the roofs of old city homes where once Basant (an indigenous kite flying festival) used to be celebrated. This web of lights both laments Basant’s forgotten announcement of the coming of spring, as well as highlights the seizure of Lahore by urban development projects.

The installation took a month to complete in partnership with the Taxali community in the Walled City of Lahore. The choice of Taxali was purposeful because it was the cultural heart of Lahore till its arts of music and dance were practically banned in the 1980s ensuing a slow death of its culture along with increasing the economic hardships for the artist community. The various urban development projects have further marginalized this community, eg. the revamped Manto Park into a gated pristine park took away cricket grounds from the youth. Taxali thus represents Lahore as the very character of this ancient city is now at risk because of the neglect of cultural heritage at the altar of morality and development.

The project was made possible through a crowd funding campaign in which $2,200 were raised. The installation was a success as it got extensive media coverage, which re-started the debate on the banning of Basant, and the government formed a Basant Committee to plan for Safe Basant. 

Media Coverage:

Dawn: Walled City illuminated to remember Basant

Tribune: Missing festivity: Lost charms of Basant

City42: Unique public protest against the ban on Basant

2.  Hum Jo Tareek Rahon Main Maaray Gaey  - We who were Slayed in the Dark Alleys (2015)  

The objective of the installation was to commemorate civilian citizens who had been killed over the last 30 years because of their belief, ideas or profession. It meant to both educate the populace to the extent of belief based violence as well as provide an experience by which citizens could make a self-commitment to not again allow it in their midst.

The installation encompassed a 160 feet circular walkway with 127 different triangular buntings (jhandis), each representing a category of incidence of violence, placed in a chronological order from 1988 – 2015. The walkway culminated into a space inside the circle where a person could light an incense stick and say a prayer for those lost in the violence. The buntings were white in color representing the white part of the Pakistani flag signifying minorities, as a significant portion of those killed did not belong to the majority religious sect or ideology. Each bunting stated the name, date and the ideological reason for the targeted violence.

The installation was the first of its kind public art project in Lahore. It was installed in Bagh-e-Jinnah, one of the oldest and most visited parks of the city, in collaboration with the City District Government of Lahore. It was well received by the citizens, and initiated a debate on public art in Pakistan.

 
Media Coverage:

Tribune: Art exhibition: We who were slayed in the dark alleys

Nation: Using public space for counter terrorism awareness

3. The Takhti March  (2015)

Awami Art Collective created a large Takhti (a traditional writing board) with text from the 1940 Lahore Resolution stating the constitutional guarantees for minorities in the new state while superimposing a pen over Minar-e-Pakistan symbolizing the importance of knowledge, for the country. We were invited by the City District Government of Lahore to participate in the March 23 Azm-Pakistan Rally in Lahore to commemorate the 1940 Lahore Resolution where the demand for Pakistan was first publicly articulated and later the Minar-e-Pakistan monument was resurrected. Members of the collective walked with the float during the rally.

4. Remembering & Protesting the Peshawar Tragedy (2015)

Awami Art Collective tied the innocent marks of resistance against terrorism & extremism on the barbed wires encircling the Punjab Assembly. We had engaged children to make takhtis (traditional writing board) in a public park, with their hand print signifying Stop along with a message to a martyred child.  

Awami Art Collective:

Ammara Khalid Media; Asad Changaizi Artist; Farida Batool Artist; Haider Ali Jan Artist; Marria Khan Artist; Mohsin Shafi Artist; Naira Mushtaq Artist; Rabia Hassan Artist; Raheem ul Haque Activist; Raza Khan Social Activist; Samra Mir Academic; Sehr Jalil Artist; Yasir Azeem Artist;

story:
HELP PRODUCE SONG OF SILENCE, a 12"x 12" hardcover book about the importance and beauty of the mighty element, water.

ABOUT THE BOOK

'Every very living thing on this planet is connected to water' - Ernie Brooks.

No water, no life. We drink it, it makes all green things grow, it covers 71% of the Earth's surface.  SONG OF SILENCE reminds us that the intrinsic beauty of water has an alchemical effect that unifies the planet, on many levels. Personal quotes contributed by many influential personalities will show us how the love of water connects us all. Nobel laureates Jose Ramos-Horta, May-Britt Moser, Sir John B. Gurdon and His Holiness the Dalai Lama contributed their personal impressions and thoughts about the beauty and importance of water to SONG OF SILENCE. And there are more! 

Inventor Dean Kamen, Professor Joan B. Rose (Nowlin Chair in Water Research, Michigan State University, Stockholm Water Prize laureate 2016), Shinto priest Rev. Lawrence Koichi Barrish, TV Chef Wilco Van Herpen, National Geographic photographer Viktor Lyagushkin,  EMMY Award winner Marty Snyderman and photography legend Ernie Brooks are among those who'd contribute their personal words to SONG OF SILENCE.

This is not just another photo book. SONG OF SILENCE is a mission to make arts, science, philosophy and religion working hand in hand to create a positive and inspiring message about something that is greater than all of us: Water.

Please have a look to this short trailer if you like:

 

 

You could be published in my book, too! Just check out my "Honorable Illuminator of the Abyss" perk! 

 

If you like to know more about Song of Silence please kindly check its official website: http://www.songofsilence.com .

Why and for what SONG OF SILENCE needs your support

The photography is complete and final image selections have been made. The photographs are press ready. Now comes the books' layout work, and after that the book will go to print. Offset print of finest quality, of course, Song of Silence deserves the best. We all deserve the best. I've made arrangements with a very fine printer who has won several international awards. 

Song of Silence is scheduled to be officially released in November this year, during the DEMA Show in Orlando/Florida. Thanks to the kindness of X-RAY MAG magazine and its publisher Mr. Peter Symes, I was offered a free spot in their booth to introduce and present my book during DEMA. 

My funding goal is US$ 15.000

My funds raised will be utilized in the following fashion (approximate):

  • Book Production: 75%
  • Pledge Fulfillment: 5%
  • Book Promotion: 20%

After the book is printed and officially released, the journey will be not over. During 2018, Song of Silence will go around the world. Initial promotional stops Include the ADEX Show in Singapore, the BOOT Show in Germany, the annual meeting of the "Friends without Borders" society in Monaco and many more events to come. Please check out http://www.songofsilence.com for further details. 

About me

I am an independent photographer and my specialty is Aquatic Imaging, the art of imaging utilizing water as the key element of expression. In 2012 I won the title World Champion of Underwater Photography and my images were published and featured hundreds of times in magazines and books all around the world. My underwater image series of a submerged "Dakota" aircraft received numerous  awards and earned a place in the "Top 5 Scuba Shots of 2013" at PADI, the worlds biggest scuba training agency.

The past seven years has seen my work exhibited in seven photography art exhibitions. In 2015, I wrote two books about underwater photography for a German dive training agency. In the year 2014 I had the honor to be a lecturer for artistic underwater photography at the SAAR Academy of Fine Arts, Germany.

The first time I used a camera was in 1978. I have been hooked on the art of photography since. In 1996 I discovered scuba-diving and began to shoot images underwater. I have explored the oceans from the surface down to 260 feet, always on the hunt for significant subjects, situations and images. My references are available on my official website http://www.maviphoto.com.

The Team

I am very grateful to have such awesome team!

Maria-Paz is a senior consutlant. She also served as Vize-Mayor of Stockholm.
Seda is a spiritual researcher and photographer. She graduated in environmental engineering.
Michael is a professional photographer and musician. He is also the author of 2 books for Lonely Planet.

What you will receive in return for your support (The PERKS!!)

Each perk comes with a honorable "title". It begins with "A smooth current of positive change" and ends with the very mighty title "Mother Water". A very special perk is the "Honorable Illuminator of the Abyss" as that one comes with the awesome opportunity to have your very own words about water published in the book. Yes, alongside the word contributions of his Holiness the Dalai Lama, Nobel Peace Prize winner Jose Ramos-Horta and many more influental personalities of our planet. To claim this perk means Song of Silence will become your book, too!

The perks 

 

NEW: 'Early Bird, Early Droplet" ( US$ 49 ) - PRE-ORDER

You will receive 1 printed copy of the book. 24% off retail price and free shipping!

"A smooth current of positive change" ( US$ 25 )

You will receive a grateful shout out on the Song of Silence website and its Facebook page, and you'll get a handwritten postcard with one of the books' images right to your mailbox. And you will receive an artful wallpaper for your desktop with one of the images of the book. 

"Rider of the Art Wave" ( US$ 75 )

You will receive a printed copy of Song of Silence, hand-signed and with a few personal words of gratitude to your name. And all of the above.

"A Rock in the Surf" ( US$ 150 )

You will get a hand-signed printed copy of Song of Silence and a hand-signed fine arts print with the books' cover image. And all of the above.

"Aquatic Arts Investor" ( US$ 250 )

You will receive 2 hand-signed printed copies of the book (one for yourself and another to give away), 2 signed fine art prints of the books' cover image, a personal letter of gratitude and your name will be listed in the book as one of the books' most generous supporters.

"Honorable Illuminator of the Abyss" ( US$ 500 )

You'll receive the honor and opportunity to have your very own thoughts about water (what you think about it, what it means to you and why water is important; maximum amount of words 150) published in my book Song of Silence, alongside with the text contributions of some very popular and influental people and visualized by my aquatic imaging arts. This then would make Song of Silence your book, too. 

Furthermore you will receive 2 hand-signed copies of the book, a personal letter of gratitude, 2 fine art prints, an artful wallpaper for your desktop, and of course your name will be listed in the book (and on the book's website, and on social media) as one of the project's most generous supporters, a true Illuminator of the Abyss!

"Master of the Elements" ( US$ 1500 )

After hours of (happy) crying because I am so deeply touched by your generosity, I will do the following for you:

Your very own words about water will be printed and published in my book Song of Silence (please see above for details) and I will dedicate one of the books' images to you, by writing "dedicated to [your name]" below the image (in the book). You will receive a signed fine art print of your dedicated image together with 3 signed copies of the book, a personal letter of gratitude in which I personally thank you for your generous support. 

"Mighty ZEN Master of Aquatic Arts [I am your FATHER!]" ( US$ 2500 )

After days of (happy) crying because I simply can't believe what a great human and supporter of my arts you are, I will do the following for you:

Your personal thoughts about water will be printed in my book and you will receive 5 signed printed copies of Song of Silence. One of my artworks printed in the book will be dedicated to you. You will furthermore receive a signed fine art print of your dedicated image and a package of 25 Greeting Cards ( 5" x 7").

If you happen to run a business or organisation or society that has something to do with water (anything goes, but it must be something with/about water) one full page of the book Song of Silence will be yours. You will have the opportunity to describe/introduce yourself, your business/company, organisation or society alongside with contact details. You can add text and/or graphics/images.

"Mother Water" ( US$ 5000 )

I can't do anything because I am crying all the time!! You are wonderful and you indeed deserve the greatest title: Mother Water (you can be Father Water as well, it does not matter!). 

Your words/thoughts about water will be published in my book. You will receive 10 signed copies of Song of Silence. I will personally deliver your copies to you in person at any place of this world you want that to happen (travel expenses such as airfares and accommodation are sadly excluded). Special giveaway: If you are interested in photography I will do a 1:1 intense photography coaching (3 days) with you, to help you awake the artist inside you. I am known as a very good photography teacher ;-) It makes sense to combine this with my personal delivery of your signed copies of the book as airfares and accommodation are sadly excluded.

You will receive a fine art print of the image I dedicated to you. This print will come with an certificate authenticating that only one single print of this artwork exists in this world. It will exclusive, yours and yours alone.

In case you happen to run a business, society or organisation that is related to the element of water, one full DOUBLE page in my book will be yours. But please understand that for the sake of ethics and our beloved planet earth, it should be something that is good for all waters of this earth. I will only give a double page of my book away when I see that there is something positive behind it.

For more details and insights please check the official website of the book: www.songofsilence.com

Other ways to support this project

  • Use Indiegogo's sharing tools to spread the news about Song of Silence. Let the people know!
  • Like, follow and share Song of Silence on Facebook: Songofsilencebook
  • Follow Song of Silence on Instagram: @song_of_silence_book
  • Follow me on Facebook: rico.besserdich
  • Follow me on Instagram: @ricobesserdich
  • Visit the Song of Silence website, share it with your friends, and use the website's contact form to send me words of motivation : www.songofsilence.com

A final word

I thank you from my heart for your support, may your life be always enlightened by positive spirits. Thank you!

And there are more! Inventor Dean Kamen, Professor Joan B. Rose (Nowlin Chair in Water Research, Michigan State University, Stockholm Water Prize laureate 2016), Shinto priest Rev. Lawrence Koichi Barrish, TV Chef Wilco Van Herpen, National Geographic photographer Viktor Lyagushkin,  EMMY Award winner Marty Snyderman and photography legend Ernie Brooks are among those who'd contribute their personal words to SONG OF SILENCE.This is not just another photo book. SONG OF SILENCE is a mission to make arts, science, philosophy and religion working hand in hand to create a positive and inspiring message about something that is greater than all of us: Water.Please have a look to this short trailer if you like:  You could be published in my book, too! Just check out my "Honorable Illuminator of the Abyss" perk!  If you like to know more about Song of Silence please kindly check its official website: http://www.songofsilence.com .Why and for what SONG OF SILENCE needs your supportThe photography is complete and final image selections have been made. The photographs are press ready. Now comes the books' layout work, and after that the book will go to print. Offset print of finest quality, of course, Song of Silence deserves the best. We all deserve the best. I've made arrangements with a very fine printer who has won several international awards. Song of Silence is scheduled to be officially released in November this year, during the DEMA Show in Orlando/Florida. Thanks to the kindness of X-RAY MAG magazine and its publisher Mr. Peter Symes, I was offered a free spot in their booth to introduce and present my book during DEMA. My funding goal is US$ 15.000My funds raised will be utilized in the following fashion (approximate):
Book Production: 75%
Pledge Fulfillment: 5%
Book Promotion: 20%
After the book is printed and officially released, the journey will be not over. During 2018, Song of Silence will go around the world. Initial promotional stops Include the ADEX Show in Singapore, the BOOT Show in Germany, the annual meeting of the "Friends without Borders" society in Monaco and many more events to come. Please check out http://www.songofsilence.com for further details. About meI am an independent photographer and my specialty is Aquatic Imaging, the art of imaging utilizing water as the key element of expression. In 2012 I won the title World Champion of Underwater Photography and my images were published and featured hundreds of times in magazines and books all around the world. My underwater image series of a submerged "Dakota" aircraft received numerous  awards and earned a place in the "Top 5 Scuba Shots of 2013" at PADI, the worlds biggest scuba training agency.The past seven years has seen my work exhibited in seven photography art exhibitions. In 2015, I wrote two books about underwater photography for a German dive training agency. In the year 2014 I had the honor to be a lecturer for artistic underwater photography at the SAAR Academy of Fine Arts, Germany.The first time I used a camera was in 1978. I have been hooked on the art of photography since. In 1996 I discovered scuba-diving and began to shoot images underwater. I have explored the oceans from the surface down to 260 feet, always on the hunt for significant subjects, situations and images. My references are available on my official website http://www.maviphoto.com.The TeamI am very grateful to have such awesome team!Maria-Paz is a senior consutlant. She also served as Vize-Mayor of Stockholm.Seda is a spiritual researcher and photographer. She graduated in environmental engineering.Michael is a professional photographer and musician. He is also the author of 2 books for Lonely Planet.What you will receive in return for your support (The PERKS!!)Each perk comes with a honorable "title". It begins with "A smooth current of positive change" and ends with the very mighty title "Mother Water". A very special perk is the "Honorable Illuminator of the Abyss" as that one comes with the awesome opportunity to have your very own words about water published in the book. Yes, alongside the word contributions of his Holiness the Dalai Lama, Nobel Peace Prize winner Jose Ramos-Horta and many more influental personalities of our planet. To claim this perk means Song of Silence will become your book, too!The perks  NEW: 'Early Bird, Early Droplet" ( US$ 49 ) - PRE-ORDERYou will receive 1 printed copy of the book. 24% off retail price and free shipping!"A smooth current of positive change" ( US$ 25 )You will receive a grateful shout out on the Song of Silence website and its Facebook page, and you'll get a handwritten postcard with one of the books' images right to your mailbox. And you will receive an artful wallpaper for your desktop with one of the images of the book. "Rider of the Art Wave" ( US$ 75 )You will receive a printed copy of Song of Silence, hand-signed and with a few personal words of gratitude to your name. And all of the above."A Rock in the Surf" ( US$ 150 )You will get a hand-signed printed copy of Song of Silence and a hand-signed fine arts print with the books' cover image. And all of the above."Aquatic Arts Investor" ( US$ 250 )You will receive 2 hand-signed printed copies of the book (one for yourself and another to give away), 2 signed fine art prints of the books' cover image, a personal letter of gratitude and your name will be listed in the book as one of the books' most generous supporters."Honorable Illuminator of the Abyss" ( US$ 500 )You'll receive the honor and opportunity to have your very own thoughts about water (what you think about it, what it means to you and why water is important; maximum amount of words 150) published in my book Song of Silence, alongside with the text contributions of some very popular and influental people and visualized by my aquatic imaging arts. This then would make Song of Silence your book, too. Furthermore you will receive 2 hand-signed copies of the book, a personal letter of gratitude, 2 fine art prints, an artful wallpaper for your desktop, and of course your name will be listed in the book (and on the book's website, and on social media) as one of the project's most generous supporters, a true Illuminator of the Abyss!"Master of the Elements" ( US$ 1500 )After hours of (happy) crying because I am so deeply touched by your generosity, I will do the following for you:Your very own words about water will be printed and published in my book Song of Silence (please see above for details) and I will dedicate one of the books' images to you, by writing "dedicated to [your name]" below the image (in the book). You will receive a signed fine art print of your dedicated image together with 3 signed copies of the book, a personal letter of gratitude in which I personally thank you for your generous support. "Mighty ZEN Master of Aquatic Arts [I am your FATHER!]" ( US$ 2500 )After days of (happy) crying because I simply can't believe what a great human and supporter of my arts you are, I will do the following for you:Your personal thoughts about water will be printed in my book and you will receive 5 signed printed copies of Song of Silence. One of my artworks printed in the book will be dedicated to you. You will furthermore receive a signed fine art print of your dedicated image and a package of 25 Greeting Cards ( 5" x 7").If you happen to run a business or organisation or society that has something to do with water (anything goes, but it must be something with/about water) one full page of the book Song of Silence will be yours. You will have the opportunity to describe/introduce yourself, your business/company, organisation or society alongside with contact details. You can add text and/or graphics/images."Mother Water" ( US$ 5000 )I can't do anything because I am crying all the time!! You are wonderful and you indeed deserve the greatest title: Mother Water (you can be Father Water as well, it does not matter!). Your words/thoughts about water will be published in my book. You will receive 10 signed copies of Song of Silence. I will personally deliver your copies to you in person at any place of this world you want that to happen (travel expenses such as airfares and accommodation are sadly excluded). Special giveaway: If you are interested in photography I will do a 1:1 intense photography coaching (3 days) with you, to help you awake the artist inside you. I am known as a very good photography teacher ;-) It makes sense to combine this with my personal delivery of your signed copies of the book as airfares and accommodation are sadly excluded.You will receive a fine art print of the image I dedicated to you. This print will come with an certificate authenticating that only one single print of this artwork exists in this world. It will exclusive, yours and yours alone.In case you happen to run a business, society or organisation that is related to the element of water, one full DOUBLE page in my book will be yours. But please understand that for the sake of ethics and our beloved planet earth, it should be something that is good for all waters of this earth. I will only give a double page of my book away when I see that there is something positive behind it.For more details and insights please check the official website of the book: www.songofsilence.comOther ways to support this project
Use Indiegogo's sharing tools to spread the news about Song of Silence. Let the people know!
Like, follow and share Song of Silence on Facebook: Songofsilencebook

Follow Song of Silence on Instagram: @song_of_silence_book

Follow me on Facebook: rico.besserdich

Follow me on Instagram: @ricobesserdich

Visit the Song of Silence website, share it with your friends, and use the website's contact form to send me words of motivation : www.songofsilence.com

A final wordI thank you from my heart for your support, may your life be always enlightened by positive spirits. Thank you!

story:
Who I am:

My name is Marcia Paluscsak, I am a 40 year old married mother of 2 girls.  I was diagnosed with bipolar, ocd, social anxiety, and mild agoraphobia when I was 13 years old.  I lived most of my life believing I would not amount to much because of my issues. After high school I tried working several jobs and could never hold one for long unfortunately.  In 2005 I met the man of my dreams and we married in 2007.  He has encouraged me to follow my dreams and is one of my biggest supporters along with our two children.

Jewelry making is something I have done from an early age, I started out as a self therapy and has evolved.  I have gotten more intricate with my patterns and expanded what I make.  My desire is to break the stigma that people with mental illnesses are useless and won't amount to anything.  I want to give others hope and inspiration.
story_txt:
Who I am:
My name is Marcia Paluscsak, I am a 40 year old married mother of 2 girls.  I was diagnosed with bipolar, ocd, social anxiety, and mild agoraphobia when I was 13 years old.  I lived most of my life believing I would not amount to much because of my issues. After high school I tried working several jobs and could never hold one for long unfortunately.  In 2005 I met the man of my dreams and we married in 2007.  He has encouraged me to follow my dreams and is one of my biggest supporters along with our two children.
Jewelry making is something I have done from an early age, I started out as a self therapy and has evolved.  I have gotten more intricate with my patterns and expanded what I make.  My desire is to break the stigma that people with mental illnesses are useless and won't amount to anything.  I want to give others hope and inspiration.

story:
Hello,


My name is Courtney and my husband is an artist. He goes by Pasha Mad. His work started out as a hobby and became more serious when we saw the beauty of the things he made and the amount of enjoyment he got from making them.

His vision for his next project is to make a 5-6 foot tall humanoid with wings made of infinity mirrors. If we reach our funding goal, it will take approximately 6 months to finish.
 
The money will be used to buy materials, tools, and machine parts needed for the project. If a donor is expressly alright with it, we will also use donations for submissions to gallery shows and transporting costs. A small portion will also go to producing the donor gifts.
 
Sculpting is one of the most expensive art disciplines. If you enjoy Pasha's work, please donate. Every little bit helps. We will provide updates so that you can see his progress exclusively. We will also gladly send you a token of our appreciation (see below). Thank you!

$10 - digital high definition picture of the final product
$50 - t-shirt with images of his art and a digital high def picture of the final product
$100 - hoodie with an image of his art and a digital high def picture of the final product
$150 - handmade pendant and a digital high def picture of the final product
$200 - hoodie with an image of his art, handmade pendant and a digital high def picture of the final product
$300+ - handmade pendant, t-shirt and hoodie with an image of his art, and a high def picture of the final product with Pasha's autograph

Please help spread the word!

story:
Help Us Make This Art Installation Come to Life!

*A $30 Contribution Earns An Opening Night Reception Ticket!*

Original works available for pre-purchase! 


POP UP ART SHOW:

EVOLUTION:

A Meditative Installation on the cycle of

Destruction, Regeneration, Rebirth, Reflection.

An interactive, multi-dimensional, installation featuring the art of Amanda Shafran, Rishi Bruke, and other stories of growth. This installation focuses on the forces required for transformation and healing. 

While using the canvas as an opportunity to visually journal the experience of her sensations, Amanda, an artist, costume designer, a Fibromyalgia survivor, soon realized that the act of mapping her body in a sketchbook allowed a visual and mental relationship to develop between her anatomy, and the naturally occurring patterns found in all forms of life. This allowed her mind to relate to the limbs of her body in a new way. Coupled with yoga and therapy, new, unexpected space for amazing neuroplastic growth and healing was created within her body, mind and spirit.

In November 2014, Amanda had a chance to show her work in a one night only installation entitled FasciaFigures at FLOW Physical Therapy in NYC. Here, it was discovered that when seen together, the images themselves tell a story of a continuous pattern of destruction, growth, and transformation. Sharing emotional artwork was an inspiring learning experience, and was direct motivation to investigate further.

Now, We bring you a chance to visit a space where Art and stories of healing are paired with sensory aligning modalities such as music, aromatherapy, and a YOGA  BENEFIT WORKSHOP (donations collected toward Exhale to Inhale, an organization that brings Yoga to trauma survivors)  for a full spectrum, integrative experience. 

This installation is aimed at empowering men & women to reflect on their own stories, and unapologetically face the wisdom of the natural cycles within themselves. By sharing our stories, we heal universal wounds. 

Help Us Make This Art Installation Come to Life!

*A $30 Contribution Earns An Opening Night Reception Ticket!*

 A $50 Contribution Earns A *Limited Edition*  Lotus Print! 

*Original Works Available for Pre-Purchase*


EVENTS: 

OPENING NIGHT RECEPTION - TBD

EXHALE TO INHALE - YOGA WORKSHOP BENEFIT- TBD 


THE TEAM

Producer-  Eyal Dagan

Producer-  Amanda Shafran

PR-   PR4Artists

Exhibition & Lighting-  Anshuman Bhatia


BIO

HI! I’m Amanda Shafran.

I’m an international costume designer, yogi, and artist living on the Upper West Side of Manhattan, with my amazing husband of six years.

I'm originally from Long Island, NY, though I've always been a city girl at heart. I love art, nature, history, yoga, and a good conversation. In college I studied English and Theater. I went on to pursue the language of clothes and construction while getting an M.F.A. in Design for Stage and Film at NYU's Tisch School of the Arts, with a concentration in costume design. There, I spent three years studying illustration, fashion history, clothing construction, drawing & painting, and dramaturgy. I learned how to channel the technical language of color, form, shape, and texture through the lens of a story.

After graduating, a series of assistantships directly after earning my M.F.A prepared me to stand on my own two feet as a designer, but my body began to quickly deteriorate with the hard physical demands of carrying heavy bags of fabric around the clock, while under the tense constriction of unrelenting stress.

It was at this point I learned that I also have Fibromyalgia and PTSD, two complicated neurological and mind/ body disorders that simply didn’t fit into my otherwise on track lifestyle or life plan.

My mind wanted to keep working at warp speed, however I couldn’t change the hard facts of my body. I decided to invest in myself. Somehow, this ended up in finding a way to use my skills with color, form, shape, and texture as a lens to communicate my own story. I devoted everything I had to self-care, ultimately finding healing in a combination of hands on massage treatments, acupuncture, Yoga, Meditation, medication, and journaling to be the ultimate aid on both a physical, psychological, and spiritual level. (And A LOT of therapy!)

Now, in addition to theatrical design, I create drawings and paintings as a lens into my story, with the aim of empowering other women and men to take ownership of and love their own personal minds, bodies, and spirits. I also share what I have learned by teaching private, group, and corporate Yoga & Meditation.

Take a look at www.amandashafran.com


BUDGET

To make this dream manifest in reality, we need your help! 

Space Rental  $1500

PR   $2000

Lighting   $2000

Production   $2000

Events   $2000

TOTAL : $9,500

story:
We need your support -- and no gift is too small.

Pepatian was founded in the South Bronx to support Afro-Caribbean-Latino and/or Bronx-based artists.  www.pepatian.org

Pepatian is a small, 30+ year old arts organization serving local artists and responding to their needs. We offer direct access to audiences eager to know about cutting edge performance happening in community. Pepatian works to raise the visibility of artists on a local, regional and national level. 

Your contribution today supports fabulous Pepatián 2016 projects like: 

BRONX ARTIST NOW: SHOWCASE & CONVERSATION - a network of Bronx arts and community organizations create a unique opportunity for presenters and funders to see a showcase of new work by multiple Afro-Caribbean-Latino- and/or Bronx-based, multi-disciplinary artists.  2016 marks the 6th annual event!

BRONX HIP-HOP ACADEMY - connects local professional teaching artists/entrepreneurs with youth for greater arts enrichment. Artists teach the history and artistry of Hip-Hop at an accessible, grassroots level, and offer workshops in dance, spoken word, visual arts, music that culminate in a final, informal showing. Presented in partnership with BronxWorks (1130 Grand Concourse).  The Hip-Hop Academy began in 2004-05, and 2016 marks over 10 years of this project!

OPEN CALL 2016 - provides free rehearsal space, mentoring and paid performance opportunities for emerging artists of color and/or emerging Bronx-based artists to create new, full-length performance work in contemporary dance and/or movement-based dance theater. Presented in lovely partnership with BAAD!/Bronx Academy of Arts and Dance. Open Call began in 2014, and 2015 was supported with funding from the Jerome Foundation !

Your contribution supports Pepatian’s ability to offer these vital programs that support artists and their skills to reach other artists, youth, and general audiences eager to hear from contemporary Afro-Latino-Caribbean voices. You will be part of the continued growth of the arts scene in the South Bronx!

$1000 will go towards artists fees for the showcase January event, and help stabilize the organization’s work towards setting up the Spring 2016 Hip-Hop Academy and Open Call events!

Other ways you can help: if you are interested in attending our events, please like us on facebook (www.facebook.com/pepatian.southbronx), visit our website (pepatian.org), and/or contact us directly at pepatian@gmail.com

story:
In the beginning, sometimes I left messages in the street

June 1 - June 30, 2016

Curated by Allison Glenn

In the beginning sometimes I left messages in the street is a public art exhibition that couples artists and practices with the materiality of the built environment. 

Through the use of billboards, sculpture, performance, media, and sound, the artists in the exhibition will consider the landscape of Chicago. The brevity of space and opportunities for engagement with the less traversed areas of the city become exciting moments for critical inquiry, site-responsiveness, and the activation of interstitial spaces. In the beginning, sometimes I left messages in the street aims to create a different platform for contemporary art in Chicago that furthers the impact that the arts can have on everyday life, while encouraging viewers to traverse rich and varied expanses of land. 

Participating Artists:

Carris Adams

Lisa Alvarado

The Black Athena Collective (Dawit L. Petros and Heba Y. Amin)

Assaf Evron

Becky Grajeda

Ayanah Moor

Cheryl Pope

Martine Syms

Amanda Williams

The Impact

This multi-sited, public art project is situated in various Chicago neighborhoods: Hyde Park, Garfield Park, Auburn Gresham, West Town, Ukranian Village, Humboldt Park, Near West Side, and Pilsen. The locations were chosen quite deliberately, as the communities are primarily located outside of areas that many would consider cultural centers. Truthfully, many of these neighborhoods are rich with vibrant culture yet are all too often overlooked. This project challenges Chicagoans to engage with the distance that is between the many and varied locales. Public programs like Amanda Williams IT'S A GOLD MINE/IS THE GOLD MINE, an extension of her Color(ed) Theory project, aim to engage residents in the communities that the projects are located by concentrating on the sites/parcels that have been vacated as a result of demolished Color(ed) Theory houses. Williams' primary question is—How can color be used to mark not just property, but the value of the vacant parcels of land as well?

Martine Syms, Cheryl Pope, Lisa Alvarado, Ayanah Moor, Carris Adams, The Black Athena Collective, and Assaf Evron will produce work specifically for billboards in the aforementioned neighborhoods that will be accessible via train, bus, bike, car, and walking. Sound artist Becky Grajeda will create a sound collage accompaniment to the visitor's journey through the exhibition. 

This project has been almost 2 years in the making, and has been supported by a 2015  Propeller Fund (Warhol Foundation), a 2015 Curatorial Fellowship with the City of Chicago Department of Cultural Affairs and Special Events (Joyce Foundation), and is fiscally sponsored by High Concept Labs. We are very grateful for their support and look forward to reaching our fundraising goals. 

What We Need & What You Get 

With regard to site, the scope of this project is broad. Alas, the execution is very succinct. Working with the maps of availability, the goal is to secure 30 Junior Poster locations as installation sites. Junior posters are small billboards used by advertising companies to sell a niche market product. We are looking to raise $7,500 that will go towards the following line items in the budget:

-Production of work for 30 Junior Poster billboards

-Public programming for the opening reception

-Production of the catalog, including commissioning new essays and documenting the installations

-Compensation for the Graphic Designer/Brand Consultant, Alexandria Eregbu

Please follow us on social media and share this campaign!

Instagram.com/messagesinthestreet

and the activation of interstitial spaces. In the beginning, sometimes
I left messages in the street aims to create a
different platform for contemporary art in Chicago that furthers the impact
that the arts can have on everyday life, while encouraging viewers to
traverse rich and varied expanses of land. 
Participating Artists:
Carris Adams
Lisa Alvarado
The Black Athena Collective (Dawit L. Petros and Heba Y. Amin)
Assaf Evron
Becky Grajeda
Ayanah Moor
Cheryl Pope
Martine Syms
Amanda Williams
The Impact

This multi-sited, public art project is situated in various Chicago neighborhoods: Hyde Park, Garfield Park, Auburn Gresham, West Town, Ukranian Village, Humboldt Park, Near West Side, and Pilsen. The locations were chosen quite deliberately, as the communities are primarily located outside of areas that many would consider cultural centers. Truthfully, many of these neighborhoods are rich with vibrant culture yet are all too often overlooked. This project challenges Chicagoans to engage with the distance that is between the many and varied locales. Public programs like Amanda Williams IT'S A GOLD MINE/IS THE GOLD MINE, an extension of her Color(ed) Theory project, aim to engage residents in the communities that the projects are located by concentrating on the sites/parcels that have been vacated as a result of demolished Color(ed) Theory houses. Williams' primary question is—How can color be used to mark not just property, but
the value of the vacant parcels of land as well?
Martine Syms, Cheryl Pope, Lisa Alvarado, Ayanah Moor, Carris Adams, The Black Athena Collective, and Assaf Evron will produce work specifically for billboards in the aforementioned neighborhoods that will be accessible via train, bus, bike, car, and walking. Sound artist Becky Grajeda will create a sound collage accompaniment to the visitor's journey through the exhibition. 
This project has been almost 2 years in the making, and has been supported by a 2015  Propeller Fund (Warhol Foundation), a 2015 Curatorial Fellowship with the City of Chicago Department of Cultural Affairs and Special Events (Joyce Foundation), and is fiscally sponsored by High Concept Labs. We are very grateful for their support and look forward to reaching our fundraising goals. 
What We Need & What You Get 


With regard to site, the scope of this project is broad. Alas, the execution is very succinct. Working with the maps of availability, the goal is to secure 30 Junior Poster locations as installation sites. Junior posters are small billboards used by advertising companies to sell a niche market product. We are looking
     to raise $7,500 that will go towards the following line items in the budget:
-Production of work for 30 Junior Poster billboards
-Public programming for the opening reception
-Production
     of the catalog, including commissioning new essays and documenting the installations
-Compensation for the Graphic Designer/Brand Consultant, Alexandria Eregbu

Please follow us on social media and share this campaign!

Instagram.com/messagesinthestreet

story:
What are the threads that weave through our lives that connect us to place and ultimately to one another?

Community is a thread that has connected me.

I invite you to participate in and support a community weaving project that I am organizing on


January 10th, 2016 in Denver, Colorado


Help create the second generation of Indra's Net

Wall of Women Colorado will be hosting us at Ironton Studios just outside of downtown Denver. We are inviting the greater community of Denver to join us from 12 to 6pm to create Indra's Net as an intentional weaving.

We need everyone to bring a donation of clothing or fabric that can be stripped into lengths of at least 12 inches long for weaving in prayers and thoughts.  We are gathering to support the work being done by Wall of Women Colorado and to support ALL actions on climate change and keeping fossil fuels in the ground.

Together we act to protect the Earth for all our children and all future generations.


Wall of Women Colorado mission statement: 
a group of  people entrusted to protect the earth for future generations. They support the children as they challenge those who choose profit rather then preservation. 

This net woven of knotted fabrics became the first generation of Indra’s Net. It was begun and completed over several years moving through hands and communities from around the globe. Eventually it was hung at the 2011 Bioneers Conference in San Rafael, California.

As we continue with this new incarnation in Denver, we will weave a golden thread throughout the net to represent the kintsugi or “golden repair” that is present when we tend to the wounding of ourselves and of our planet. Repairing the cracks, tending to the wounds, creates strength and resiliency as in the container of Indra's Net where the "jewels" can be found at every node in the net. 

In early August 2015, at the same time that I was planning for this event, I learned of a toxic waste spill from an abandoned mine shaft near Silverton, Colorado. When I first  saw the dramatic aerial views of the winding, golden Animas River, I was devastated and discouraged about the healing potential of Indra's Net. Further consideration and a phone call to a friend and I was reminded that Animas means "soul" ~ the original meaning, the river of lost souls, rio de las animas. 

I often think of the soul of the world and how the creative act of collaboration is an empowering ritual. It is what I mean by weaving the invisible. I deeply believe that the healing power of art and working in the invisible plane leads to healing on this physical plane. 


This golden thread will honor the work being done to support the continued healing of the Animas River in western Colorado. 

"Ritual creates a second flow of events ~ and we can enter that stream or not, as we wish. The idea of ritual is strange to our ears; it says that if something is healed in the other world, something is healed in this world also..." ~ Robert Bly

Please join us and contribute to this creative act. There are different ways to participate.

Be in Denver on the 10th and bring materials! Ironton Studios on January 10th

Show your support for artists, activists, and everyone dedicated to acts of recognition and healing for the planet. Please support this campaign and  send your wishes, prayers, and meditations so that we can gather materials and weave this net. See the perks associated with each financial donation and how any gift you can give will lead to a variety of other gifts directly related to the making of Indra's Net.

"Animas River kintsugi", 2015, 18"x24" acrylic paint and encaustic on board . Original painting by Debra Goldman ~ highest quality reproductions available through donations see perks.


Budget

I would like to raise a minimum of $3,000  

Artist Fee Debra ~  $750. 

Artist Fee Olivia ~   $250

Event expenses ~ $1,000

some fiber materials donated by participants

Translation fees ~ e.g. Credit Card fees, campaign admin

To offset production costs & perks ~ $1,000

Please know that you are participating in creating a permanent work for Wall of Women Colorado, supporting an entire community of all ages through art and engagement, and strengthening efforts to gather and focus on healing all over the world.

Donation to Wall of Women Colorado ~ completed Indra's Net value@ $3,000

All funds raised above and beyond this goal will be used to generate documentation and distribution of the day’s events, reproductions in digital giclee prints, an artists' book to accompany future community net events and a book to be reproduced that will include photographs and documentation of the prayers and thoughts donated to the project.

Campaign Sharing Helps
Please use your social media to help. Share widely - email friends, family, and supporting community. Go ahead and use the handy Indigogo share tools. This net is a manifestation of our connections, please ask yours to join ours!

Thank you so much and we hope to see many of you in Colorado!
