story:
____________________
Alma Mater matters.

We are all proud of our school (Especially when it is the premier university of the land. Ahem.)
We cheer the feats of its scholars and alumni, rally with fervor behind its sports teams and heroes, stick emblems and decals on our notebooks, gates and cars. And of course, display their marks on wearables like jackets, pullovers, caps and tees.

_________________

Tee talk.

The commonplace tee shirt can be more than just a plain utilitarian piece of clothing. Tees have become a statement, a bold, ubiquitous medium of creative expression accessible to everyone who has a message to send out. And with the available technology in garment printing, the tee can now be a canvas of endless graphic possibilities and legitimate pop art.

_________________

Peyups Pride worn in style.

Most school tees are actually mere labels-- school name in text that labels the wearer of their school affiliation. 

Peyups Pride tees are graphic tees. Graphic tees that are visually rich and evocative. They deliver the message with style and soul. And just like the Peyups spirit—may kabuluhan at astig. 

_______________

Help us make it happen.

Giving the idea a big push.
Right now PeyupsPride is at its concept stage. Many prototypes have been produced and given out to friends. Our ultimate objective is to launch these as products and make them available in the market. This crowd funding campaign is a crucial stage towards that goal. If we succeed here, PeyupsPride will finally come to be.

Giving back to the alma mater.
If we raise the target amount of this campaign, Php 100,000 of this will automatically go to UP. This is out of respect for its intellectual property rights. UP holds copyrights to symbols, marks, and all content trademarked to the university. We respect that.

I learned about franchising and the licensing fee during my initial discussions with their IP personnel. Frankly, I was not much into the business of this since this started more as a creative venture so I took a pause. I weighed the franchise fee--quite a considerable amount-- and its impact on the viability of project considering that this really started as a hobby.  And for almost a year now, this project had been dormant, held back by that franchising cost. Until it occurred to me that this might not be a stumbling block after all but a road map to the goal.
 

Giving the Peyups community a part in the journey.
The heart of this enterprise is the Peyups spirit. And this spirit is best expressed when shared by its very community. So why not involve the UP family to carry this dream project to fruition?

I have decided to do so. And here I am at Indiegogo, one of the most successful crowd-funding sites in the web and the only major platform that allows projects from the Philippines. Through this Indiegogo campaign I am reaching out to you, fellow Peyups. By doing so I hope to have a feel of the community. And the pledges of support from you will be a generous affirmation that we all share the vision.

_________________

Not a dole out. It's "win-win" for all.

This is a crowd-funding campaign so funds will necessarily be involved. But while supporters are asked to send in monetary pledges they won’t be donation nor charity contribution. There's a quid pro quo. It is because you, the pledgers, will be getting something back that is certainly worth every cent you contribute. Everybody wins.

UP wins 
If this campaign succeeds, PeyupsPride will go into full production mode. And UP will be a major beneficiary of the endeavor. For one, the Peyups community will be offered unique, artful, thought-provoking wearables and pride pieces worthy of UP's original and trailblazing spirit. And on top of that, UP will be financially rewarded as 10% of every PeyupsPride sale will be remitted to the university. Big win for the alma mater.

Isko wins
One of the very first programs that PeyupsPride will launch once it starts operation is to bring the Iskolar ng Bayan into the enterprise. The PeyupsPride Iskollection,  a special design collection will be opened featuring art creations submitted by current UP students nationwide. Creators of selected designs will receive profit share from sales of products that shall feature their work. May dagdag allowance o pang-tuition si Isko. Panalo.

_________

Perks.

There two ways a supporter can contribute-- by clicking BACK IT button above and entering the amount or by availing of the Perks (right sidebar). Perks are "thank you" items for specific amount of contributions.


The PeyupsPride campaign will accept and appreciate any monetary pledge but offers Perks to amounts of Php 500, Php 750 and Php 1500(equivalent to USD figures in this site since Indiegogo does not use Php currency yet). Pledges of these amounts are rewarded a Perk or a token of appreciation for the support (see Perks section on the right sidebar). Peyups Pride will be producing the Founding Edition RoyalTee and matching Cup 'O Tee from the current full line of designs (gallery found here). Perks will consist of these eye-catching conversation-piece items and guaranteed collector-grade commemorative mementos. Definitely worth as much or maybe more than the pledged amount.

Backers may choose multiple Perks.

TO SEND REQUEST FOR PERK/s please fill up form here. Submit request for each Perk you availed. Thank you!

NOTE: PeyupsPride Perks are tokens for support of the campaign. They can be passed on as gifts but not to be sold.

________________

The PeyupsPride Art Gallery


To date, I have created more than 30 designs ready for rendering on PeyupsPride RoyalTee and Cup 'O Tee. The collection will definitely grow and I hope to share the new creations with you. And not just on tees but on many more wearable, usable, collectible PeyupsPride mementos. See the current gallery here.

 

_________________

The QR code stamp. 

A special customizable QR code stamp will be printed on the back side of every Founding Edition Royaltee. It will contain the Founding Member tag, name, college, course and batch year of the backer or of the person who'll receive the shirt. Other details may be added per backer's request.

QR codes can be read using a code reader device or any scanning app that can be installed on mobile phones. Try installing Bakodo from the App Store and scan the code above to see the embedded data. QR code- It's Qool!

_________________

The PeyupsPride Founding Member Card.

Every backer with Php 500 minimum contribution or Perk availment will receive this PeyupsPride Founding Member card. They will be sent out after the successful completion of this campaign after which the PeyupsPride organization will be officially set up.

________________

Target fund.

We have set Php 250,000 (5,150 USD) as the campaign target. As explained earlier, the goal of this crowd-funding campaign is to raise funds for the UP licensing fee. That amount is Php 100,000. The target fund shall cover the Indiegogo percentage fee for hosting the campaign and production cost of the Perks. If we raise Php 250,000, the remainder fund (after the Indiegogo fee and Perk costs) will be used to produce initial inventory ready for the market as soon as the UP franchise is obtained. By then it will be all system go, encouraged by your support that took us to our goal. We will be up and running. PeyupsPride shall then be officially born!

________________

The PeyupsPride Founding Team.

__________________________________________
PeyupsPride Founder / Owner /Creative Director

Henry Lopez  
Creative Director, 3rdWave Corp./ Software Instructor, Phil Center for Creative Imaging/ Video Producer+Director /Scriptwriter / App Developer
BS Statistics, 1980, UP Diliman 

_________________
PeyupsPride Founding Partners

  • James Dennis Gumpal
    Chief Legal Officer, UP Manila, 
    BS Zoology, UP DIliman
    Medicine,  UP PGH
    Law, UP DIliman
     
  • Jovy Taule
    PLDT Corp,
    BS Statistics, 1980, UP Diliman

___________________
Founding Advisory Partners 

  • Meldin Al Roy
    Group Chief Financial Officer, Phil Transmarine Corp.
    BS Economics, 1977, UP Diliman
    MBA, UP Diliman, 1982
     
  • Juan  Sarmiento
    Senior Desk Editor, Phil Daily Inquirer
    BS Statistics, 1980, UP Diliman
     
  • Jonathan Perez
    Head, OPD Dental, Phil Heart Center 
    BS Biology, 1977, UP DIliman
    DMD, 1981, UP Dentistry, Manila
  • Julius Gabay,
    ICT Systems Analyst, Tampa, FL, USA
    BS Statistics, 1980, UP Diliman

__________________________
To infini-tee and beyond.

To those who do or shall invest their faith on the idea, we promise you that we will keep PeyupsPride alive in many other forms and design directions. It won’t end with the tee. We have our eyes on a lot more innovative articles worthy of the PeyupsPride mark and the style and spirit of a true Peyups. The RoyalTee is just the beginning. There are way more exciting possibilities out there and beyond. Let’s make it happen!

_________________

We'd like to hear from you!

PeyupsPride@gmail.com
http://PeyupsPride.org
https://www.facebook.com/peyups.pride.org
https://twitter.com/PeyupsPrideOrg

We respect that.I learned about franchising and the licensing fee during my initial discussions with their IP personnel. Frankly, I was not much into the business of this since this started more as a creative venture so I took a pause. I weighed the franchise fee--quite a considerable amount-- and its impact on the viability of project considering that this really started as a hobby.  And for almost a year now, this project had been dormant, held back by that franchising cost. Until it occurred to me that this might not be a stumbling block after all but a road map to the goal. Giving the Peyups community a part in the journey.The heart of this enterprise is the Peyups spirit. And this spirit is best expressed when shared by its very community. So why not involve the UP family to carry this dream project to fruition?I have decided to do so. And here I am at Indiegogo, one of the most successful crowd-funding sites in the web and the only major platform that allows projects from the Philippines. Through this Indiegogo campaign I am reaching out to you, fellow Peyups. By doing so I hope to have a feel of the community. And the pledges of support from you will be a generous affirmation that we all share the vision._________________Not a dole out. It's "win-win" for all.This is a crowd-funding campaign so funds will necessarily be involved. But while supporters are asked to send in monetary pledges they won’t be donation nor charity contribution. There's a quid pro quo. It is because you, the pledgers, will be getting something back that is certainly worth every cent you contribute. Everybody wins.UP wins If this campaign succeeds, PeyupsPride will go into full production mode. And UP will be a major beneficiary of the endeavor. For one, the Peyups community will be offered unique, artful, thought-provoking wearables and pride pieces worthy of UP's original and trailblazing spirit. And on top of that, UP will be financially rewarded as 10% of every PeyupsPride sale will be remitted to the university. Big win for the alma mater.Isko winsOne of the very first programs that PeyupsPride will launch once it starts operation is to bring the Iskolar ng Bayan into the enterprise. The PeyupsPride Iskollection,  a special design collection will be opened featuring art creations submitted by current UP students nationwide. Creators of selected designs will receive profit share from sales of products that shall feature their work. May dagdag allowance o pang-tuition si Isko. Panalo._________Perks.There two ways a supporter can contribute-- by clicking BACK IT button above and entering the amount or by availing of the Perks (right sidebar). Perks are "thank you" items for specific amount of contributions.The PeyupsPride campaign will accept and appreciate any monetary pledge but offers Perks to amounts of Php 500, Php 750 and Php 1500(equivalent to USD figures in this site since Indiegogo does not use Php currency yet). Pledges of these amounts are rewarded a Perk or a token of appreciation for the support (see Perks section on the right sidebar). Peyups Pride will be producing the Founding Edition RoyalTee and matching Cup 'O Tee from the current full line of designs (gallery found here). Perks will consist of these eye-catching conversation-piece items and guaranteed collector-grade commemorative mementos. Definitely worth as much or maybe more than the pledged amount.Backers may choose multiple Perks.TO SEND REQUEST FOR PERK/s please fill up form here. Submit request for each Perk you availed. Thank you!NOTE: PeyupsPride Perks are tokens for support of the campaign. They can be passed on as gifts but not to be sold.________________The PeyupsPride Art Gallery

To date, I have created more than 30 designs ready for rendering on PeyupsPride RoyalTee and Cup 'O Tee. The collection will definitely grow and I hope to share the new creations with you. And not just on tees but on many more wearable, usable, collectible PeyupsPride mementos. See the current gallery here. _________________The QR code stamp. A special customizable QR code stamp will be printed on the back side of every Founding Edition Royaltee. It will contain the Founding Member tag, name, college, course and batch year of the backer or of the person who'll receive the shirt. Other details may be added per backer's request.QR codes can be read using a code reader device or any scanning app that can be installed on mobile phones. Try installing Bakodo from the App Store and scan the code above to see the embedded data. QR code- It's Qool!_________________The PeyupsPride Founding Member Card.Every backer with Php 500 minimum contribution or Perk availment will receive this PeyupsPride Founding Member card. They will be sent out after the successful completion of this campaign after which the PeyupsPride organization will be officially set up.________________Target fund.We have set Php 250,000 (5,150 USD) as the campaign target. As explained earlier, the goal of this crowd-funding campaign is to raise funds for the UP licensing fee. That amount is Php 100,000. The target fund shall cover the Indiegogo percentage fee for hosting the campaign and production cost of the Perks. If we raise Php 250,000, the remainder fund (after the Indiegogo fee and Perk costs) will be used to produce initial inventory ready for the market as soon as the UP franchise is obtained. By then it will be all system go, encouraged by your support that took us to our goal. We will be up and running. PeyupsPride shall then be officially born!________________The PeyupsPride Founding Team.__________________________________________PeyupsPride Founder / Owner /Creative DirectorHenry Lopez  Creative Director, 3rdWave Corp./ Software Instructor, Phil Center for Creative Imaging/ Video Producer+Director /Scriptwriter / App DeveloperBS Statistics, 1980, UP Diliman _________________PeyupsPride Founding Partners

James Dennis GumpalChief Legal Officer, UP Manila, BS Zoology, UP DIlimanMedicine,  UP PGHLaw, UP DIliman 

Jovy TaulePLDT Corp,BS Statistics, 1980, UP Diliman

___________________Founding Advisory Partners 

Meldin Al RoyGroup Chief Financial Officer, Phil Transmarine Corp.BS Economics, 1977, UP DilimanMBA, UP Diliman, 1982 

Juan  SarmientoSenior Desk Editor, Phil Daily InquirerBS Statistics, 1980, UP Diliman 

Jonathan PerezHead, OPD Dental, Phil Heart Center BS Biology, 1977, UP DIlimanDMD, 1981, UP Dentistry, Manila


Julius Gabay, ICT Systems Analyst, Tampa, FL, USABS Statistics, 1980, UP Diliman
__________________________To infini-tee and beyond.To those who do or shall invest their faith on the idea, we promise you that we will keep PeyupsPride alive in many other forms and design directions. It won’t end with the tee. We have our eyes on a lot more innovative articles worthy of the PeyupsPride mark and the style and spirit of a true Peyups. The RoyalTee is just the beginning. There are way more exciting possibilities out there and beyond. Let’s make it happen!_________________We'd like to hear from you!PeyupsPride@gmail.comhttp://PeyupsPride.orghttps://www.facebook.com/peyups.pride.orghttps://twitter.com/PeyupsPrideOrg

story:
A Piggy Ƀank for the 21st Century

A modern twist to a classic childhood gift

  • Tecnology, Art, Design, Nature and Finance come together in a a friendly Bitcoin Piggy Bank
  • Save bitcoin safely and easily
  • Teaches your children about bitcoin and saving
  • Add funds to it any time you want
  • Store the private key (password) inside or securely elsewhere
  • made by makers @MakerSpaceNorth in Ottawa

The Thick Walnut Piggy Bank
$77

The Thin Walnut Piggy Bank
$33


What is Bitcoin?

What is it exactly?

It's a physical piggy bank that lets you store bitcoin in it.

How Big is it?

They are about 9 inches wide and depending on the animal style you choose and wood selection the height and thickness vary. 

Do we create the Bitcoin keys for you? 

If you want we can.  It's safer if you send us the address you would like printed.

Can the Piggy Bank be customized?

Absolutely. We will send out details for customization options. 

Is there any Bitcoin in the Piggy Bank when I get it?

Depends on whether the address you provide to us has Bitcoin in it. 

Why did you make this?

I started this campaign because I wanted to create a Bitcoin Piggy Bank for my daughter Amelia. I wanted to create her something unique that acts as both a toy and a saving account. With it, we can add funds to it whenever we like. It also doubles as an excellent tool in helping people understand Bitcoin and the public/private key relationship.  Thanks to technology like Indiegogo I can offer these to the world and see if others are interested. 

Can they store physical coins?

No. These only store Bitcoin and other digital cryptocurrencies. It depends on the type of address you get inscribed. 

What animal designs are available?

We have a template with over 280 animal shapes. If you want something custom we can accommodate. Here is snapshot of all the animals available. 

Are there any good resources to tech my children about Bitcoin?

Yes there are. This is a really simplified explanation of Bitcoin:

http://www.coindesk.com/bitcoin-explained-five-year-old/

Here is a Book series on Bitcoin for Children

http://www.amazon.ca/Bitcoin-Beginner-Kids-Trilogy-Book-ebook/dp/B00GG0AQOI?ie=UTF8&*Version*=1&*entries*=0

HOW ITS MADE

story:
Wearable Art

Fashion show with unconventional materials :

  • Been doing wearable art show for over 10 years. 
  • The shows we do raise money for Art education at a local Art Center.
  • Helping us reach our goal, helps up to expand on what we have already created.
  • Everyone loves balloons. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We funds to house out of town Balloon Artists. We have artist that come from out of state to help with the fashion show.

  • We need to feed people for 3 days.

  • A money offering would offset gas and potential work Artist gave up to come.

  • Join me in making the world a bit brighter with amazing balloon Art. 

  • What is in it for you? Glad you asked
  • Incentives will be a coffee table book of the event with professional photos in it, Postcards, T-shirts and knowing your helping artist make the world a bit brighter.

The Impact

Year after year we go bigger and bolder with the fashion. Eventually we want to go to the world stage and do the Wearable Art Show in New Zealand!!

Been doing wearable art show for over 10 years.

We need to feed people for 3 days.
A money offering would offset gas and potential work Artist gave up to come.
Join me in making the world a bit brighter with amazing balloon Art.

Incentives will be a coffee table book of the event with professional photos in it, Postcards, T-shirts and knowing your helping artist make the world a bit brighter.


The Impact
Year after year we go bigger and bolder with the fashion. Eventually we want to go to the world stage and do the Wearable Art Show in New Zealand!!

story:
Short Summary

The Westmoreland Museum of American Art and the City of Greensburg have partnered on Bridging the Gap, a public art project to revitalize the North Main Street bridge that connects The Westmoreland to downtown Greensburg. The Museum sits at the top of a hill reached by this functional but unsightly bridge, creating a desolate barrier between The Academy Hill neighborhood and downtown Greensburg. 

Working with the Pittsburgh Office of Public Art and an Artist Selection Panel comprised of local residents, Museum staff and representatives of the City considered dozens of artists for the commission.  In the end, Janet Zweig was selected to design and create the public art project.  Zweig has been working in the public art realm for over 18 years.  She has designed public art installations for the City of Milwaukee, St. Louis, and Kansas City.  Locally, she has successfully collaborated with LaQuatra Bonci Associates Landscape Architecture to build a memorial in the lawn of Pittsburgh's Mellon Park.  

Ms. Zweig’s proposal utilizes both the east and west sides of the North Main Street bridge to ‘bridge the gap’ between the City and the Museum by giving residents and visitors a changing and dynamic cultural experience.

She has proposed fabricating a three-dimensional analog scrolling text that will extend the length of both sides of the bridge, producing an experience of serialized poetry that will slowly unfold over time. The Museum will commission writers, poets, and artists from the western Pennsylvania area to produce poems or essays of a specific length for display on the bridge. As residents and visitors drive or walk across the bridge, they can read an installment of the poem or text, making it an especially appealing site for repeat visits and inspiring curiosity of what will come next. The full text with author credits will be available in the Museum and on thewestmoreland.org/bridging-the-gap.

What We Need & What You Get

Thanks to the NEA's Our Town Grant program, The Community Foundation of Westmoreland County's Revitalizing Westmoreland, and support from the Westmoreland Tourism Grant Program, the design process has been completed.   

Currently, we need to bridge the gap in our funding to complete the fabrication and installation of Ms. Zweig's design.  We hope that you will consider helping us complete the project, which is the greatest benefit of your investment. To thank you for your generosity, we have designed a series of perks that will allow you to take a piece of the project with you!  Please note that there may be slight alterations to the donor perks as we finalize our plans with the commissioned artists. 

If we exceed our $10,000 goal, any additional funds will be used for remaining installation costs and the care and maintenance of the art work. 

The Impact


Greensburg is in the midst of a cultural renaissance. In the span of a few years, there has been a renovation of the historic Palace Theatre, the construction of the new Seton Hill University Performing Arts Center, Seton Hill Visual Arts Center, and the transformation of The Westmoreland Museum of American Art, which recently underwent a major renovation and expansion. As part of the Museum’s expansion, a new green space was added for the community, providing opportunities for the public to gather. Bridging the Gap will serve as an inviting gateway from the Museum into downtown (and vice versa) and will help to invigorate street life, making Greensburg a more inviting and vibrant place for residents and visitors alike.

Stay Connected

  • Visit The Westmoreland and experience the excitement for yourself!
  • Please take a moment and share our campaign on social media!  We are excited to get the word out and truly 'bridge the gap.' 
  • Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter for updates on the status of the project.

story:
Ever since she could hold a crayon, my daughter has delighted in creating art. She loves to draw and paint, and will spend hours doing so. After taking her to public studios that are 30+ miles away, I began to cultivate this idea of a public art studio for our area. This would be a unique addition to our community, one that is greatly needed. Funding for art programs have been cut to the bare minimum, and Paint The Town will fill the gap between public education art classes and creating art for many children. I know that my daughter isn't the only "Picasso in training" in this area!

in addition to providing an independent paint-your-own-art studios, Paint The Town will provide a space for birthday parties and other small group events. There will also be opportunities for local artists to hold individual or group classes, and display their personal artwork.
